after reading so much about how good bar mut was we were very disappointed. the food was good but the service was abysmal. after our initial drink was delivered we felt ignored.  we were there for over an hour before we were able to order food, we weren’t offered wine until after we stopped the waiter from removing the wine glasses from the table (our empty aperitif glasses remained on the table even after plates were cleared), the wine was poured with the label facing away from me and the waite
delicious food in a welcoming pub like atmosphere that belies the intention given to food.  the wait staff was enthusiastic and it was enjoyable to see the cooks at work.

small, intimate and cosy, perfect for a date or even a business meeting. top notch quality, professional service, definitely on the expensive side. basically a menu of refined tapas. we had croquetas, pulpo with parmentier (grilled octopus), pulpollo (octopus on a thin crispy chicken skin layer), canelón. everything really good, but imho the best was the dessert, torrija with (i believe) toffee ice cream, simply delicious!

excellent food!
we did have a bit of trouble understanding the menu, all in catalan - but the waiters did a great job helping.
everything was tasty and well made- would definitely recommend and come back!
the food was stunning! great atmosphere! be prepared to spend a fair amount and the menu is completely in spanish but just trust your nose and gut! 😝

servers were helpful and knowledgeable. seafood was excellent and everything was cooked perfectly. my only complaint was that the counter area is a little small for some of the larger plate rice dishes but still absolutely worth a visit
the egg carpaccio is superb - must have. also, although so simple their tomato bread is great too. service was slightly slow so therefore the 4*s.

bar mut is the best food experience i’ve had in barcelona, and one of the best wine experiences i’ve had in the world. a must do if you’re ever in catalonia and want to try it’s fantastic, unmatched wines.

very dismissive service. i left with out ordering as i was seated in the only available table with little help or explanation and then no one came back to assist. and no notice when i left after sitting outside for considerable time. very disappointing as i’d heard great things about the food but would rather be a patron somewhere where it is appreciated.

had to ask for service and drinks 4 times after sitting for 20 minutes with nothing to eat or drink
food was ok but overpriced.
eaten in a lot of places in barcelona that are a much better experience than this one.

i skipped this place many times due to the reviews here but decided to go on this trip to barcelona and make my own mind. it was the best meal of the trip! yes, the menu is in catalan (i speak spanish but not catalan) but it was explained to me in detail and i was allowed to ask questions. the food was divine, especially the seafood rice. service was attentive and friendly. everyone was getting the same level of attention (irrespective if they spoke spanish or english). it’s not the cheapest but

i am not at all happy with the restaurant, do not see why all the hype. yes, it was busy, yes, seems to be popular and has good reviews, but simply did not work for our party (of 6). what they lack is transparency. yes the meny is there hanging, but there are so many extras that they encourage you to take, but they come at quite a price. also we had the menu explained to us, but that was just so much information to process, not being familiar with the cuisine. the quality of the food did not mer

the lowish rating is definitely not indicative of the quality and taste of this place. it needs to be much higher.

everything was exceptional. from the risotto, croquetas, to the french toast dessert.

one of the best meals i’ve had.
great food in casual well run restaurant - share plates.  service very good too. but you will need to book even on a wet monday night.

bar mut, a tapas bar that should be avoided at all costs, has proven to be an absolute nightmare. my recent visit to this establishment was marred by the relentless attempts of the waiter to rob us of our table, the insatiable demands for exorbitant spending, and the aggressive response to a simple request to split the bill.

from the moment we entered bar mut, we were greeted with an air of hostility. the waiter, whose name i prefer not to mention, seemed determined to intimidate us into submis
perfect restaurant to go to in barcelona. great chef that cook in front of you. fresh seafood. great time.

still a great place after all those years. unfortunately the upstairs bar is now closed - this place was just magic - but downstairs you still get very solid food from friendly people. interesting wine list is a bonus.

good ambience....food was tasty...portions a bit on the "small" side .. a bit touristy for my liking and definitely a little " overpriced"

would i come back? meh...maybe?nothing to complain about....but i've had better in barcelona
lovely wine bar with excellent choice of tapas. the sommelier david will always find a special wien for every taste.
i had dinner there in my first night in barcelona and the food was really tasty and the staffs very kind. i would certainly come back to try some more dishes.

superb!! this place is busy (and for good reason) so please be patient! the “menu” changes every day depending on what is fresh at the market, and the staff was very helpful in describing the menu and giving recommendations. the food and wine were excellent, the space is charming, and all of our servers were friendly and accommodating. highly recommend!
nice place even though expensive. we had a great dinner but dishes were small and expensive. staff was nice too.

visit on 08/11/22 in couple - tourists from belgium. the wine list is perfect, staff friendly and trying to accommodate the clients` requests. the tapas service however is based on oral presentation of the options without any menu or suggestions with the relevant prices. this of course is done on purpose, however it is quite disappointing to have this kind of popular places which can be really nice if it was not the spirit of tourists` swindle. we paid 140 eur for tapas  based on sea food apart

great!  we had reservations at 8 for two people..... then 2 friends showed up.. we were off by 45 min.  we lost our table inside....they didn't skip a beat.... they were never angry or frustrated... they went with the flow.... superb food, wine, hospitality!!!!
the scallops were my favourite dish, perfectly cooked! all the wines we had were very good

don’t trust your reservation in this restaurant, even you have both mail and sms confirmation. i came from another city to have dinner in this bar and they cancelled my reservation one hour in advance. whatever food or other services they might provide, this treatment is not acceptable. if you are not capable to do basics like managing your seats and not making double reservation, quit this job!. barcelona is full of fantastic bars already.

intimate and charming space - eat at bar or tables inside or out. great wine selection by bottle or glass. all items posted on board - no menus to peruse, so challenging to make a decision. all small plates. wait staff will review items for you (must be recited as board listing is only in one language - not your language? too bad), but hearing 12-15 items recited is overwhelming and tough to retain. food mostly excellent, except risotto which was clearly underdone.

it was a very delicious lunch even better than abac.
it deserves a michelin star
must try 👍🏻
one of the best bar in barcelona. i assure you perfect satisfaction, don't miss it.

we loved this place! the servers were very nice and friendly. although there was no octopus left,  everything else was delicious. please do yourselves a favor and try the "the cheese tart" and "the torrija" as the desert. i would recommend that you go.
food was good but it was overpriced. they didn’t have the menu in english or a physical menu for us to take look. you have to memorize what to order and you don’t even see the prices.

bar mut has to be one of the better restaurants in eixample dret. for locals and tourists alike, its a go-to spot, and should be on anyone's rotation. what makes it special is the fact they have no ´carta´ (menu), except a few standby options on the black chalkboard. ask your server what's good and let him (or her) decide for you. they specialise in seafood, so i highly recommend splitting a whole fish between 2-4 people. also amazing are the foie toasts (with or without beef tenderloin) and the

my friend and i just came back from eating, and my friend felt uncomfortable after eating half of it, so she left first and i packed the food she ordered. after i returned to the hotel, my stomach also felt very disgusting. we both vomited and couldn't contact the store by phone. i hope to get a refund through google reviews. it's a terrible experience.
amazing service / well managed place / outstanding local food / locals for locals

seventy barcelona recommended as it was a short walk from the hotel. there was seating outside, but we chose the warm ambiance of eating inside. the interiors ooze a certain barcelona style the is simple, yet ever so stylish. the tapas we had were excellent as was the wine picked by our server. there is a large chalkboard spotlighting the daily dishes. i think we might have tried them all. do not miss the croquettes; mouth watering!

authentic italian spot in barcelona !
the mood and the setup of the restaurant gives you a feel of italy ...
unfortunately i only had coffee and it was great but i’m coming back for food for sure !
✅🍝

very nice environment
some of the dishes are too much expensive for no reason

looked like a nice place to sit down but from the start it was a big dissappointment. they do not have a written menu. they said our employees will explain the dishes verbally. someone explained the dishes in 30 seconds and we could neither understant nor remember what she said and she told us all the meals written on the chalkboard. however, chalkboard was in spanish language which we do not understand. we left when we saw the menu in the hands of the people next to us. would not recommend for

lovely food but what takes away from it is the fact that they do not have a menu.
so usually whatever you’re ordering is at the suggestion of the waiters and without the price being provided.

we ordered a few but needed up paying more than we would have liked.
be prepared to a nice long bill!
pretty good tapas bar. perhaps a bit overpriced, but the food is quite good.

incredibly good food and service in a very cost ambience. and moreover, quality stayed same high level as many years before, which is just great, and finally no pressure of time or shifts. congratulations!
great food, only for fish and seafood lovers.

i give 3 stars because the food was great but really salty! and really!! and there was construction in the building so the vibe was not at its best. there was no menu, which is cool but difficult as non-spanish speaker. vibe inside restaurant is nice. waitresses try to get you out after 2h.

to those complaining (ariane dargent and dargent alexis) about the price of the prawns it should be noted that the current price for local prawns at a fishmonger at most markets in barcelona is 170/kilo. restaurants are in business to sell food at a profit. and when a menu doesn't list a price then you should ask before ordering it rather than complaining after the fact.

this place is a little gem and one of my favorites in barcelona. been going here since 1999. always great!

at first it seems like a good place to sit, the food looked good but we never got to eat it (more on that below). however, this was probably the worst dining experience we had in barcelona.

i should note, we sat down at around 4pm and were not that hungry, and figured we can go for a drink and maybe some small tapas.

after we ordered drinks a waiter sat down at our table (which for one don't mind) and asked if we have any allergies, which is a good thing since my wife has deadly allergies to f

i recommend making reservations, this place will always be packed as the food is excellent and made extra special by our server, maria, who made recommendations on menu and specials. everything was a delight, her recommendations were spot on. definitely a must visit in barcelona.

what an amazing place - the food is delicious, the flavors are exquisite and you can feel the love put behind every dish. the service is very personal and you feel extremely well taken care of. it seams to be a favorite for locals. i can truly recommend this place
food was good but quite expensive for the size of the portions. we left restaurants being hungry because prices were abusive!

booked it based on yelp and google reviews. the server decided not to bring the menu and i went with her recommendations only. the kitchen could only arrange 3 items as it was early in the day and she recommended an item which was ridiculously expensive. no tapas place should ever charge $40 for plate of iberico jamon and never mention that out of the 3 tapas available, this is the most expensive. at least let the people know....don't blind side them; not cool.
great service, amazing food.

love love loved this experience! went here with no reservation our first night in barcelona. they managed to accommodate us even thought they were booked solid (call ahead!). proceeded to bring us amazing wines and food pairings all night. the staff were gracious, accommodating, and all spoke flawless english when they recognized that our spanish was poor. cannot recommend highly enough. just go!

don't go there unless you are spanish/catalan. there is no menu for food/drinks. if you don't speak the language you have to translate what's written on a blackboard or have to wait a staff who speaks english to translate the menu for you. seats inside of the bar was too uncomfortable. a waiter spilt the drink all over my husband's leg and didn't even say sorry. food was okay somewhat tasty however, i agree with previous comments it's pricey for what you get. i gave three stars to ambiance, food

we felt really lucky to get in. our hotel h10 casa mimosa called ahead and reserved a table. we ordered the servers suggestions and all amazing. the scallops were perfectly cooked. the mushrooms were excellent but pricey.

this is a fantastic restaurant. it is not for people who don’t like surprises or who need to see the price of every dish before they buy. none of that will happen.

if you like food, like surprises and are willing to pay for it. this is your place. they do an excellent job with service and the food is spectacular.

this is the only bar i've ever been to where you have to whisper. seriously. it's a bar. there is a huge selection of sub par spirits, but the pours are generous. not sure why this place gets 4.5 stars, but if you want to tie one on fkr less than €10 and enjoy some silence, then this is your place.
superb. very much a locals bar and not a tourist in sight, apart from me... off the beaten track and well worth a visit.
lovely friendly local spot for a beer and game of pool out the back. lots of character 👍
pretty much as old school as it gets. stop by for a beer and say hi to the boss. if you can check the back room... foosball table and nostalgia.
seemed average at first but turned out great. the waiter is a friendly local who gave us endless snacks with our drinks and got to use the pool table to ourselves
lovely vintage bar
awful place awful smell awful service and stuffy air!
very authentic. feels like you go back in time at least 3-4 decades. movie scene material... the owner is a classy guy with top notch service. you just know he's had the place for years.

back-in-time bar.
lovely and very atmospheric.
lovely bartender, cheap price  free crisps, perfecto
lovely and original
stellar place for drinks...old school vibe and extraordinarily cordial bartender.
nice meetup event every thursday to play pool
great vibe ..you enter to another world.love it
real traditional bar of the barrio
cheap beer, handsome owner
best bar ever
fantastic

it is an old-fashioned bar, very curious, it is not something elegant where you go but where you get lost and appear there although honestly after entering and seeing that it looked like a museum from the decade of the 70s and 80s even with even older objects where the the waiter, a super nice and friendly man, invited us to enter a room that he had secluded where we could enjoy the privacy and a lot of antiques. honestly, if you go to the immersa space that is nearby, i recommend that you stop

one of the most cozy and retro corners in all of barcelona! simón, its owner, is a legend and always makes us feel at home. we love every corner, decoration and tile of bar mónaco.and with each drink it offers you a delicious snack, something almost impossible to find in barcelona.great plan for coffee, vermouth or afterwork in the heart of poble nou!
an incredible bar, one of those that no longer exists, just like when it opened in 1973.
simón is a figure, an authentic character. he has been here for 50 years… he has seen everything happen. he has good conversation.
a very special bar, from 1973 and everything is the same!! mr. simon, the owner, is very kind and tells us the anecdotes he has experienced in these 50 years. there are no bars like this!!!!

a bar that makes you travel to the past. served by simón, a man who does not hesitate to treat you like another member of the family. just as the aesthetics suggest, when you enter the place you immerse yourself in a rhythm from another era, where respect and good treatment are common currency. for €2.1 you can have a beer, and simón does not hesitate to buy you potatoes, olives or peanuts, with each beer you order. in addition, the place has a room with a pool, table football and target shooti

it really is an authentic bar! it reminds me a lot of the bar my grandparents had 20 years ago! when i entered it was like going back in time. with the drink you make they put a lid on you. they have pool (the reason i went), they also have foosball and a diana!! we had a great afternoon! there are usually not many people and that makes it very quiet, ensuring that billiards, table football or the dartboard are free. the owner is very friendly. we will return to the bar for sure! 😍
a great discovery in poblenou!! super authentic, you feel like time doesn't pass, we will be back for sure 👏🏽✨❤️
simon and his bar is something unique in poblenou! much more than recommended..
a classic with magic. david lynch in poblenou. simón is a perfect host.

a cozy and unique place, one of those that no longer exists. simón makes you feel at home, you are one more there. it is difficult to find places like this, it has a special charm. it is a place where you will feel comfortable and have a pleasant and entertaining time.the bar has a retro style, authentic to the period. it is a hygienic place and it is not a place where there are many people.it is perfect!

we have been very comfortable, both for the possibility of playing dartboard and billiards in very good condition, and for the delicious and well-priced food. a 10 for the very varied background music and the attention of the staff. quiet place to be with lifelong friends

it's like a bar to travel back in time with vibes from the 70s, they serve you beer with tapas, it has a very cool lounge concept in the back, ideal for an after work. the owner simón provides excellent, super nice attention. i recommend it !!!
i have known it for a long time, a wonderful old bar to spend a quiet time, very normal prices, the owner always attentive, friendly and above all a very trustworthy person.
a traditional bar, where they serve you with kindness and accompany you with your beers just as the other messages say.
super picturesque place, i really liked the aesthetics.i just had something that i don't know what it's like, but i'll have to try it someday.
there are very few places left as emblematic as this one.pleasant atmosphere, authentic decoration from the 70s and 80sindoor premises.worth visiting.

an emblematic place in the neighborhood that has experienced its evolution over the years. the owner is charming and likes to tell the history of the neighborhood from his own experience in the hospitality industry.
an authentic bar, the boss a master! free of tourists and if you're lucky you can see carlitos alcántara running down the hallway. paradise on earth
an authentic bar, the boss a master! free of tourists and if you're lucky you can see carlitos alcántara running down the hallway. paradise on earth
quiet place with excellent service, we will definitely return, thank you
the place is a small gem that no longer exists, old and original. and the owner is a 10 person. how few places and people like that are left.long live the bar and the owner!
it's a club for those who have a hobby, it's like suddenly entering the 60s. it's so tacky it's cool! it also has table football and billiards in a back room where it is very quiet.
good place to have a beer, coffee or soft drink.with more than 45 years in the neighborhood.the owner, simón, a symbol at the head of monaco
the bar is like going back to the 70s...the owner of the bar is great, polite, professional and if you want to have a good conversation with a nice person, don't hesitate to start it
good treatment and atmosphere, to recommend and return
if you want to grow, talk to simón, he has history. i wait for you
charming place with a classic bar. very clean and well maintained. the waiter is very friendly and approachable.
super authentic bar, super attentive man, very friendly
if you are a lover of nostalgia, this is your place! simón, its owner, is an excellent professional and charming ♥️
a traditional and simple bar to drink honestly and play pool.eye! they close around 3pm for siesta.
ideal for returning to the poblenou of yesteryear. a peaceful place full of old memories of youth
a bar from before. when you enter you go back 30 years. they have estrella galicia and they always have some appetizer (olives, potatoes, peanuts....)
the place is not bad, the bad thing is that the table football is tilted and some of the darts are damaged.
extinct species, good treatment, good price.... thank you for existing
very good atmosphere, and charming bosses. a timeless place
old bar, in every sense of the word. simón, the waiter, is a professional.
it's a pretty old bar, from a lifetime. ideal for a beer and a game of pool or foosball.
the oldest bar in poblenou...roots
the poblenou bar, perfect for a beer with "pispejos". a bath of reality in the midst of the gentrification of the neighborhood.
i have never been treated so badly anywhere
long-established bar with a lot of tradition. the "boss" depending on how friendly he is can be good company.
attention to the moment and everything of great quality
bar in the poblenou area, very authentic because of the care of the 80s, friendly and cordial treatment
a bar from before, with its disorderly order and its working-class and popular style. there are fewer and fewer
the best bar in poblenou!!! historical. and with the best attention from simon
attention to the moment and great service in general
it's a vintage bar in poble nou. very friendly
very peculiar and interesting
if you want to go back in time... you can go.
i spent a wonderful afternoon with a japanese player in a 60's bar. thank you all for not going.
i spent a wonderful afternoon with a japanese player in a 60's bar. thank you all for not going.
compadres, if one day i go to heaven... i hope it is like that.... :-p
authentic, really. seventies with billiards and table football. adorable.
great service and friendly staff it's clean
highly recommended, deal of 10
heritage of poblenou 💯
i have an addiction to this bar, back to the 70's
an authentic and traditional bar.
the best bar in poblenou
nice bar, friendly bartender, recommend it
simon the owner is a crack!!!
helpful and attentive staff.
a great place to stop for a drink and some tasty bar food. sit inside or out and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere. staff are friendly and helpful.
eat like a local. very delicious food.

after waiting 15 min to be attended, i turn on my computer in the meantime i was having the coffee and breakfast (reading mails, the same like you can do with your phone). later, after 10-15min i was advised that the boss doesn't allow to use computers in the bar... he invited me to leave.
so, very bad service and treatment.
the waiters sometimes dont allow you sometimes to stay with your pc there. they ask u leave if u seat there
brilliant to sit outside when sunny. conveniently located. good service. large assortment of acceptable snacks and simple food. price ok. nothing grand but pleasant enough

“here it is forbidden to open a notebook while having a drink!!” told the waitress, so since i needed to check my mails, i went inside to pay my drinks and to go to another place. when i asked if they were serious about their “normas de la casa”, the reaction of a mean looking bartender was nearly agressive. they neither worry a lot about hygiene. it’s not very clean over there.

amazing food if you're traveling through barcelona this is the place to go. the son of the owner is one of the kindest, most helpful waiters i've ever had. you will be taken care of. and the bravas at the best in town period.
nice tapas bar with a sunny terrace next to the gracia fgc station.

intended to have a quick coffee, but that wasn't to be the case ...
ten minutes to caught the attention of the indifferent waiter and another twenty to wait for the bill. and that in a half full terrace...
in the end i had to go inside to pay and wait there for another ten minutes.
place is only saved by its location...

took a table with my spanish gf on an almost full terrace with people drinking inside. bear in mind i live in bcn, i went to order a beer and a wine (in spanish) and just got no. no to a beer? si, no cerveza. no to a wine? si, no wine. no to all drinks. si, no to all. disgusting.

i do not know if it was because i'm an englishman speaking spanish. but very unwelcoming, and a place to avoid. i would advise not to drink here unless your obviously spanish!
for such a location, the service and cleanliness could be much better
the bar does not have any personality whatsoever but the location is great and the croissants good.
the service fine, but i can't believe that they have 3 different prices depending where you take sit to eat
good service, nice streetside terrace to watch the world go by with a coffee and a beer.
simple but good location​ next to the train station. fast service
normal bar but well located and atractive prices
best terrasse bar around.
it is just for having some drinks. but the tapas are really bored...
perfect breakfast! tasty food!
place for having a coffee next to fgc station
normal

typical bar very well located with a variety of tapas, mixed dishes, sandwiches, etc…the right food to get by.the service, i think we would need some more waiters, since the waitress who was there at that time (night), no matter how hard she tries, is not enough.

i went to have breakfast, their french omelet sandwich was very good, the bread was crusty.fast and friendly attention.the atmosphere is that of a traditional bar, the space could be used much better with a small renovation😜

we have been waiting for about 20 minutes to order and it took another 15 minutes for them to bring 3 drinks and some olives. if you are in a hurry this is not your place. the waiter does not hold back at all, he has come 4 times to remind us that we had ordered.

i came twice. the first, i waited a long time (i don't remember how long), and i received one of the best tortillas i have ever tasted. i forgave them.the second, i had to wait 45 minutes for a sandwich and coffee, unacceptable.the waiter is very available and capable, the problem is that he is completely alone. don't be stingy and hire other waiters

hello, it was the second time because it is close to rehabilitation and they have a nice terrace with a lot of sun. i ordered a tortilla sandwich and coca-cola. the girl brought me a small coca-cola from cubata. i asked her if she has a large one. she answered that she already opened it and that the drinks would be gone. in front of the client, the girl got angry and i had to warn him 🤦‍♀️and she screamed at me! from there he brings me a sandwich without napkins, i call him several times withou

we had a couple of beers and a potato omelette sandwich that was amazing. the bathroom was very dirty (piece of poop on the floor, juggling to be able to pee without stepping on it) but they are forgiven because they were very nice.

they told us that we couldn't be on the computer while we drank beer (they didn't give any reason, it was just the bar rules) and they told us that they weren't going to serve the beers while we had the computer. ridiculous. the waitress says, “this is not a library.” i can't use my cell phone either then? if it was a matter of time, it was to have a beer and leave. the waitress is unfriendly.
great place, a usual place. delicious omelet, meatballs and chicken in the same way. totally recommended

neighborhood bar that does not disappoint!! the owner is amazing and so is the group that works there. the food is 10! highly recommend the potato omelette, the meatballs and the garlic chicken!i go to eat there every week!a site of 10!
awful,cold croquettes, reheated potatoes from the day before.we asked for the croquettes to be heated and they heated them in the microwave, you know how they turned out. total disgust

i've been waiting on the terrace for 10 minutes and no one has helped me. i had to go inside to order and it took 10 more minutes. there weren't enough people to wait that long. in total 20 minutes for a coffee. i hope they improve the service because it seemed very bad to me.

they have kicked us off the terrace because we have not consumed "enough" for them. they told us that renting the terrace was very expensive and for what we had consumed they couldn't afford it! sorry? i am a client and i believe that i have the right to be able to have a drink with a friend for as long as necessary. i mean.
very nice place to have some tapas on the terrace, where the sun is warm. the tortilla skewer, very good and generous. the waiter very friendly. the cleanliness of the toilets can improve.
it's not worth it. there are hundreds of better places in the area. in la pubilla you will eat fantastic food and if you want a better terrace, go to plaça de la vila or plaça del sol
the tortilla is spectacular and the price is very cheap. the terrace is great for having some peace and quiet. the service was very pleasant from the two waiters.
i ordered a coffee, i had to go inside because there was no room on the terrace, when i found a free table i went out and sat down, they made me pay 30 cents more, i will never return..
the coffee was goodthey charged me quicklythe sun was shining on the terrace
everything they sell to eat is delicious! the staff is always very friendly and the terrace is very cozy.
very friendly staff and correct service, but exorbitant price, €3,05 a glass of beer on the terrace. if it's not necessary, i won't go back.

outrageous. very bad treatment. unbearable and very dirty waiters. the drinks arrive with the ice melted. one of the worst places i have been in my life. we were a large group and they didn't let us be together.
the coffee a little burnt. the croissant is very good. the terrace is super nice in the morning because the sun shines. if you don't consume for a while they try to kick you out.
the waiter this morning (monday) had terrible service, and very expensive prices..
i can't give zero stars, service is so bad, unpleasant, it was completely empty and they didn't let me sit down

[excuse the spelling mistakes, it is long and i used voice dictator.encouragement collection of neighborhood signatures in the [closure of this bar] people work who mess the good image of the neighborhood.change of waiters as for me the blonde and the brunette.or closing the bar. due to a bad image in an elegant and familiar area as it issarria-via agusta.it is urgent that if you do not want this emblematic restaurant to end up being an unpleasant place, it is urgent that there are new waiterst

bar family restaurant opened in 1964 with one of the best terraces in barcelona to enjoy the sun and a good aperitif or fast food. the good service stands out, the good variety of its menu and as a special dish or tapa we recommend the meatballs and the homemade garlic chicken gala placidia.

it doesn't have wifi. the correct service. the bathrooms are the most unhygienic i have ever seen, and i went first thing in the morning, so it must have been the cleanest time of the day. i would like to return in a while and be able to change my opinion.
it is inconceivable that in the 21st century they prohibit you from opening a computer at the table. naturally, i'm gone.

dirty, if you want to go to the bathroom go by gondola. bordes, i go with my 3-year-old daughter (yes, 3 years old) who was carrying a bag of “worms” and they tell me that you cannot consume anything from outside… do you have “worms” and should i buy them from you? "no. well okay, they are useful for less than the windshield wipers of a submarine. flee you fools!

i reiterate, close this bar forever. and or reform the staff and bring in educated people who know how to serve customersor from now on it will be "la gastro verduleria de gala placidia where if you want navajera waitresses more arrogant and cool than a middle 8, great.if you want excellence you don't need to go to botafumerio, just going to a 365 is enough.

after ordering breakfast for 3 (2 sandwiches, a croissant, 3 drinks) my wife opens the laptop and before bringing the drinks they inform her that it is prohibited to use the laptop.they argue that this is not a library.i can understand that it bothers someone who will spend 5 hours having a coffee but in our case, i find it unacceptable to eat 3 breakfasts in half an hour.we have also learned that you cannot play cards and other entertainment things.

this place is one of the worst i have ever been to in my life. very bad treatment from the staff. the food was bad and the glasses were dirty. they didn't bring us the things we had asked for. not recommended at all.
the terrace is good although the interior of the bar is a pity. it's an expensive place.
1 star because i can't give 0. negative service and atmosphere.
good quality classic joint food at a fair price. good attention

we sat down before returning by train to my house so i am not a regular in the area. at the time of paying i noticed that they charged me 0.05 more expensive for the coffee with milk than someone else. for an ice cream that specified €1 in the advertising, they charged me €2.40. when i complained about the latter, they told me that it is what it is, that it is provided by the machine. a disappointment. the waiter is good.

professionalism 0, the guy behind the bar, blonde with curly hair who only does to walk around like a model, and who has no idea about working or even less education, the waitress, because of her accent i think argentina, who doesn't pay any attention to you, is only waiting for the friends who come to see her.the cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired. you rest your arms on the table and they get stuck.the price!!!!!, 100% abusive. it's better to go to a bar for drinks than not to drink anythi

i do not recommend this place to anyone. the treatment that the waiter gave us was outrageous. he is rude. there were three of us and after one of them consumed twice, the waiter came and told us that we should leave if we didn't consume more, when there were empty tables. we told him that we were finishing the cigarette and leaving and he told us no that we should get up right now. we politely repeated to him that we finished the cigarette and he said that he would stay standing in front of us

we were eating on the terrace. i asked if by some chance he had a container or pot to give water to the dog, explaining that i couldn't find a fountain nearby.the blonde waiter stopped what he was doing for a moment and before he could answer me, another of the staff (i don't know if it was the waiter or the owner, dark-haired) shouted from the other end of the bar (i was on the side of the entrance ) in a very bad way, saying that there was nothing there for the dog.the blonde waiter and the o
more than €4 for 2 beers, two glasses of nothing and they charge you more than what a medium one would cost you anywhere else. abusive prices and despotic attitudes. i don't plan to return.

i do not recommend this bar. the workers, specifically, a girl who is usually at the bar and a boy with hair and tattoos, have been rude. i had breakfast, i had a coffee and a sandwich and while i was waiting for a friend i read a book. the shaggy waiter approached me and kicked me out because i had already finished my coffee and sandwich. i told him that i was waiting for a friend who was on his way to have breakfast and he told me that he didn't care that i had to leave "because there were pe

the best thing about the place is the location. the coffee and service leaves a lot to be desired. they "invited" us to leave when we had only been on the terrace for 40 minutes because we did not have a new drink and with bad manners. first bringing us the bill and then very rudely telling us that there were people waiting. it is clear that they are very interested in making money and very little in customers. impossible to relax in a place like this. i will not come back.

at the food level, everything is good. some excellent stuff, like the cheesy tenderloin sandwiches. as an added value, it has the terrace to have coffee in the sun practically at any time. but, without a doubt, the best thing about this bar and what makes you a regular is the quality of the service: all the waiters are very correct and very friendly. a pleasure. congratulations!
the first time we went, two very fast young girls serving, they cook very very well, the service was very pleasant, they had a lot of time to talk, they were not poor, we liked it a lot.

a theft!!! they charged us €6 for 6 mini croissants…. normal and ordinary. €1 each mini croissant, it's crazy. they don't set the price and then you get the surprise.we ask the waitress how that price is possible and she tells us that it is what it is... breakfast for two people €21!!!!! the most expensive i have ever paid for breakfast in my life, never again.
horrible hospitality, they treat people very badly
delicious paella menu. the lobster melts in your mouth... the waiter is very friendly and handsome.
normal cut price 1.75e...and with an ice 2.05...an ice 30 cents.

if you are thinking of eating here, don't even think!!! a scam and very rude.we have ordered some bravas, a nestea and a fanta, the prices absurd and super expensive. €5 for bravas and there wasn't even enough for one person, less than one potato had been cut there, something very exaggerated, i got up to complain and to please give them a real normal portion and the most impolite short-haired waitress and it's not natural that fire her now because facing the public is not her thing, they are l

i gave the waiter 5 stars! he was alone on a holiday in the middle of the festival of grace, but the place was very slow, and he had to attend to everything alone.i understand the evaluations of slow service now because of the poor waiter, and having a very good disposition and kindness.

waiters (dark-skinned in black clothing and a "blonde" terrace waitress) are poorly behaved, disrespectful, shout, scold, insult customers, if after an hour you do not consume more than one drink and some tapas, for wanting to keep the table free . they put on a show for you to leave. i've never seen anything like it. they lie and are, to say the least, poorly educated and shameful. zero recommended!
it could be better, and a little cleaner, it is not acceptable for the girl at the bar and kitchen to go with her hair down, it doesn't cost anything to get in a queue

indecent experience, especially with the waiter named marcel.he intended to get us out of the table even though he hadn't finished because others wanted to sit. when we reprimanded him that we hadn't finished, he started to lecture us about the fact that we should be more people, and that it's always like that and blah, blah, blah.with very kind words but saying that he had no reason to give us explanations.unbelievable.if i were the owner of the bar, i would throw him out for business health
the waiter is very friendly, i had some beers and some bravas that were delicious!we also tried their meatballs, very good quality.

i have worked for many years in the hospitality industry and i have never seen such unpleasant treatment by the waiter (with tattoos) towards the customers. the owner of the establishment should know how they treat their customer.
good view, place and attention!! the pizza is delicious!

one of the workers kindly asked us not to eat the taper that we brought from home, since there was a sign indicating it. once we had been served, another waiter came and addressed me and my colleagues in a totally excessive and rude manner.the coffee is terrible, it's aguachirri.they charged me for some mussels when they didn't even have mussels to serve in the kitchen.in short, customer service is 0
the coffee at least with milk is terrible and they charge almost €2. i've passed it twice in three months, and then i have to run to the bathroom.

bar added to the list of "bars that i will never set foot in again" today i went to this bar with my partner at lunch time, and when we went to sit on the terrace it was all wet because of the rain and the lack of attention of the staff, the waiter from the terrace quickly approached and told us that we could not sit down because we brought the sandwiches from home... such pettiness with which it is falling due to covid and on top of that there is less attempt to collaborate as far as possible

in addition to paying the cut at a golden price and taking it in 10 minutes when i took out some documents and my cell phone to carry out a personal transaction, 2 waiters with bad manners invited me, bordering on disrespect, to leave the table because according to them i was working. i do not recommend this place for any consumption, i had never encountered a similar situation to the point of justifying to a stranger what i was doing.

there are always a lot of people inside and on the terrace. the waiter we had was distracted or tired. in short, the service could be improved. i was only able to have a beer although i ordered a tortilla skewer which i had to complain about when they told me there was no left. so the experience was poor. maybe it was a one-day thing... i don't know because i haven't been there more times.
nice and shady terrace, at least when i went, i only had a coca cola, but i looked and there are quite a few smoothies and ice creams, ideal to cool off in these heat
the coffee is bad and also they don't let you eat foreign products on the premises despite not having options for everyone...
place from 40 years ago with the, second generation at the front. good atmosphere, good terrace and good service with young people

i corroborate the opinion that it is expensive. the memory you take with you when you leave the premises is that. it is the typical unrenovated neighborhood bar that is in a transit area and you can fall into it without realizing it. the simple breakfast sandwich and drink well above the average price in barcelona. plus they cook at the bar so all the fritanga stays on your clothes.

i get to the terrace, they stand up in front of me and i ask the waiter where i can sit, - wherever you want! obviously they don't disinfect. i'm going to the other table that at least is, aired more time. 15' and no hello. i eat a croissant that i brought from the oven and then the waiter comes to tell me that i can't eat things from outside. no sign in sight. i tell him if he will help me and he says no. well, no problem, 3 empty tables

the coffee is the worst i have tried in bcn,they charge you 1.85 for oat milk and 0.25 for ice and on top of that they make it watery, i will never set foot in this terrible bar again, it is a shame that we have to suffer this lack of know-how.we must recover the quality of the bars in bcn
obvious lack of staff.only one waitress for the entire bar during morning sandwich time.

with the restrictions in hospitality as a result of covid, this place allows you to sit on the terrace only if you are going to eat, but it is prohibited if you are only going to have a drink. upon my complaint, the employee left telling me that “no one called you since you didn't come.” a shame.
handsome waiters, ideal location, expensive beer, inedible tapas: the omelette hides an entire salt cellar inside, it looks like they marinate the olives in cologne 🫒🥴

today we waited an easy 2 hours for a seat but it was completely worth it, very good service, super friendly and everything was perfect. despite all the stress of being alone against all the madness of people outside, at no time did he present himself in a bad way, even when i stained myself with ketchup, he offered me a damp cloth to remove the stain, which is truly 100% recommended.

we sat on the terrace. the waitress saw us. we waited almost a quarter of an hour. another table arrived. he took the order first from the other table and when he was going to go inside we had to signal to him to serve us. i went inside to see what tapas they had and the truth was that they didn't look good, little variety, the russian salad was dry, and the place looked dirty. there was no one inside. i asked the waiter for a tapas menu. he told me to ask the waitress outside (the one who sees
we ordered 3 tapas and they brought us one at a time, and the third 10 minutes later, food bought in mercadona, it took who knows why. a disaster!!

pleasant bar on a quiet terrace on the edge of gracia. the food is not bad but it is nothing out of this world. careful! it may be that you get a waiter who is not completely up to the job and you have to wait half an hour for some bravas!

cosy and tasty food, and friendly staff
and i saw my melody
good service, tasty food, nice atmosphere. recommended

nice bar close to an area full of office buildings. i have been a few times for a coffee or a lunch. during lunch-time, you can choose full menu or half menu, for both included water+dessert or coffee. staff are kind.
a small bar but the service was excellent!

house of menus, in the neighborhood, with traditional, casserole and healthy food. for breakfast they serve magnificent portions of omelette. calm and relaxed atmosphere. it has an outdoor terrace on a street with almost no traffic. the service is fast, and the place offers wifi.

highly recommended for breakfast, lunch or a drink. varied and very good sandwiches, such as the mid-day menus. they have a pretty powerful snack of the day. the attention is unbeatable, always with a smile. the tranquility of the street allows you to enjoy the terrace.
it is a nice place with a good menu, they have a wide variety and also unique flavors, i will recommend it and i will return, thank you
they make us endure! and we thank you very much! they have very good vibes!
good service, breakfast offers at a good price, the best in the area.👍
you eat well from the menu.
good breakfasts at a good price.

excellent value for money in terms of food. as for the staff, a 12/10, álex and pepi improve themselves every day, excellent people.very balanced daily menu and spectacular homemade desserts!!!!! i recommend the cheesecake, my favorite!ah! and the artichoke and meat paella on thursdays is another level.highly highly recommended if you are in the area.
typical bar, tapas, tortillas, the kitchen at the back of the room, regulars. it's good, it's fresh, authentic. excellent.😎
excellent service but unfortunately i cannot say the same about the vegetable omelette or the bread, poor quality and not very tasty.
alex what a kind person, he is charming. pepi, a super cook.generous and delicious breakfasts and lunches.
bar restaurant run by alex, very attentive. the staff is very attentive and the quality/price is unbeatable. they do breakfast and lunch menu offers.highly recommended.
i ate well. homemade dishes with good flavor.
at night they try to charge you for extra drinks and when you try to complain they get angry with you. the worst service i have ever received in restaurants.
economical, good and quick working lunch break... 9.90 euros for first course, second course and drink
the best bar in barcelona, ​​if you want you can help in the kitchen and everything
great professionals+ and of coursea good kitchen, thanks to the cook, which is improved every day
the menu is very good, the attention is the best, i like the place....
small, very chic and tasty
good service, good food and more than reasonable prices
quality and very low prices! and the optimal service, congratulations!
fantastic breakfast
it's like going to eat at grandma's house. recommended!
good deal

lugar acogedor, limpio, ordenado  y con un personal atento y muy predispuesto a conseguir que la satisfacción del cliente sea su razón de seguir. la calidad y presentación de sus platos va acompañado de un toque de espíritu de superación. valoro muy positivamente este lugar que recomiendo por su profesionalidad y buen servicio.

great wine, super friendly staff and a lovely atmosphere! i will definitely return :)

one thing i really didn’t enjoy was the food - the waitress offered me bread with tomatoes and garlic so i ordered it, and it ended up being thick slices of bread with two small uncut tomatoes and an unpeeled garlic clove 🥲 i wouldn’t really consider this food, more like ingredients that are handed to you but this is just my personal opinion and has nothing to do with the staff there (again, great staff!)

eve
great wine, super friendly staff. i've tried two different wines from the tap and they were both very fresh. the food is ok. i also really enjoyed the atmosphere.
great place! big variety of natural wines, cool atmosphere and solid food!

we had a lovely dinner.
interesting natural wines and tapas.
i would thought recommend to indicate in the menu spicy dishes, the bao was delicious but unexpectedly spicy. 😅

we visited barcelona with friends and started our week off with this amazing bar and liked it so much, we ended our trip with it! violette was amazing as a person but also as a wine wizard.  she asked us a few questions about the types of wine we liked and picked us a bottle that matched everything we could have wished for. the atmosphere is super vibe-y and the food is delicious (the meat/cheese and the bao especially ). if/when we return to barcelona, this will be our first stop!

slept on. should have way more than 4.1

glad we gave it a try. great inexpensive wine, great vibe, great menu.
love this place. natural wines, delicious cheese, great vibe and charming staff.

delicious natural wines on tap, and they had bottles in ice buckets on the bar you can easily choose from and taste before you buy. i know enough about wine that it was easy to pick what i wanted so i can’t speak on the knowledge of the staff or if they can make good recommendations based on your taste, i simply pointed at bottles and said “this one please!”. it is a busy place but we had no problem going up to the bar and ordering, there is no table service but for me that’s not an issue. staff

the environment is nice, full of people but not uncomfortable. the natural wine we chose is not my favorite but they fit well with the food. admire the thought put in the food, with the drink is 1+1 > 2

it's a place with huge choice of wines, either from taps or from bottles in affordable, good prices. it's also possible to get some snacks / tapas here - although we didn't try it, everything looked tasty and fresh. friendly and helpful staff.

personally the bar is too loud to sit in and it's hard to have a conversation, but it's just a subjective opinion. tables outside would be nice as well.

all in all, recommended!
awesome food and vibes. wine list on point! try the duck tortilla, you won't regret!

lovely, natural wine bar in a great location. wine and cheese board was delicious. service was ok…one guy was amazing and attentive (i forget his name), whilst the others were fairly rude and forever avoiding eye contact. regardless, still a great spot. would recommend

trendy bar with a variety of natural wines from the wall! the food tasted good too. prices are normal to slightly higher than usual in similar bars. overall great vibe. they could use one waiter more as sometimes it took a bit to order.

very inattentive staff. had to ask for orders of wine multiple times for 3/4 times throughout the night. same thing when it came to the bill. the wine tasted pretty average and the charcuterie n cheese board wasn’t good. overall over priced and very slow / inattentive service.

absolutely loved bar salvatge - food was good (esp the olives and pork belly bao) and the wine was so good and unique - i’m in love with the natural wines you find here being a wild ale lover and all. i had complete trust in violeta to suggest some absolutely amazing wines and she didn’t disappoint! you need to check this joint out!

ok, i have given many spots in barca 5 stars, but this is an exception, i would love to give this one an extra star. it's all about atmosphere in this joint, really extremely easy going staff, just hanging around a bar that could easily just be a really high table. there are new ciders, whines and beers on offer. extremely hip hip public and some realy awesome food. make sure to check out the beef and the owner who seems to be a bit tipsy to say the least ;)

a real hipster bar! a nice selection of whines, beers and newly introduced ciders. a small but delicious menu. the steak tartare with organic breads are absolutely to die for and cheese platter is a nice addition. if your looking for a hip local hangout this is you place! staff was a little too busy and therefore not as friendly as you would hope for, that cost them their 5th star...

generally a nice little bar, friendly staff, good wine obviously, and decent enough food... unfortunately they first forgot our food order (with the waiter then weirdly trying to convince us we hadn't ordered, even though he had spent some time with us, explained a few dishes and repeated the order back to us) until it was so late we had to cancel part of it, and then later tried to charge us for wine we didn't have. still, may have just been a bad night... i'll probably go back.

amazing wine bar! i had 2 glasses of wine but no food. diego behind the bar is very helpful and has great recommendations. the ambience is also super nice, they were playing nice 90s indie alternative rock music :)
bar salvatge might be the best stop we've had in spain. the wine, the food, and the incredible staff are all top tier. i hope we get to return some day.
friendly service and a bunch of great wine. the two wines + dried sausage is a nice snack to split!
best food i had in barcelona. great wines. great service. great vibe.

nothing special about the wine and the service. in fact, we had to go to the bar several times to place the order and pay because the waiters were not available. the wine is very standard, a little overpriced for the quality they offer.

however, the worst part was the kimchi tacos, which were worse than mediocre with very low quality ingredients but with a high, gourmet price. this was my second attempt trying to enjoy this place but definitely not coming back. do not waste your money here.
“tempranillo” wine is excellent! ask for the olives, you must try them! great cheese and jam
perfect natural wine bar in gracia. not many tourists and has a big selection of both local and international natural wines. serves nice sharing food too.
relaxed atmosphere, great for small bite with wine. away from the tourist side of barcelona

it’s funny how they try to rip you off. we were 2 and we had 2 glasses per person. the bill on the left was counting 5 glasses. after telling that we only had 2 glasses per person, they took out one drink from the bill. but… surprise!! the frisach is 1€ more now… inflations really going well.. so you know, they try to get a bit more money… and told us “there is an issue with our computer machine” lol lol yes ok

lovely place, waitress was very friendly, we took the wine by glass and the cheese platter. everything was good. i like the fact that even when the bar was full it was easy to talk ( i am sensitive to noise) it was on a monday, i will try to come during the weekend next time!

food was fantastic!!! we loved the peking duck tacos (absolutely delicious). service was great and our waitress was super friendly and helpful in selecting wines! would frequent this place if i lived here :)
check this place and try organic local wines in cozy atmosphere. the staff was friendly and helpful.
great food and wonderful service. the wine selection is impeccable and well priced. i would definitely recommend the trip and i’ll certainly be back!
did i think i'd be blown away by the food at a place that's known for its natural wines? salvatge has it all, and has my taste buds screaming at me to visit them again. an absolute delight!
for natural wine lovers. great vibe, good wines, fantastic pan con tomate and cheeses.

arrived in barcelona in the morning. spent the day exploring. found this place at night. first glass of wine since arriving. was beautiful. natural wine is very special. the bartenders are all great. was super crowded but felt like a room full of family having a good time. just squeeze your way in and be friendly. perfecto
awesome spot. nice wine, great atmosphere. definitely will be back

we asked for something non-alcoholic at the bar and they were really rude about it and said they only had grape juice. then we saw in another table some sparkling water. i asked for water and they told me they only had sparkling. before i left i saw a bottle of flat water in someone’s table.
there was only one waitress for the whole place and she never saw us when we waved at her so everything took ages.
they also don’t let you split the bill but there’s only a sign in spanish and no one tells y
new wave of natural wines is here: local grapes, wild winegrowers and fresh style
my local bar. great homemade vermut and ecological wines.

very nice vibe and atmosphere. it's hard to find a seat if arriving after 20.30. the vino tinto de la casa (house red wine) tasted a bit vinegary...could have been just that night. the other reds were more interesting.

very nice vibe and atmosphere. it's hard to find a seat if arriving after 20.30. the vino tinto de la casa (house red wine) tasted a bit vinegary...could have been just that night. the other reds were more interesting.
9 natural wines + 1 vermut on tap, all reasonably priced. what's not to like?
favorite natural wine spot in gràcia. they also have delicious snacks (tapas style) and service is always kind and helpful. lovely atmosphere, perfect for a quick apéro before dinner.
wonderful cheap wine bar with excelent wine and service
favorite wine bar in the world. excellent selection, great vibe, perfect location.
one of my favorite places in town. the wine selection is amazing. uncommon and mostly ecologic. food is a little bit expensive but totally worth it.

i'm a bit disappointed with this place.
the wine wasn't as nice as we were expecting (for a wine bar)
also a bit expensive and the chairs/stools are very uncomfortable.
amazing place, good wine!
good atmosphere, great food and service. got kind of poor supply of wine served by the glas. only got organic wines.
weird system to get you a seat, didn't like it. wines are organic so if you like that it's good, i didn't like the taste of their wines. food was ok and waitresses very nice
don’t waste your time at this spot. go to bar brutal instead. we were met with an incredibly rude woman at the front. not sure if the woman was racist or just in a terrible mood.
fantastic natural wine selection by the glass or bottle. delicious small plates to go with.
wonderful selection of natural wine, would’ve loved to been able to sit outside.
good natural wines by the bottle, food could be better. great vibes and atmosphere.
love this place!! amazing all round abs great selection of wines
great atmosphere and food, but the red lighting kind of makes you go insane and the service is a taaad sloppy…try the duck tacos
an interesting selection of natural whines and there is some food in the menu that is nothing special. the great downside of this bar is the stuff, quite unfriendly and uninterested.
great bar and wine selection, the food for the price could be better
great spot for natural wine. very knowledgeable staff. a must go for top quality wine.
incredible team! incredible service! incredible wine! cannot wait to be back
perfectly located in the gracia quartier with selected seasonal dishes & an enormous variety of local wines. definetely worth stopping by.
nice fun place good food galons of wine to choose from , good tapas small menu
only had wine. wine was nice and alive. good atmosphere, vibrant
very tasty natural wines, a lot of variety, tasty tapas
brought here a nutritionist therapist...  and it was a complete success! thank you team for the perfect dinner and wine recommendations.
really good organic wines, great atmosphere but the service could be pretty slow.
perfect bar, excellent vine, excellent food, very pleasant atmosphere. highly recommended !
nice wine and stuff served by the snootiest most disagreeable hipster lady
chilled atmosphere with great wines at good price and friendly staff
my favourite place in whole gràcia. lovely people who work there and love what they do.
great ecologic wine options, nice services good tapas
amazing choice of artisanal & bio-organic wines, lovely camareras.
quality natural wine without sulphate! oh and cheap.was great
always the best for natural wine in barcelona!!
really cool vibe, organic wines and cheese!
my favorite wine spot in barcelona
authentic wine and fair prices
nice bar with natural wines! a plus for the hippo!
very nice wine made just down the road
great place, alot of wine, nice walls
ecological wines meet cool interior.
fantastic wines.

i love it. i want to live here.

the person who helped me with my wine choice did an excellent job. introduced me to delicious spanish wines that were right up my alley.

we were looking for a place with a good atmosphere where we could have a glass of wine and we found this bar. the atmosphere is ideal for a night out with friends or a partner, it is neither very quiet nor very party. they have a great selection of natural wines and the staff does a great job with making recommendations to suit your taste. you can order by glass or bottle and the cheese and cold cuts boards to accompany are delicious. we loved the vibe and decoration of the place, we would defi
great place with amazing service! loved it!
a good spot to stop off when exploring gràcia, with a fair offering of drinks, tapas, and sandwiches. the placement is ideal and scenic.
definitely best croissant in bcn, they make them in kitchen. good coffe also, recomended!!!
good bar. beer was cold and tapas were nice.
great place to grab some tapas and drink a few beers

a small cafe, very nice. the terrace is gorgeous especially at sunset. they serve good wine at room temperature which was greatly appreciated! many places serve it cold... note that prices change from day to evening and whether or not you are on the terrace.

the bar has a spectacular location. both in winter and summer, the plaza de virreina is very pleasant. the menu is basic and the prices normal. the salads are very good. the service, regrettably not good. at the tables outside the bar, only one waiter. and as attentive as it may be, the volume of work compromises the quality of service. do not expect sympathy and kindness inside the bar. details that could improve a lot mainly because they are located in one of the most beautiful squares of the

not a great option. drinks are very weak (i watched the bartender make a “sangria” (it might have been a tinto de verano?) and it was, truly, 90% lemon soda topped with 10% red wine. the food isn’t great either; in particular the patatas bravas are more like potato chips than fried potatoes (i think this alluded to on the menu but i gave them the benefit of the doubt that it was a mistranslation… it wasn’t). the nachos at the table beside me also looked underwhelming. their queue system is weird

the staff was friendly and engaging when we were waiting for a table.
disappointed by the bravas, order the croquetas they are much better:)

quite a nice place where you can have some lunch/dinner & tapas. the food was okay, but nothing outstanding.
the location was nicely located in a square, it was quite full on the terras so we had to wait about 15-20 mins before getting a seat (waiting for someone to stand up). service could be better, but the drinks were nice and it had a nice atmosphere.
the worst part is the service. ppl attending are rude and slow. not coming back
beer very cold, wine at ambient temperature, small tasty plates as humus or guacamole. delicious freshly bakes sandwiches. nice ambient. a terrace outside to enjoy barri de gràcia.

the place is nice and the staff very friendly. the food is excelent, the menu is simple but the food is delicious.

it is not always easy for find a table. located in corner of a very busy plaza.
good bar with ok coffee. we live in the neighbourhood and we choose to drink the morning coffee at this place. the plates and sandwiches are also good.
not very nice staff. great location nice place a bit expensive. a pity that the waitress at the counter is so unfriendly!
supernice and fast staff. nice summer evening terrace to have beers with friends in a cute square in gracia neighborhood.
the place is nice, but the prices are bit high. however, it is totally worth to sit outside if the weather is good enough, nice square.
a very nice terraza at beautiful spot. quite good food, prices could be better.
one of my favorite gracia spots, really nice tapas! great both for afternoon and evening
great food but very unfriendly waiter. he always left before we got to finish a sentence and was unpolite.
this is an average bar with quite high prices (almost 3€ for a coffee...). but cozy place
nice location and tinto de verano, decent but not the best tapas i had.
the service was horrible, they kicked us out today after 27 minutes of having a coffee and tea at the terrace because apparently there were more clients waiting...
situated in a lovely square with old church, good coffee and decent guinness
scam alert! 4,50€ for a small glass of orange juice...
drinks nice & strong but took ages to get seat outside
slow service (as expected) great small plates, drinks, awesome vibe!
perfect location in a beautiful square. the offers are limited but the service is quite fast.

my very best  bar..
thwy have the best tapas in the best location..
i forgot that some waiters in barcelona they like to throw things into your table, miserable service...
service was merely acceptable.  great pour of guinness, though.
beautiful setting on the square, nice atmosphere and good service
nice location on the plaza. typical tapas food.
there is much better out there. cranky service. tapas to forget about.
monday night - salsa classes - good fun
bacon, swiss and date sandwich is as good as it sounds.
it's a nice place for a chat or simply hangout
good place for beer and a chat in the sun
sunday mornings with a coffee.  here.  forever and ever amen.
gracia's terraces are the best terraces.
god tapas, difficult to find a table in the terrace
best cafe in the best plaza
best cafe in the best plaza
overpriced and trying to trap tourists.
nice plaza bar.

inside one of the most beautiful squares in gracia!if not the most beautiful is this charming neighborhood bar, excellent sandwiches, my favorites are the loin with cheese and peppers and the grilled chicken with roquefort and raisins!good vermouth, well-served drinks and the unbeatable attention of lucía and andréa!excellent to go have a drink with friends and eat some tapas
bravas at 7 euros, they are not cooked at all, quite slow service, salad in a jar, no paper in the bathrooms.
the decline of gràcia. beer at €4.50you can go mud grazing. if i say what i think, they don't publish my comment.

scandalous prices, at the level of switzerland. i have complained about the prices, small beer €3.40, carton juice €3.10. unfriendly staff. never again, i can't even go to a terrace in my neighborhood.

this review is for the owner of the bar as i know that the workers don't care much... if you know, from the waiter's words, that when it rains the outside awnings retain water with the danger that a gust of wind will blow it out and fall directly about the customers, like what happened to us the other day, ending up drunk, how come they don't take the appropriate actions to avoid it. on the contrary, you allow the customers to sit down, finish their drinks, and for your employees, as if that we

if you go to eat or drink alone (not in a group), they ignore you and do not treat you kindly, since you are occupying a table that could potentially be occupied by 4 people. it's always packed with people. they go there for the position, but certainly not for the service, which is correct, but... it seems as if they are doing you a favor for serving you, and not that you are doing them a favor for leaving the money there. otherwise, they have a nice terrace, it's the only thing worth it

good sandwiches but it depends on the day and how many people they have. the same sandwich, yesterday great and today, festive, bread with bread, very little of everything except bread, everything very dry, for €6... they have to take better care of customers even at parties or with people.
bar well located and with good service, the waiter gabi was very friendly and made us love the coffee🥰

unprofessional bar waiter, lazy, believing that customers are his friends, his attitude is very out of place.with the prices they have, the minimum would be to be more friendly.i will not return, and my recommendations will be negative.

we had some beers and some hot sandwiches, loin and chicken. highly recommended, the beer is very cold and the food is delicious. very friendly service, very happy atmosphere in the square. thank you!!

what has caught my attention is that i think it is the first bar with a terrace that charges for the terrace or perhaps it is the only one that puts it on its menu.the patatas bravas have an innovative cut but i think the portion price is a little high.they have few waiters who are busy so service takes a while.

one of the worst patatas bravas i have ever tasted, the russian salad saves a bit, the nachos are not worth it. the service leaves a lot to be desired, lack of attention, slowness and a lot of delay in the dishes. a shame
excessively expensive prices. 3.40 for a clear one and almost 7 euros for the not very generous bravas. very slow service. made by tourists.
€3 for a coca-cola seems like a lot of money to me. so you're only charging the clientele of the neighborhood.

on sunday mornings in the square around there are many locals... which makes it less touristy than other places... it's perfect for a beer or a drink... maybe accompanied by a small plate of olives (always asked for and paid for separately... how tradition often in barcelona)
located in a corner of the square, this bar has a strategic position. it is very pleasant to enjoy the shade of its terrace, even though it is often full.the waitress was very diligent and friendly.

bad experience. a wrong sandwich, half-cooked patatas bravas, they took a while to take the order and prepare it even longer. then, they were charging me for the wrong sandwich. the kitchen only had 1 person for a full bar on the terrace and inside.
we had a beer and everything was very correct. quiet and pleasant environment.
the food was very delicious, everything came out very quickly and the atmosphere was very pleasant.
always trusted bar.we miss the bravas from before, which were with chips-type fries. even so, we don't fail at least once a week, my friends and i.

good terrace atmosphere and table service also with good attention and friendliness. however, the food leaves a lot to be desired: hummus from mercadona (literally), dry potato omelette... if you're looking to eat, choose somewhere else.
a good bar in the center of barcelona with a terrace, although there are always a lot of people on the terrace. the bravas are very good.

notice to all customers this bar pays black hours and does not declare them. it is unfair that while some entrepreneurs declare and pay everything established by social security and the ministry of labor, others do it illegally, it is shameful.in addition to not complying with the legal rules and the rights of the worker which is unpresentable they also do not comply with the hygiene rules leaving bad condition in the fridge if you don't want to catch typhus or any other disease do not eat anyt
very good sandwiches and the waiter very very nice and friendly.
very friendly bar with very good beer, and very friendly waiters
terrible attention from the waiters. the person who charged us refused to split the bill between three because, according to her, he could not collect cents. an absurd situation with very bad manners

the waitress seems rude, although in the end she turns out not to be. the bravas said they were good for one, but they could eat three! although it is better to have more than not to lack! surely if it were a couple more times i could give it four stars

good location in one of the liveliest squares in gràcia. you rarely find a table available on the terrace. the service is bad, they take a long time to serve you; when i got tired of waiting i went to the bar to order the drink and they were friendly. reasonable prices.
charming place, in the heart of gracià, perfect to share with friends and family 10/10
on a sunday at 9 in the morning, the sandwiches are very good, with the warm bread.the attention is fast.however, the prices are a bit high.

good food, good service, relaxing place (unfortunately during the pollen period it is off limits for me because it is right under a few sycamores that if you have allergies will kill you). one of my favorites in the neighborhood

it's a total bar, i mean they open around nine and close after midnight, you can have breakfast, lunch, drinks, tapas, it's a conversation bar, like the one in the gabinete caligari song.excellent coffees and infusions.various beers.spectacular sandwiches, the chicken with mushrooms.quality liquors.perfect terrace and warm interior, i've been going for more than 16 years and i never get tired, although the waiters do 😩i used to go for morning coffee after dropping the kids off at school.for me
we thought it would be more expensive and for 3 we paid €42.40 and ate well enough. positive surprise!
terrible service, when we told the waiter that we were missing a beer he told us “i was missing this one.” fatal.

very slow service, the bravas are cold bag chips with bottled sauce on top... badly cut fuet, hummus with too much oil on top... in short it's a shame since the place is beautiful but i will definitely not return and i will not recommend it!

everything was fine until around 11:00 p.m. they brought us the ticket to pay without asking for it, we paid and it wasn't even 11:00 p.m. one of the very rude waiters kicked us out, a borde, and we left with a bad taste in our mouths and bad roll, we will never come back.
3.40 a canya, i didn't know i was in the monaco grand prix

well, the friendly service, fair price, i tried some bravas, the sauce was great, but the potatoes are baked and i didn't completely like them, although they weren't bad, they are simply like that, there will be those who really like that they are baked instead of fries and i tried some nachos with cheese and guacamole that were brutal

beautiful place, correct service, somewhat high coffee prices (but acceptable considering the area) and crazy beer prices!!a beer, 25 cl (inside the premises)... €4.50!!!i honestly thought there was a hidden camera

this place is awesome! we found it it by chance and we really enjoyed the vibes there, it's a real barcelona bar, very popular among the locals. the food is great and they have good beers at a very reasonable price. the manager is such a legend! we enjoyed so much listening to good spanish music there. see you soon
very nice ambience, good staff, good food and at night they put popular music until 2 am or so

the tapas i ate here were exactly what i was looking for, and what i was craving from my visit, at a reasonable price. music is fantastic and eclectic; the staff were forgiving of my poor catalan and spanish. i'm so glad i visited this bar!

tiny bar in the heart of gracia, a bit pricey (two cañas of punk ipa and one croqueta 9,10€) the was something about decoration of this place which made us feel kind of uncomfortable. i liked the music they were playing and staff was ok.

nowadays it's hard to find a bar in gracia that keeps the original environment of this catalan neighborhood. bar viu gives you unforgettable nights with good music, tasty food and nice people. either if you go to chill out and eat some "tapas" or for the night parties, you will always want to come back.
great vibe and the only place in gracia with happy hour! (1€ the estrella galicia, every day from 6pm until 8pm)
super nice bar, amazing staff, good food, good drinks and good music.

really cool bar with good drinks and lots of nice food.
it's really chilled and they play cool music
nice music vibe. good prices. informal place.
small portions. slow but nice service. prices are reasonable.
best bar in gracia! very welcoming staff
guys in the kitchen chatting, not even asked our order in 15'. left
marvelous!

bar viu is a small and cozy bar in the barrio de gracia with a good atmosphere. it is evident that it is a bar well frequented by the residents of the neighborhood. they offer classic drinks and their menu is limited, but it is fine for their style. it's not pretentious, that's fine. the attention or service is at the bar. certain days have musical and artistic panoramas. recommended to stop by for a beer or something quick, except on music days that are more intense and merit staying a little

cozy, a simple but comfortable place. good vibes, good music and a good variety of beers. i just had a couple of beers, a bread with tomato and bravas potatoes, which i order with the sauce on the side, they confirm my order but they don't deliver them as they should, leaving this aside, good service. (the bravas were not entirely my taste)
