the tray of fries is a shame. we ordered delivery, we paid €4 for them, and they arrived half empty, incredible, half empty, just as it appears in the photo. i called to ask for explanations and not only did they not give them any, but in a provocative and disrespectful way he told me “it is what it is, hang it wherever you want.” never more.

large place specialized in, as its name says, frankfurt. they have a great variety at a good price. they also have other dishes, from salads to patatas bravas, but i highlight their sausages, which you can eat in all kinds.the service is fast and they accept cards.
if the food was a little better we would go more. since i can't eat meat, i order the tortilla sandwich, which is really bad. the potatoes are good.

the food was simple, very tasty, we tried frankfurter. it was done quickly, cheaply, probably too cheaply, the service was very nice, of course there was no problem communicating in english, the place was nicely decorated. personally, i don't see any disadvantages, we will definitely come back.
very delicious food, fair price and very pleasant service.
all normal, but i asked for a sigalo of rum and honey and they put white, when it's usually made with black rum.
the place is not bad, they have a large variety of sausages to try. cleanliness is not one of its strong points. very very noisy environment with somewhat strong odors.
this frankfurt has been well established in the neighborhood for a long time, good sandwiches and better tapas and a familiar and friendly atmosphere

good place, old place without pretensions.attentive and friendly service with good humor.super fast cooking, within 5 minutes we already had all the food on the table and the place was full.if i'm in the area and want a frankfurt, i already know where to go.
very typical place, i ate very well. the waiter was very kind. i spent €17 including beer.
excellent place, very good, familiar and fast service, magnificent prices and quality!
i went to eat and the attention was great on the part of the super friendly and attentive waiter, the food was 10/10, highly recommended, i will definitely return!!!!
very delicious food, the service is good, fast, the atmosphere is friendly, very delighted with this restaurant, i recommend it with a closed eye 🤩
they are super friendly, you feel at home.very good frankfurters, a pikanwurst must be eaten!
very good service, super attentive. delicious burgers, sausages, etc. at midday there is a more complete menu. very good price, €7.5 to eat and have a beer.

the girl's attention is good.but the mojitos… they leave a lot to be desired, they had no taste of anything in my glass, there was no mint, the sweetness of the fruit was not noticeable… i would not return
i loved the frankfurter verdi and the strawberry and passion fruit mojitos. and the very kind and excellent attention of valentina. i will be back!
the food was very good, but i loved the service, excellent attention, recommended.
i come to this place at least once a month. it eats well and i like its sangria
a frankfurt where they make very delicious sandwiches, the vegetable one is delicious.they are very well organized, fast and the service is very good.without a doubt, we will repeat
magnificent attention. a safe stop after a good movie at the verdi. hard to say, but maybe a hair too fast in the service😂

i always order food at home in this frankfurt. i try new things every time and the price is right.they place orders very quickly since it doesn't take more than 15/20 minutes to arrive at my house.i recommend this frankfurt for its variety, price, quality and speed
very nice, delicious and fast food and well priced for what barcelona is.
good place for sandwiches and some tapas
some dishes from the tapas list. delicious food and very friendly service.

very good location. and with very important details: quality and price. delicious and cheap burgers. very honest prices. furthermore, in three minutes the dish was already on the table, hot, and looking wonderful. a recommendable restaurant. totally different from all the places below, in plaça de la revolución, where they are very expensive and the quality...it deserves 5 stars.

it is spectacular, the food is unmatched, and there is a lot of variety to choose from, the service is very good, i have been going there for years and the quality is unbeatable, highly recommended!!!

ideal for eating quickly and deliciously. the quality, quantity and price ratio is very good. they have table space and you can also order takeout.the service is very good, from the owner and his employees, always friendly and with a smile.the place is clean, with nice decorative details and pleasant music.
we went for dinner at 9pm and stayed until they closed.very friendly, attentive and professional.possibility to split the account when paying and not make bad faces like in other places.
perfect for a night with friends and children, eating well and without complications. the best is the cervela, a place for local people

i didn't like it very much the first time, i have returned for the second time and i must admit that i have eaten better, it must have been a bad choice of dishes. this time i ordered the cheese fries, they were very tasty. the burger with bacon, cheese and egg was well made, the bun did not break and was easy to eat. very friendly waiters.
the delicious food!!!! and also very good attention from the girl who helped me, valentina.

they put cumin in the burger and you don't appreciate the flavor of the meat. it tasted very bad. it looked like a tower of vegetables with all those spices. i did not like at all. very good fries. fast delivery.

we were in a hurry, we only had 15 minutes to have something to eat and it was a good choice to go to this place, since we ordered two egg whites and some bravas and they gave us everything quickly. plus they were good, both the bravas and the clear ones.
my favorite frankfurt in the barrio de gracia!

i just ate there with my father. the attention is unbeatable, the girl who attended to us was a sweetheart. the food was very very good. we ordered some nachos with cheese and they even had oregano. the burgers with their meat spiced with oregano and parsley with delicious and toasted bakery muffins. let's go for the price and location a pearl.
i've been there several times and i always come back for the pikantwurst! super good food and the mojitos are always a hit!
the tapas and sandwiches are good and the price is very affordable. in addition, the waiter's treatment is fantastic.
the truth is that he is very well and he is very calm. the owners are from the neighborhood and very friendly
good place to eat a frankfurter. it's the second time i've come and it's a nice place with the same quality of food as always.
good place to eat a frankfurter. it's the second time i've come and it's a nice place with the same quality of food as always.
my favorite place on mondays, attentive staff, special and like at home
i don't recommend ordering nachos with guacamole: the guacamole needs peppers, salt and done well, it doesn't taste like anything.
a frankfurt as always. excellent atention.
very good service from valentina!! delightful. i would repeat

excellent and fast service! i like this place when i want to eat something on the go, especially before going to the movies. the vegetable sandwich is delicious but without a doubt the fries take the plaudits.

a 5 "raspao", i ordered a serranito, the bread was toasted to hide the fact that it was hard but the rubberiness gave it away, the green pepper was cold. the frozen chistorra potatoes with pieces of old potatoes burnt from the fryer. the chicken sandwich, because it was missing 1/4 of the chicken. a place not to repeat.
excel. slow good food, variety, friendly and good price.

super viby place! really well decorated with reused materials which give it “points” in therms of sustainability as well as a very cool look.
drinks are good and cheap compared to other places like that in town.
highly recommended.
great atmosphere for a multiple art experience. good music and great pizzas!
fantastic place, i recommend it, beautiful location and atmosphere. they have amazing artisanal kombucha and other great drinks 🔝
the place is really good. they have an art exhibition that’s great. i met valentina, the manager, and she’s a really good persone and artist. fran, one of the founders, is a very crazy and funny guy.
super spot, amazing terrace inside. staff is friendly. totally recommended!
chill atmosphere, cool music and very good natural wines! a place to go in barcelona 😎
best place in poblenou with a terrace and best spritz in town

gommalacca is a new born furniture shop/exhibition space. it has the peculiarity to mix different concepts in perfect harmony with the neighbourhood where gommalacca is situated. the guys running gommalacca are organizing events everyweek from wine tasting to art exhibitions. i defenetly recommend to keep an eye on them.
amazing place art and fun, such nice people will be back for sure, every week a diifernt experience !
amazing place! lamp and plants are so nice 😊😊
stunning hand-picked furniture in a beautiful space❤️‍🔥❤️‍🔥❤️‍🔥
great art and funny events every weeks!
stunning location both indoors and outdoors! excellent music, excellent art and tastings! fantastic owners!
cozy place and cool people, wines, beers, patio with terrace.they also make good things to snack on.inside there is an art exhibition, dj or live music.

what a fantastic surprise this new concept store is!! warm and welcoming with innovative and never banal settings, furnishings and pieces of art, it is a fantastic novelty of 22@pleasant location both for aperitifs and tastings and for exhibitions!!super recommended!!!nice place nice people!!

we celebrated my baby shower and it was a very special afternoon😊 the place is fantastic and the terrace is super spacious. like a small oasis in the center of the city. without a doubt, highly recommended to celebrate any type of event with friends and family!!

we celebrated my husband's 40th birthday and it was a lot of fun.the owners are very nice, the guy who helped us was super friendly. it is ideal to have a private party and have a good time!we hope to return soon! thanks for all the attention to mario, fran and fabri! 🥳
good place and better treatment from its managers, very reasonable prices and fantastic atmosphere.
it's a great place that i found the first week i came to barcelona. it has a beautiful garden and the people here are incredibly friendly ❤️

very nice place, inside it is structured in an industrial style, the members of the club are truly exceptional people, very polite and always smiling during the evening, good beers, an ipa and a handcrafted rubia, music not too loud, basically for evenings where you can have fun listening good music, being able to talk to your friends and also making good acquaintances, super recommended

good cocktails and also the bruschetta... very honest prices.the outdoor space is very nice and pleasant.very friendly and familiar place, the staff is kind and helpful.the guys organize some interesting events.super recommended.
it's super cool to spend an afternoon with friends 🍻 with good music 🎶 the space is quite spacious and pleasant. good pretty and cheap. 💃🏻🕺🏻
best bar and social club in the region. i love coming. mario and fran are amazing people and the music is excellent..
i love this place, the atmosphere is great! it has a nice terrace with a private interior garden and tables to have a drink in the sun. the wines are top!it's like an oasis in the heart of poble nou!

very interesting place that emerged in poblenouen this past year 2022 that is establishing itself as a place to find or make new friends while listening to good music or enjoying the various events that are scheduled or drinking anything on its cozy terrace.don't miss it. elou.
very good place with good air and friendly. from the first moment you feel comfortable and at home. 100% recommended.
great environment phenomenal staff.
good space, incredible terrace, quality products.and the boy at the bar is a sun!the craft beers are also from the neighborhood 5/5 i will return
fantastic welcome, very nice guys, tasting of top made in italy cheeses and jams! highly recommended!
cozy place, incredible outdoor space perfect for an aperitif.highly recommended.
very good place!! the inside is very cozy and they have a small terrace with a small garden, and the locals are very nice!
very good place to go for a drink in the afternoon. the waiter is a machine, he makes the best pizzas in poble9.
in poble nou, a very cozy place with live music, appetizers (spritz and pizza) and an outdoor terrace! what to ask for more 👍👍👍
happy place with good vibes. fantastic terrace. good programming of events and music. good spritzers and some gins with very good and original flavors.
very particular place, underground in a very modern neighborhood.... good live music, top local craft beers, you feel like family, found it like this by chance and like it even more
excellent, the homemade pizzas are delicious and the craft beers.the treatment and very friendly staff. i recommend
beautiful place, the beer is delicious, and best of all the people who work there!!!don't miss out on the experience :)
excellent atmosphere 👏. a place to come and enjoy some delicious drinks, art, pizza.💖
super cozy place with a huge and cool internal patio. very friendly owners, dj set, quality drinks at a good price, and they also have very unique artisan kombucha. to go have a good time!
cool atmosphere, gin tonic and spritz ottimo , good music and good wave.i will definitely repeat
what can i say... excellent music and a young, particular, unconventional environment... we were surprised to find typical salento products and recipes!
fun, music and a very curated atmosphere! i went for my birthday and it was phenomenal
great place in barcelona - good music, art and very good performance-price ratio. highly recommended place to visit - we will definitely be back!
great local! very good music and very good homemade beer! they have a large garden where you can comfortably enjoy a beer! highly recommended
nice place with an internal garden to meet up and drink cocktails and taste italian wines served by polite, friendly and professional staff.
perfect place to spend some time with friends, always ready to serve customers, magical atmosphere, i recommend!!!!
modern antiques, design, art and music... one of the coolest concept stores in barcelona! not to be missed!
finally a family place where art reigns supreme, beautiful ❤️
beautiful place, people, events, wine and pizzas (the terrace is brutal)
the place is really welcoming, the staff are super friendly and very nice
super cool place! best creative negroni in barça! very cool garden!
i was there celebrating my birthday and the truth is that it was all very cool! the guys were very nice, there was live music, and works of art!! i loved it and i will return for sure
a cultural family highlight in the city. i can highly recommend it ❤️
very good people, italian friends, 100% recommended.
a rustic and at the same time modern place in the heart of poblenou. we will be back soon !
great place! nice people, you eat and drink well

a great place, located in a very good position, very curious things and good opportunities to buy.very convenient, there is also space right in front to park and load.attentive staff, very professional.i leave happy
excellent atmosphere and charming fran as well as the entire team
for me one if not the best. place to drink craft beer and listen to good music. in barcelona. pere iv 93. i wish everyone like him

the doors open and a charming place appears.like the mirror for narnia.dreams and reality come together in a journey made of sensations, colors, and laughter.because this place is not a workshop but an atellier, and if these guys have transformed a storage room into a castle, they can surely transform your gray days into indelible memories.
great place, fantastic music!
cultural venue, good beer, sophisticated atmosphere
very good attention, super friendly and cordial 🙂
very cozy place where art, concept and vintage come together and take shape. the owners and all the staff are super friendly and available! a 100 in every way!
an excellent place for every day, very pleasant ambience and atmosphere. for every recommendation🤗
fantastic location, the place is really interesting and i advise everyone who decides to visit barcelona one day to stop by. obligatory!!!
very nice place, cozy, where you can find vintage things, friendly staff. plus gallery space. recommended to visit
beautiful moments... the waiter is good
perfect, cozy place with amazing people
a beautiful experience, art, music and joy all contained in a unique venue. thank you
crafts, design, art and music in the same location! what to say? the new experience of barcelona!!!
the best deal in poblenou, good vibes
a great club! super friendly and very charming
very good treatment, exquisite food and good atmosphere.
very good crispy pizza
a beautiful store, very good furniture and lamps. fast and easy service and also the treatment is excellent. highly recommended
nice people and nice environment, excellent tasting and modern shop
a very attractive space with many good ideas! the guys who run it are very nice! i recommend it!
one of the most beautiful places in barcelona! recommended
fantastic place where you can breathe art and good vibes.
the good vibes life iseverything in what we are looking for and here is the center of that in poble nou.. thank you great team.
happy birthday i loved this place
cool outside plants and pots! very nice and available staff!!!
all good, and friendly staff
good place, good people and 100% recommendable quality operas
new in poble nou, furniture, plants, planters and tasting of gin and tonics #whynot #furniture #restauracion
bombshell news in town! superlatives!
wonderful place.very pleasant.we will repeat.

the place was very nice and had a great style and atmosphere, especially for young people. it was relatively cheap to stay there and it was very close to a metro station. the people working there were very welcoming and kind. i didn’t have any problems with my stay, neither with the facilities, nor with the roommates. 100% recommend this place for a short stay in barcelona.

second time here and i would choose again this hostel. confortable beds, clean room, towels and sheets. people working really nice. they let us make the check in before time and they changed our room because we were not comfortable in the first one they offered us. i highly recommend this place for a short stay.

pros! :)
staff was super friendly and speak both spanish & english. we had a situation in the dorm and the handled it well. plus available 24/7
the hostel is pretty centrally located to food, shops, & transport.

cons :(
beware!!! there are a lot of americans (they were very rude, loud, & inconsiderate)
bathrooms are really small and smelled like mildew w/ slight signs of mold.
some of the lockers in our shared dorm were broken so that was a lil sus.

the rooms were clean and nice. the staff were very polite, had good english, and gave good recommendations for food. location is very close to la sagrada familia and la pedrera-casa milà. you have to pay 5euros to rent a towel. no body wash is provided in the private bathrooms. to take money out of their cash point it was a high charge. there is no hairdryer in the rooms but you could pay a 20 euro deposit to rent one or reception said you can use one in the shared bathrooms but when we looked t

it was a pleasant stay. the place could be cleaner - the floors in our dorm felt like they weren’t mopped in ages. my bedside light never worked which was quite a bummer. the staff is super responsive and friendly - we had a complaint about the loud people in the neighbouring dorm and they handled it quickly! the atmosphere also felt really social and enjoyable - the rooftop terrace was amazing!

the hotel has a young adult vibe and is a chill place. there is a bar in the lobby, three swing chairs, a game room floor with a pool table, and space to sit on your laptop. the rooms were nice and has space, with a desk. the shower and toilet room was small but doesn't affect the score. the breakfast was plain but there are breakfast locations in walking distance. the metro is close and the best churro place is less than 5 minutes of a walk. i would recommend this hotel and would stay here agai

solo female traveler here. honestly, overall it was an okay stay. i have two complaints. the second (at the bottom) is the reason for the two stars.

the lockable drawers in the rooms had locked padlocks on them. when i (and the other girls in my room) asked the front desk if we could be given the combinations for the locks, they said they were unable to unlock the drawers and were given a locker downstairs. so we were able to lock up our stuff, but it was really inconvenient and slightly worryi

just plain and simple. beds are hard and very low to the ground. no tv,phone and the elevator is tiny. for one night stay is perfect if your a collage student passing through. front dest service is good

overtall a bad experience concerning the staff. bad service. the staff was rude and always in a bad mood. got yelled at because we misunderstood the breakfast place. also, there was an insect in the food at the breakfast. very dirty breakfast area.

the hotel is very nice: clean, new, well furnished and comfortable.
the location is strategic 10 minutes from the sagrada familia.
i found the staff very helpful and ready to satisfy the requests we made of them, qualified staff are capable of communicating in various languages.
large breakfast (sweet and savory). good value for money! i would recommend it!

this place was a good experience: clean, organized and not just young vibe.

i stayed at 4 bed only women and it was perfect.

not issues at all with them. the bathroom were clean and you feel safe as a solo travel women.

good experience!
the generator is one of the largest hostels in barcelona, which boasts nice rooms, a rooftop observation deck, and excellent breakfast bar. my stay was six days long during the circuit festival 2023.
had a double suit in the hotel side of the hostel, great views , clean room friendly staff, food fresh , ideal location as a hub to travel out from

this hostel is more for large groups - like teams, classes or tours. there were loads of school aged or high school kids there which is so not the vibe that most hostels have. as a hostel traveller, i wouldn’t stay here again — especially not as a solo woman. wish they would have mentioned how big it is - easily fits hundreds of people which feels more like a hotel than anything.

we've had a wonderful experience at your place. the room was clean. the location is perfect regarding to the restaurants and bars. also, it was possible to visit the whole city by feet from the hostel.

amazing place and service. if you are looking for an hostel where to spend some days in barcelona i would recommend hostel generator 100%.
the rooms are really cleaned and well organized, not to mention the kindness and willingness of the stuff. i am really satisfied
was visiting from the states and had the best time in this hostel. was traveling with my two friends and we loved this hostel. it was so clean and the staff was very nice :) would definitely go back

super location, amazing staff, tasty breakfast! clean rooms. its my 2nd visit to barcelona and 2nd stay in generator. i like this hotel and i am sure i will come and stay here next time also. price and quality balance!

quality of the room to improve!||the bathroom was not great (the shower was really horrible!!)||i was expecting somehting better for that price! ||but the location was really good! ||nice also to have a terrace and the sun was amazing in the morning :)

generator is just on a perfect location. you can easily explore every part of the city. bus and metro stations are near and can take you to any part of barcelona. many great dining places are near also and you can also have really good breakfast there to get you started for the day.

our bed didn’t have a cover up sheet for the mattress, we aksed for it 3 times. they said they would fix it. after the second time they told us, they ran out of this. the room is small, not comfortable for your luggage. mattress , shower, wifi is okay. location is great !!

really cool hostel with great common areas with a quite chill vibe. beds are a bit small, and there is no kitchen facilities if you want to prepare your own food.
found it a bit hard to meet new people. bar / cafe had limited opening hours.

i couldn't sleep at all. all night long i was listening snoring and farts of a guy on top of me. no curtains, no earplugs or any assistances were provided. you are by your own. this was a terrible night. the rest of service is quite acceptable, taking into account the price.

it was a great experience. i was recomended by a friend of mine and i'm sure i'll do the same with my people. everybody was very nice with me and i could really enjoy during my staying. thank you all again!

very good hostel, 8 floors in total, at the top is a beautiful terrace, improvement that could be made is a curtain on beds? apart from that - a great place to stay, i had only 1 set of noisy/annoying roommates in my week there & shout out to josé on the front desk for helping me with the problem update stayed here again in november again brilliant, very helpful staff and a big shout to molah as well , on security, a top man 5 ⭐

decent hostel- did a private room. the bathroom smelled terrible .. wasn’t the best. the bed was soft, but for the king it’s 2 doubles pushed together and they move often so sometimes i woke up in the middle on the hard bed frame.

this was a decent place for the price. it was packed with large groups, kids, etc. had a good event/dj scene for the night…
location is great and very walkable. 18 min walk from la sagrada, far from the beach to walk 50 min, but close by train (15 min)!
great food nea

hotel very well connected to the city center as well as the beach or any other famous landmarks. they have a cozy lounge with some multi-game arcade machines and pool board. as well as a rooftop with amazing views

i've stayed here with my family for 5 days, and i can assure that they have an outstanding team. upon arrival, yenny received us with a big smile and during our check in she was very aware of everything we might need so we can have an amazing stay.
the breakfast buffet was beyond deli

this place reminds me of a high school dormitory. firstly, it was heavily crowded with high school backpackers; it felt as if an entire class had booked this hostel for a field trip. consequently, the lobby and common areas were quite noisy. secondly, the room key card system was very unreliable, causing me a lot of trouble trying to access my room, often relying on luck. this problem seemed to affect everyone.

on the positive side, the common area is very spacious, and the hostel itself is qui

women should not stay here. on my first night here, two separate women reported incidents of sexual assault/harassment, and the only thing reception could do for them was move them into an all female dorm. one of the women had to stay on the same floor as the man that sexually harassed her. the men faced no consequences, which is so scary because more women could be sharing rooms with them. i’ve stayed at hostels for my entire three week trip throughout spain, and this is the only hostel where w

rooms weren't that clean when we came in the toilets leave a bad smell and the 4th and 6th bed rooms have an insanely small toilet and washroom
good reception service
stayed in the hotel portion quiet. good breakfast great staff and a good location for walking. rent some bikes and see the city!  would stay again.

i think this is a nice hostel, although expensive for a hostel. the best part is their rooftop terrace. i think a lot of people don't realize you have to manually turn on the ac on the wall. it's bearable in the room after that. i didn't bother with the breakfast as other reviewers said it's not worth it, and the hostel is close to everything.

do not stay here. they do not have the amenities listed. no useable kitchen. they also installed fixtures poorly that can thus fall on you or your head. cafe was never open. management isn't interested in helping.
great place. a block away, you will find xurreria trébol and that's a must on your agenda. also the hostel is surrounded by different cafes and places to have breakfast,  lunch or dinner.
rooms are very tiny. there is almost no space. that's unfortunate, especially for the price. however the location is very good and the staff is rather friendly. there are also a lot of shared spaces.
great value for money. very social hostel and staff were very accomodating. highly recommend.

disappointed with their services. check in was 2pm we arrived a little earlier so we asked if we can do an early check-in in which they told that it is not possible because they have a late check-out request but not to worry as our room will be ready at 2pm .they told us to just wait and so we waited.  at 2pm exactly we went to the front desk  to see if we can check in and they told us 15 more minutes. 15 minutes past and they told us the exact same thing, to wait a couple more minutes . at this

we booked a deluxe king room. the customer service here was very nice and the staff seemed alright.

besides that nothing was what we expected. the king bed was two mattresses put together. so we spent the next 5 days pushing them back and forth the whole time. this made the whole sleeping experience no fun.

the bathroom has a timer on and it and will turn off while you are showering so you have to start waiving you hands around or opening the shower door. now hair dryer was not functioning rig
perfect everything, rooms where very nice and simplistic, dinner took forever but it seems most dinners in barcelona do seem to take forever, overall greatly enjoyed my stay

giant hostel with many people so it's good if you're looking for meeting other travelers and socializing. cool lobby area and a beautiful rooftop. seems like they also organize happy hours and nightly events for those interested. the only thing i found odd were the high number of higher school and middle school students staying here, but maybe they have a contract or agreement or something with the hostel. overall, a positive stay and i met some great ladies at this hostel.

staff didn't let my brother in the room i paid although the reservation was under his name. the payment was made by me and just because the credit card information didn't match with the reservation name, they let my 18 year old brother sleep outside in the street. very angry and surprised about this treatment, this is supposed to be normal ?

the room was fine, but on our first day we were exhausted they didn't let us check in although our room was empty
we waited 4 hours on the sofa next to the reception and the security woman didn't let us catch a break "sir here is not allowed to sleep"

the hostel itself is good and clean etc. my issue is with the hostel restaurant.
the pizza has enough cheese to make cardiologist cry and is probably the worst quality/price ratio i've seen in spain.

nice hostel for the price. they have some really cool events for guests and groups. very good vibes and the place smells great. i took off a star because the showers are so tiny you can hardly use them if you’re a bigger person. they have a very good breakfast but it costs extra, so do towels.
rooms are basic but affordable. not as social as other hostels. rooftop was closed when i was there for renovations
my 13 year old stayed there as part of the barça fotbal first program and he enjoyed it a lot.

i was here a few weeks ago with a travel group and i had an okay time the majority of the time until my last day. my last day i decided to walk around and grab food and go to the beach (there weren’t too many vegan options on their menu, so i decided to get vegan food elsewhere and explore the city). i come back from my day out around 6:00 pm for a few minutes before heading back out. when i came back around 9:30, my leftover food was completely gone. other people in my room had snacks and food,

where to begin... generator hostel in barcelona was an absolute nightmare. i cannot express enough how much i regretted my decision to stay there. first and foremost, let's talk about the exorbitant price of €91 per person per night. it's laughable to think that this hostel could even dream of justifying such a ludicrous price.

the rooms were nothing short of a sauna. sweaty, suffocating, and utterly unbearable. i've never experienced such discomfort in my life. it felt like being trapped in an

i want to start by saying that the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the location is fantastic, the breakfast options are yummy, and the room size is just right. everything that i went to and did was easily in walking distance or able to get too by train/bus/taxi. the atmosphere was positive, upbeat, and the decoration was stunning. i love the "bohemian" style interior design. the small breakfast room with the lamps is gorgeous. i highly admire hanging lamps like that.

i do not like to

not the best hostel experience, but also not the worst. did have higher expectations though, considering the price.
we booked a private double room, but we may as well have slept in a dorm because we were right next to the shared bathroom for the floor and got minimal sleep, so the private ended up being pointless. it was very difficult to fall asleep to slamming cubicle doors and hand dryers for 4 nights.
they also don't have a shared kitchen space, or even anything as simple as a microwave, so

i stayed in a four-bed room. room was clean, service and staff were pleasant. but no privacy in the room: there were not curtains on beds, and no closets or lockers. i was there for three nights and it was overall positive experience.
the place is nice and the location is ok. i just had a problem with service (reception), people without empathy and rude when you ask about some information.
do not stay here. they do not have the amenities listed. no useable kitchen. they also installed fixtures poorly that can thus fall on you or your head.

a complete rip off, the hostel operates a floating rate according to demand and while advertising to give you the best rate, this actually locks you into the rate at the time of booking. this  contradicts the small print. the room is filthy, with greasy hand prints on the door, hair in the bathroom and in the bed.

i stayed in generator barcelona for 3 nights in may. it was my first time abroad and they were a positive part of my experience as a whole. the rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff were all friendly, accommodating and spoke great english. the bar was so much fun and was a great place to spend the early hours partying!overall a positive experience and would recommend to anyone visiting barcelona!

the hostel itself is very nice. great atmosphere and well kept. the staff is not friendly at all. they were extremely rude on multiple occasions. on the first day we got there the cleaner entered our room with us in it and started cleaning. one of our roommates was sleeping. she didn’t say anything to us. they gave us a room key to a room that was full of people and had us sit and wait an hour in order for it to be resolved. we ended up being late to a tour as a result of this. they were very di

stayed in the private room, €100 on a monday night , very expensive for a hostel
the room is nice, comfortable, balcony with a great city view.
for the price you would expect minimum soap,shampoo etc
bed was comfy
major issue in the morning : housekeeping came before check out time at 10am, didn’t knock before entering . then 5 min later a member of the reception team came up to notify me that housekeeping called them to tell me that i needed to check out. bearing in mind i know the check out ti

location was nice to walk around
everything was okay
no curtains for dividing space (need to know before booking)
the day i checked in i arrived at 2am but the staff was nice
fun fact : slow elevator
hairdryer : o in bathrooms
towel : needed to rent

the rooms are nice, comfortable and big, in my case i shared a room with other girls it was a multiple room they have bathrooms with shower and toilet apart, the attention of the staff was incredible is special by jeison, he treated me very well, the food is delicious  and they have a very variable menu and with good prices from € 7,  they have a liquor and leisure area which also have good prices, the location is perfect, it is central, it also has an elevator, it has a study and games area it

great location, it was convenient to most tourist attractions. it was clean and service was amazing. big shout out to surib, jenny at the reception and their manager, xavier. they were always ready to go the extra mile! well done team and thanks for making my stay comfortable.

it was a rough stay, they dont clean on regular basis, the door lock in the room  i stayed was broken, you cannot get in using the access card, unless there is someone inside you knock on the door to get in, another option was take the guard to open the freaking door. very inconvenient stayed.

don’t let the looks fool you, this place is a glorified dorm room where travelers are stuffed into small closets of rooms. the bathrooms are caked in mold and the pillows are nothing more than the idea of a pillow. what is more, they will pinch every euro from you, they charge 5 euros for a towel, they charge  store your luggage and the restaurant/bar are incredibly overpriced. traveler beware.

although we purchased a late checkout, we were woken up twice at 10 am. although i explained the situation to the house keeper, she knocked on the door 3 times and i could not sleep again. i don't know how a management who cannot follow the check-out time of a room manages the entire hostel. i would never choose again.

в номере было чисто, свежее постельео белье этих денег стоит.
из минусов : раньше 14:00 не заселяют, нет кухни. номер устроин так, что будет слышно всех входящих. душ и туалет в номере, будет шумно.
кухни, где можно приготовить еду нет, но есть бар, цены как в горде.

(translated by google)
the room was clean, fresh bed linen was worth the money.
of the minuses: they don’t check in before 14:00, there is no kitchen. the room is designed so that everyone entering can be heard. shower and toilet i

even though the location was excellent and close to lots of touristical places, we rented deluxe private room and it was so weak as the materials that must be inside of the room. like soaps, towels, shampoos, hair dryers so on.
even you pay more for the experience as if you stayed in hotel, certainly the facilities offered could have been better.

rubbish and items left from previous guests across bedroom and bathroom. we asked reception to have the room cleaned as none of current guests things were outside of their lockers but this did not happen and we had to clean rubbish/cigarettes/tablets/clothing/glasses ourselves

we were told rooms are apparently only cleaned every 5 days - which is absolutely ridiculous when bed turnover is everyday
floors, cupboards, bed frames, walls, mirrors, sink, shower not clean

no privacy on our bunk arou

didn’t have the best experience here. no social vibe at all, it definitely doesn’t feel like a hostel. the staff were not very friendly. at 9:30am one morning in the middle of my stay, the cleaners came inside our room and had the door wide open and began changing sheets etc. some girls were still sleeping… i thought it was really rude. we could not use the bathroom all morning… don’t understand the timing.  it’s also quite expensive for what it is. overall the place is clean and it’s in a prett
such a great hotel/hostel. we stayed here for a stag and we ended up coming back here twice during the evening as the club/bar was so good. good vibe and great staff!
i had a nice stay here in a private room. the location was convenient, the staff were great and helped me with a travel issue i had. i'll definitely come back the next time i'm in barcelona.
good rooms and good location. it was quite clean also. biggest downfall was the price, it was quite expensive

such a great experience.  our room was cleaned every day. the vibes are super positive. the atm in the lobby has the cheapest fees (use it). jose and gloria in the bar made us feel like family. ❤️ i will be back
i've had awesome roommates. all unique people who i intend on keeping in touch with after. the location was wonderful as well!

honestly the best way to start your trip around europe! everyone (staff and people) here are so friendly and welcoming! the rooms have everything you need, and are cleaned daily! have had a blast making friends and just going down stairs to enjoy the amazing cocktails (thanks jose!) and music.
can’t wait to come again!

overall pretty good, but expensive for what you get. could be greatly improved by some very very cheap additions like a simple curtain to cover your bunk or a shelf to put your belonings on while you sleep.

as hostel, it could be. as rooms, it is not an option. i hace booked by booking and the pictures of the room as not like in the web. and even paying 200€ per night, the value of the room is not reaching 50€.
i would recommend it. the employees are friendly and willingness but the owner dont care about the customers. i was absolutly tricked!

super happy with that one night stay! staff is amazing. especially alessandro from the bar, jose from the security and manuel at the reception! spent good times with them! also guests are all open to chit chat and hangout together even if you knew them 3 seconds before! also i left a card to my gf that would have arrived the day after at the hostel when i was already gone and they actually delivered it!!! lovely!
amazing experience! thank you
loved the vibe of this hotel and the themes! you can see segrada familia from the roof and the bar is super lively!  rooms have a neon-goth vibe. our stay included no breakfast.

the common are is pretty nice and they have a big space to eat downstairs with tons of fridges, the rooms are fine. the wifi is pretty janky though and connection goes in and out (at least on the 5th floor). the elevator is also super slow and they do not have enough showers and bathrooms for the amount of people in there.

it’s a nice hostel with very cool design, but it feels quite impersonal.
everything you need else than a bed you have to pay extra (towels, breakfast, luggage storage..) so in the end it’s not that cheap, and you feel like you can’t ask for a little thing if you don’t pay for it. i’ve been to a lot of hostels where it was much more “human”.
also, the beds don’t have small curtains for privacy, which is a minus in big dorms.
all in all, it’s alright but not great if you like cosy hostels.

i stayed a few days for a company event, nicely decorated and the rooms are clean and comfortable.

it is also right in the middle of the barrio de gracia. from there you can go wherever you want.

food was delicious, i ordered a burger. juana was so kind.
i will repeat.

when i first came in it was super overwhelming. it is not a small institution at all. not what i expected to be honest. it took forever to check in and they make you leave at 10 am. it’s like they really don’t want you here. there was also a vintage fashion shop going on too so there were a ton of strangers going in and out. there were a lot of kids too. when i finally got to my room the bed was unmade. i had to go somewhere so it was fine. i went downstairs and asked the front desk about it. th

the hotel itself is terrible and poor planning on their part split up one person from our group even though we booked the whole room and they refused to correct it.

the only good thing was the bartender josé at the bar, he was great and such an awesome bartender. make sure to stop by at night and try his ‘tropical paradise’ drink. may be the best drink i’ve ever had.

fantastic hostel and great facilities. highly recommend it. javi was really nice and caring. it would be good to add some vegan options to breakfast - i know there are some vegetarian ones - but not vegan unfortunately. overall my stay was pleasant and comfortable.

alessandro, jose, and gloria were all wonderful bartenders! blen and kenya were equally as wonderful at working the front desk, and showed me around the city personally. i had a great time here! the staff is exceptionally friendly. i cannot recommend a stay here enough.

super far from a lot of the beaches, it is close to the basillica but nothing else is very accessible via walking. the rooms are like furnaces and the ac doesn't work and no windows open. it's very stuffy and hot. staff were a bit rude and breakfast was dissapointing

half of the plugs on the beds don't work, as well as the cabinets to keep your luggage stored. came in to find another girl in my bed as hers was taken, had to stay in another bed, so i've left some things (nothing valuable but still) in my bed to keep my spot, came back and they were gone, and the staff couldn't find any of it. the receptionists were very helpful though, and the place was clean.

top hostel, rooms are good and mostly clean. rooftop and bar are top tier and really good to meet people. the highlight of the hostel is the whole staff, special thanks at this point of course to jose, best barkeeper known to mankind.
really cool place. nice rooms with private shower and drying area. reception staff helpfull & nice break out areas to chill if you don’t want to stay in room

really happy with our stay! we stayed for 5 nights, everything was clean and worked well. the hostel is in a really good location and it has a really nice rooftop terrace with a view of the city. would definitely use generator again!

i stayed just one night here. it was very comfortable well i had quiet roommates too. the lobby was full of noisy people at 1am even though the receptionist tried controlling them. it’s a very comfortable hostel though. will return if i need to

horrible, overpriced hostel: i've stayed in many hostels all over the world and the generator barcelona was definitely not only the most expensive one, but also the one with the worst experiences. i slept in a 8-bed-dormitory which has obviously not been cleaned for a while. not only clothes and towels and toiletry stuff was lying around, but also trash and masks. so overall just a dirty room! the staff seemed to be nice but unfortunately wasn't helpful at all and seemed to be unable to cope wit

the rooms were very dirty and the furniture was only slightly damaged. the smell from the hostel will haunt me in my nightmares for a long time. the neighbours were very talkative until early morning hours. definitely wouldn’t recommend it. sleeping on the streets is the better option here ;)

quite stylish lobby and the bar area. very pleasant and charming reception staff.
dorms packed with beds, no much space. the showers and the toilets in the dorms way too small and no ventilation. this whole place needs better care.
edit 27.04.2022: the price is too much right now but the quality is lesser. the small toilet in the dorm room was unusable for 2 days.
the reception staff also lesser quality.
clean rooms, amazing breakfast. somewhat close to the city center and metro. beautiful view from the roof. can't eat in the rooms though :(

churros were stale and just not tasty and the waiter didn’t really listen properly when we ordered (they also had no clue what we ordered once we went to pay and was messy). but the rest of the stuff we ate (jamón sandwich, hot chocolate etc.) were not bad. the outside seats are nice and the elderly owner? seems like a fun character although he looked happiest when we left lol so overall a mixed experience but it looked like a super popular place with the locals

we got 1 portion of churros for take away. the churros were not warm and tasted old. in total we paid 6,30€ and got 4 churros, which is very expensive. service was nice though. however cannot recommends

i have been to this wonderful neighborhood in cafe twice in a week. the staff are helpful and welcoming. it’s a great place for meeting up with family and friends over board games or coffee and cakes.
heard good things about their churros but that was not available in the menu this. perfect excuse for me to head back there real soon.

ideal place for merienda. i liked that they do small size chocolate and not just the big mug that you can barely finish.
also the melindros were good and the nata excepcional.
perhaps the service a bit slow but good overall.
they have some games that you can play as you have your chocolate with churros o melindros.
great place to go with kids, they have puzzles, some toys and a playing corner. they also have a shelf full of board games for adults. nice atmosphere but quite loud!

very cozy place to go for a warm cup of hot chocolate or coffee. the cakes were super good and fluffy, coffee was also nice and there is a small space for little kids and parents to enjoy. super recommend

awesome hot chocolate! hot the way it should be and right thickness. churros was a bit oily but tasted nice dipping in hot chocolate. i didn't try anything else. seatings were not too many. service was unfortunately too slow, to be fair, two staffs came back from lunch. otherwise, recommended if you are around the area.
warm and cozy place - atmosphere is nice, many board games to take a small break in a charming narrow street of barcelona - would leave 5 stars if churros were fresh 🙂
great local place for coffee and breakfast! it is managed by a family and gives real home vibes, with cute local regulars and many special platters.

beautiful place for a coffee and some sweets, alone or with friends. good character, good people watching, very cute waiters (as a young woman i appreciate them), and good options for food and drink. i bring everyone here!

great amount of food and delicious tastes. the owner were really friendly and attentive, we even got small fans to fight the heat :)

try the zucchini, feta toast, it was simply perfect, all of our group wanted a bite!
great options for anything chocolate and games combined. generous portions for the value. full 5 stars for delivering on what was promised

churros ain't gonna happen between 1 and 5pm. ok, well, nice to know that...now...and coupled with a "so, see ya" farewell, we decided to stay! the hot chocolate is suitable as an adherent for wallpaper.. and that's a compliment.. only, somehow, with all that bulk, it's not particularly chocolatey...the cheesecake has a terrific texture, but no discernible flavour..must be why they serve the cream and good jam with it. it all looks good, and the savoury stuff at the next table does too. the team

the food was extremely good, all of us made a great choice. i can recommend to try out the spanish ham and the crêpes. please also order the juices, they are fresh made and taste wonderful. the service was nice as well. the only thing i could say: in the front part it’s pretty small and a bit warm. they could use the ac more.
great coffee and natural juices. fresh churo with chocolate. order freshly squeezed passion fruit juice with orange.

went for the churros but we were too late.
regardless it gave us a chance to enjoy other delicious items from their menu. we enjoyed and shared toasted bread "escalivada" with tomato, cheese, peppers and olives, fried eggs and potatoes just perfect! ensaïmades con xocolata, a fluffy pastry smothered with warm dark chocolate, and coffees. all in all it's a great place with friendly hospitable staff. we were struggling with the catalan menu so they brought one out in english. great place all in al

read many positive reviews so decided to give it a try. but the churros was cold, chocolate was overly sweet and coffee was one of the worst i’ve had. you could easily get much better coffee and churros anywhere else in barcelona at a cheaper price. really disappointed!
a relaxing place where you will find a nice and chill ambiance with fresh meal and drinks. we were a bit disappointed by the churros but we still had a nice time there 😊
great café with vegan options and really friendly waiters! perfect for an afternoon coffee, hot chocolate with vegan churros or a nice healthy brunch. we will come back!
very good and freshly made churros con chocolata. endroit tres sympa. the owner and staff take care of the clients. nice neibhorhood, not touristic.
cosy and super charming café with loads of boardgames, vintage pictures on the walls and delicious housemade cakes. they also make nice churros.

went for coffee, the famed hot chocolate and churros. everything was exceptional. the coffee is super strong but so good. one of the best i've had. the chocolate is thick and tastes like good quality chocolate. churros were not entirely fresh but tasty - i reckon they made them an hour ago. if you got them fresh they would be perfect. prices were cheap - we paid ~€10. staff was friendly and had an english menu although it was clearly a local spot as it was full but we were the only tourists ther
excellent little place. very friendly and cozy. staff is really helpful.  food is authentic and tasty.
churros we’re good and the chocolate was not too bitter like other places nice location in gracia
currently closed for the august holiday. no notice, but will likely reopen in september?

we found this place on google looking for churros... they didn't have any left when we arrived (late) but the cheesecake was so good i have had dreams about it ever since. as you can see in the picture the hot chocolate is great and is well received by chocolate lovers. the menu of the day is 9.50€ and great value (2 of us shared 1 menu for mini lunch). don't forget to ask for the english menu if you only find spanish ones. family run business and everyone is very accommodating. if you are nearb

good place to have catalonia’s traditional hot chocolate, churros. but takes time to serve which is worth waiting. cafeteria has a cache antique  look and staff are always open to help as a guide to help with site seeing. nice experience with the food and drinks in this café.
the waitress was super nice! i ordered a small hot chocolate and 3 pieces of churros. the churros was freshly fried and the hot chocolate was rich and thick. great experience!
great place for kids. tons of board games  on the walls. kids got their fill of choco and more. loved it.
great place for kids. tons of board games  on the walls. kids got their fill of choco and more. loved it.

neighborhood spot.. good stuff to keep kids busy with a piano, board games and books in the back.

food wise, we just had churros and ice cream which were just o k
cute little place but cake we got was stale and they drizzle chocolate sauce on every cake your order even if it's lemon cake. coffee is ok.

this is one of the really nice places in gracia the place has really nice food and coffee and stuff are very very nice also the place doesn't has wifi food options are very good and so tasty and it's so spanish if you are passing by please go there and enjoy the place plus there's many games for all ages and this place it's very nice to go with your family or couple or friends spending time there is really nice i love it so much.

small cafe but cozy and very friendly.
yummy churros.
sweet little place with delicious chocolate and churros! kid friendly and a great stop in gràcia with kind service
try the savoury pancakes! i would love to know how to make them. incredibly friendly and helpful owner!
charming little place. great homemade lunches too :)

cute, relaxed-pace place. the crêpes are absolutely delicious and i'd go there again just for that. we initially went to sample the churros, but they were not so much to our taste as they were quite dense and savoury, rather that light fluffy and sweet. however if you don't have a sweet tooth like me, they may be for you!
we came 2.5 km just to find out they dont serve churros all day. i recommend to write churros times

just a wonderfully happy place to enjoy a board game, a smoothie or a hot beverage (my fav is hot chocolate) and a desert or a salty sandwich. all fresh, all very well prepared and delicious in simple way. highly recommended especially for families or dog owners.
amazing breakfast with home made hot chocolate with churros made at the moment. so delicious. nice place with nice people
great local spot! had churros for breakfast here and they were freshly made and really yummy! staff were super friendly too,  highly recommend!
we had a great hot chocolate here, the melted chocolate kind of european hot chocolate. full of locals, this was a very authentic place.

cozy place to have breakfast, elevenses, lunch, afternoon tea, or even dinner (before 21:30 i think)... the veggie hamburgers are great, as are the vegetarian sandwiches. i'm not so fond of the cakes, but i love this place. the staff are lovely and you can happily hang out there unhurried and even play one of the board games they have on offer. it can get busy, especially since it's child and vegetarian friendly.

the cup of chocolate is very good, no doubt, plus 3 small churros for a total of 5,50 eur... is a little bit expensive... and please try not to go on sunday afternoon, is a chaos of noise especially in the back beside their kitchen. toilets pretty small place, you possibly need to await to dry your hands while staying in the middle of a crossroad

great place to spend some time among the adults while your children are playing with the toys that the local is providing! the sandwiches and the crepes as well as the home baked cakes are delicious! they also have board games, vegan options and a small smoking section in front of the local.

best hot chocolate in the neighborhood. just be prepared to wait as it's a popular place.  very kid friendly and alcohol free. cakes and pastries to die for. loud at times but it's part of the atmosphere. sit outside and have a suizo chocolate. perfect

best hot chocolate in the neighborhood. just be prepared to wait as it's a popular place.  very kid friendly and alcohol free. cakes and pastries to die for. loud at times but it's part of the atmosphere. sit outside and have a suizo chocolate. perfect

a little disappointed after reading the great reviews - this is a cute local place in gracia with lovely service and an extensive menu, but the food was only okay. we had a tortilla and a bocadillo that were fine but not worth going out of the way for. they also didn’t have quite a few items on the menu that we wanted to try, and the pastry selection was pretty basic - muffins and banana bread pretty much. maybe worth a second visit to try other dishes.
fresh hot churros and super coffee. great way to start the day.

ive been twice: cozy vibes with lots of cool board games. also, tasty cake, good cafe and really nice juices. sadly, service was both times mostly ignoring us and unfriendly with no smiles/gracias/see you/common decency. maybe it's not meant for non-locals.

beautiful local jewel. it is a very good restaurant/pastry shop, but it's specialty is on pastries. this particular place serves quite the apple cake and the chocolate cake is to die for. the place is beautiful, full of games and even a piano! if you find yourself in the slumber of a cold sunday afternoon or evening, this warm place will surely take away the coldness and replace it with a hot chocolate and the slice of your favorite cake. a must visit in the "vila de gràcia".

great home made food at this family run restaurant.  some of the best pie i have ever tasted.  friendly service and menus in multiple languages.  it's a small place with reasonably tight seating so may be full during peak hours.

overrated. i was excited to come here after many recommended it. churros were dry and the chocolate wasn't anything special. the service wasn't friendly either. we didn't realize nor was it explained that one order came with 5 churros, so when ordered 4 orders the waitress decided to give us a dirty look rather than make sure we knew how many we were ordering. save some money and get better churros on the street.

seems like a traditional coffee shop. the sandwiches was good. portion for breakfast was just nice. not to mention the coffee with milk that i have was good too. will definitely come back for breakfast if possible to try out other food to give it a 5 stars
super nice location, however not the best churros. they weren't fresh, was slightly disappointed with that

it was a very nice experience about having tea time and even get access to those board games forgotten from our childhood. i got a very nice earl gray tea only because i got fever but my friends were having a great time tasting yummy pies and cakes meanwhile they were playing those board games.

a real cafe from gracia, cozy, friendly and home made. the pastry and chocolate are the highlights of this place both good for couples, friends and families. fresh juices are also good. they don't serve alcohol here, but you wont miss it.

amazing and familiar place. no wifi, they have board games were you can play with. amazing brunch menu. homemade cakes and pastries. it is an old chocolate places, i recommend chocolate con churros for those chocolate lovers. nice and cosy.
very nice place, typical catalan food.

cute little cafe in a local neighborhood, great service, and delicious food/drinks. we got the drinking chocolate with churros and a coffee, both of which were delightful. great place to spend a relaxing morning in barcelona.

maybe you have to go earlier in the day, but at 21:30 i got cold, stale churros that tasted like old oil and a small chocolate for 5€. not worth finishing. you can easily get fresh churros for 2€ somewhere else.
you can find there a good soul. thanks

best hot chocolate in town!!!
warm family place to have breakfast or lunch.

incredibly cozy place to spend an evening in with a huge variety of table games, cards, and even food to choose from.
they have no wi-fi nor alcohol so that you can really disconnect form the world for a couple of hours while you enjoy the company of your friends or significant others.
great cafe for vegan/veggie food, churos, muffin

small café in a narrow side street, off revolution square in gràcia area. some will call it gloomy, some will say it is cozy, it depends on the perspective.
very good coffee and homemade cakes. lovely staff who welcomes children and pets.
fantastic local café with delicious local cake "melindros" with hot chocolate

menu wasn't clear that chocolate needed to be ordered separately from churros.  wasn't offered and didn't find an english menu.  waiter did not speak english.

once order came, realized needed chocolate, told waiter, then waited 15 minutes before asking a waitress.  finally got chocolate but by then the churros were cold and baby was antsy.  chocolate was a bit bitter for my taste and definitely way too much of it for the amount of churros received.

food was good, but i've had better in barcelo

super friendly staff, amazing home made pies, sandwiches, hot chocolate... anything you order is very good.
i like that each time i'm there the staff plays around, making jokes, like bringing me the entire jar of nutella. keep up the good job guys
cute little place in gracia with yummy sandwiches, churros and hot coco. the only pickle is that they dont have ac. if not, 5 stars!
lovely place with friendly staff. the churros and coffee are excellent. highly recommended!
the hot chocolate is good. but the rest is really average, we ordered some churros and these were cold and stale. it is a nice a quiet place, but to the choc and coffees.

get some churros and a cup of melted chocolate (the big one is more than enough for two people) and enjoy a rainy afternoon with some board games. it is very loud due to the many small children but that should surprise noone so still 5 stars
best chocolate drink in barcelona, with a lovely selection of homemade cakes and sandwiches. and if you're more hungry, savoury catalan dishes for lunch.  super family friendly.

i love this place. great for families, also good if you want a cup of tea and want to read a book. the tea and cakes are good. so is the soup. no wifi, though. there is a sign saying no wifi, talk amongst yourselves.

i would avoid this tourist trap. we went for churros and chocolate. the churros were old (cold and chewy) and chocolate was marginal at best. service was non-existent. got in a tourist guide book, now doesn't offer anything of value .

do you have kids? it's a wonderful place for them.
do you like good food? it's a great place too.
floors could be cleaner, the children would appreciate it and parents would be happier.
nice and kind people.

its a really nice place to go with friends that have kids. they have board games all over the place so you can enjoy wile the kids have fun. the food is good, all veg friendly and no alcohol is served.

had a lovely breakfast here while in barcelona. although the crepe was tasty, it was different from what i was used to. i guess the spanish and french makes crepes differently. but tasty non the less and the ice coffee was great.

perfect place for a cold day, they serve some delicious homemade cakes, pastries, hot chocolates and savory snacks. yeah, barcelona is full of granjas and pastries shops, but la nena for sure has the best hot chocolate in town!!
this place deserves its high rating. breakfast, coffee, and churros are good at awesome prices. also, the service and atmosphere are very familiar and inviting. turned me into a repeat customer.

super slow & unfriendly service, but they serve a really amazing organic beer. bit dirty & grotty place, not the best place i have ever been to, but not a bad place for a quick beer or coffee. staff do not speak a word of english.

such a disappointment. stale churros and below average hot chocolate. my child cried after eating here because it was so bad. very misleading reviews ...don’t know where all the stars are coming from.  definite tourist trap.
great thick hot chocolate with whipped cream (el suizo) does not disappoint! lots of babies running around which can be fun. no booz but lots of board games :d the veggieburger is delicious!

we've been to this place for a birthday celebration. the place looks like it has been there forever even if the owners are young... the cakes are prepared in their other location (obrador la nena) but they are spectacular... the service was a bit slow but we were a big group. the staff is nice.
super friendly and inviting, very helpful people customers as well as staff. man on the next table offered to explain the menu, another reminded us of our bag. coffee and cheese croissant delicious.
the host was very disrespectful telling us there was a wait. he came outside and kicked us out to the sidewalk.

my favorite cafe in gracia area and in whole barcelona! i was recommended this place for its delicious biscuits and nata de chocolate - and they were right! i *love* it. plus, there's no wifi - so you end up doing what you should do in a cafe - socialise ;)

you will be waiting for the winter so you can enjoy the "melindros" with hot chocolate of this little charming cafeteria. its colorful wood decoration will make you feel like you are back to your primary school (in the good way), the perfect enviroment to spend your cold dark evenings. is better to go during day weeks since in the weekends it becomes way to bussy, specially on sundays. i especially recomended as well the sandwich offer they have.

love this place! they have what i want and are pretty quick with it, and very courteous.
a quiet little cafe offering breakfast and lunch menu options. nice coffee and tea selections.
cozy, homely atmosphere. tasty food and great service.
little local cafe without wifi but with nice interior, cosy atmosphere and good hot chocolate. we played board games and had a good time!
chill coffee shop. chocolate and churro were really good. no wifi but wasn't there for it.
really nice and caring people. real place, not tourist trap. prices acceptable and reasonable. clean and spacey and cozy.

place to go social dancing salsa, bachata, merengue. we visited on thursday at 22:00. at the time a cuban guy showed us few basic (and not so basic) steps, after that there was an animation. the place is rather small and gets crowded but there is lively atmosphere and live music. card payment starting on 10€. we didnt stay long so cant say how good the party was but we managed to get few fun dances. i recommended to try this one out if you are a cuban salsa dancer

best salsa club or bar
good to learn bachata , salsa , reggeton
people from cuban , very friendly

amazing place for dancing with friendly teachers and nice bar staff. the biggest issue i’d say is space, lots of people for the amount of space available to dance. so other than that, really love going there!

bartendenders don't serve any nordic looking people,
made eye contact with the bartenders 5 times but they prefer talking to random people than serving tourists,
of course everybody else was served around us except for us cannot recommend, this was for me really one of the most blatant displays of racism against foreigners for somebody that migrated here to live in barcelona this was really disappointing. this however is something you experience here a lot. in gracia latina however they didnt ha

i had a great time at gràcia latina's flamenco night! there was a great ambiance, people were having fun and the music and dancing was very good. the drinks are affordable and the kind barmaid made me a very good cosmopolitan. i definitely recommend!

it was unexpected for a weeknight. lots of locals there but all super friendly. my brother and i ended talking with them and all super nice and kind.

the bartender was the life of the party and even played ranchera music for us and everyone sang along. truly nice to visit again in my next trip.
always fun with live salsa music. small and crowded but the mojitos are good and the ambiance is fantastic.

i liked attending this bar very much, the ambiance is totally latino and welcomes locals and europeans too. i am catalan and i had a great time in it. the music ranges from reggaeton to salsa, bachata and other music styles from latin america. the cocktails are okay, the best is the ambiance. if you don't like places that get very crowded and packed with people, don't choose this place. if this is your vibe, you will love it.

wonderful live salsa! loads of dancing
classes also offered

small place good service, a mojito is €7 , closes at 2:30 am on sunday. this particular sunday i went, there was a dj that was terrible, played whatever the hell he wanted. maybe it is a place for locals to hang out and drink and only dance the music the dj wants. not good for social or salsa dancing.
good cocktails, latina music, always crowded

it's a small and cozy latino bar. they have free dance lessons in salsa and bachata for beginners everyday at 22.00 followed by live music at around 23.30. i have been there a few times dancing and it's very fun, you also get to meet alot of other travelers, expats and locals. weekends are quite crowded so i would recommend visiting during the week.
cozy venue for flamenco shows as well as latin music/performances.

love you so much latin community.
had a wonderful time there. this is the place for dancing salsa, bachata, reggeaton, merengue, etc.

went here after having tapas next door to dance salsa. they have dance workshops a couple of nights a week, this night they offered zouk and salsa. it was fun, and its a nice way to get to know new people. instructors were goodspirited and enthusiastic. dancefloor a bit cramped, but as long as its not too crowded, that's fine. unfortunately most clientel left after the workshop so we did too. will absolutely go back another day that's not monday, though :)

a bar which has free dance lessons, such as salsa and bachata during some weekday nights. the only thing they appreciate is done is to buy a drink, cause that is how they pay for the dance teacher, which is a really funny and happy guy with good dance moves
little space, big energy. it's perfect to know people who like latin music.
great place, lots of space to dance, good drinks at excelent prices
super fun dance class (salsa and bachata) ! live music with a great cuban band ! i really recommand of you like a latin party !
really enjoyed this place on a saturday night.  a lot of people dancing salsa and wonderful live band.  staff is really friendly and attentive.
lively pub with latin music, mostly salsa with live music.  excellent mojito, but not a lot of options from the bar
amazing place for salsa and a latina experience! so authentic and the party people are always happy and awesome! definitely recommend it for a genuine latina night.
amazing live music, amazing owner and staff, great impromptu salsa lesson. reasonable prices. must experience. even on a week night!
great little cuban club. offered free salsa and bachata lessonsseveral nights a week before dancing starts. great live band and good vibe.
very cool place for dancing and listening to latino sound. often there is a live band playing. instead of entrance fee a consumption is needed.
very local place to have a dance and also drink is nice.
super nice place with salsa and bachata lessons, really great vibes and later though the night amazing live music. recommended!
go here on a sunday night and enjoy a free flamenco. you'll experience the spanish culture at its best. definitely must go!
there is always live music, we were there one saturday and sadly it was so crowded. the place is cool but better go earlier.
good vibes and awesome music. go there to meet friendly people and have a ball dancing the night away!
nice little latin bar. friendly staff. social dancing weekends. had a nice, dancing and sweaty evening. gracias
if you are looking for live latin music.. this is the place to go. it's usually super packed, but very good vibe
great spot, with live music, dancing, and good prices for drinks!  solid for a fun night out!
great latin music. live music on fridays. some days have bachata or salsa classes. great environment.
a lot of fun! if you like latin music,  cuban drinks and dancing it's the right place!
was an amazing workshop of bachata at this place and super night out. recommended  (gets little crowded. but okay)
it's good to get out of the routine and have a delicious cocktail
fair prices and lovely atmosphere. we had a salsa lesson it was quite funny 👌🏽😉
it's good to get out of the routine and have a delicious cocktail
fair prices and lovely atmosphere. we had a salsa lesson it was quite funny 👌🏽😉
nice club with live music. drinks are kinda expensive though but there is a nice ambient.
amazing flamenco show and salsa dancing for free all the owner asks is that you buy a drink
the vibe is good when there are dance workshops but the drinks are just so-so.
music was constantly being muted or turned off, pricy drinks for no good reason.
too crowded, you can't even dance. i've been there couple of times, but not coming again
good mojito good place to dance a little if you 're bored ,little
good vibes, amazing music and everyone is so nice and welcoming
live music, great cocktails, free salsa and bachata classes!
amazing place and good mojitos if only it wasn't so tight
great place for an evening of some salsa or bachata.
great salsa dancing. live band on weekend
great place with live music. salsa and cuba.
amazing place
the better place for latin music!!! in the better quartier: gracia!
a nice latin place with authentic atmosphere.
best mojitos in barcelona
free salsa classes are awesome.
fun place to go and dance!
good place with good cocktails
place for chill up and learn salsa
so far so good
dope salsa place
cozy place. set with a lot of cubanism. they have live music for all tastes (salsa predominates). very good service from the owner to his waitress. i will repeat it a thousand times for sure.
good very comfortable space to dance all night
good place with excellent atmosphere to dance salsa!

the music doesn't sound very good. the sound system is poorly equalized or they simply play the music very low. at the back of the place it is so hot that it is impossible to be there. those who serve at the bar are too busy and there are only two of them so they have a bad face and are fed up with living :( selection of music from the group very very good.

very good atmosphere and music, very nice people and employees. small room, perfect if you want to go out quietly and dance.i give it 4 stars because of the heat, when it's full you can barely breathe and you sweat profusely. instead of installing an air conditioner (which costs a lot) i would install two or three fans distributed between the walls.there are free dance classes, but there is no sign indicating days and times, nor do they have it on instagram. it would be great if they put it so

extremely full place, terrible sound, attention from the staff is borderline and disastrous, i ordered some beers and the person at the bar told me that she can't because she is washing, minimum card payment €10, i will not return

i went to this place for a drink after dinner with some friends. it was the first evening of holiday in barcelona. what to say? i found this place truly surprising. while you drink there are "salseros" who grab you and make you dance salsa steps. there is a small rink to have fun and also make new friends. intimate, full of magical energies. go there!!! the only negative note: very small 33 cl bottle of water for 3.50 euros :(
good bar to learn to dance salsa and bachata, excellent atmosphere, the girls at the bar are great, the teacher is very nice and has a good vibe, one of my favorite bars in gràcia.
a latin place with a very good atmosphere, friendly treatment from the staff, they also teach free salsa for an hour from 9.30pm and you only have to consume it. i recommend it.
good atmosphere, with live music and drinks at acceptable prices. even at certain times there are dance classes

i loved it, i felt like i was at home, plus the owner is super humble, polite, the waitress is a sweetheart, i will go again soon, the food is fabulous, i advise you, the musicians are amazing, in short, spectacular, i loved it.

great place to go dance to latin rhythms in gràcia. it is not very big and there are times when the air conditioning is not enough depending on where you are.when it's full it takes a while to get a cocktail, the bar is also small.the mojitos are very good and varied. the prices are acceptable, although i can only complain about the €4 beer... maybe that's how they also control the capacity...super nice staff.a plus is that they have salsa and bachata classes several days at 9:30 p.m. for free!
