wonderful service! delicious tapas (especially the bravas). amazing mojitos and even has gluten free beer. highly recommend for an incredible atmosphere and great food.
great place and great staff👌🏻 gràcia doesn’t really have any pubs so this is the best and biggest place to watch football

a very nice place, very nice waiters and quick service. the food came quickly and was very tasty, however, the food was very oily and everything was deep fried. a little bit more expensive as well but over all a good experience.

delicious food and the best service, the place to be in gracia!
i live in gracia and it is definitely my header restaurant. you can find the best mediterranean food on their vibrant terrace and you are always welcome with the best staff smile.

i have been here few times.
staff was efficient and nice. it doesnt seem like the traditional tapas place but they have really nice food. i recommend it and i ll defo repeat it. thank you!

well, what can i say....the burger meat was almost raw, the pan con tomate a mess, french fries were already cold when the burger arrived and i'm still waiting for the ice cubes i ordered three times....nope, not again....
casual spot for dinner in the gracia neighbourhood of barcelona. i have to say, it was the most friendly service i experienced during my week-long stay in spain. the calamari was good.

seriously one of the worst places you can eat in gracia, everything in the menu is defrosted out of a bag, even the bravas.
if you go inside it's loud and humid as well
they didn't want to serve us because we only wanted a coffee. they wouldn't allow us to talk to the manager. extremely rude staff, never seen anything like it

tried to had lunch for two with my girlfriend who was having a little ice cream from next door gelateria. although already had asked for both meals and drink (almost rounding 50 euros), after 10 mins waiter said she couldnt eat it while waiting for our meals and booted us from service. well done. 👏👏👏
very bad food. the guacamole was from the supermarket, 8 euros for nachos for this. chicken wings tasted like old shoes. 1/5

la cerveseria was a surprise - it looks a bit touristy and is on a main plaza, but the food was all very nice versions of all the tapa favorites. would definitely go back - especially on a sunday in gracia when very few options are open for food!

good food (pane con tomate and the patatas bravas in particular, the bombas not that much) and very friendly and effective service, in a nice open location, can eat very well for 30-35 euros for two people.

pretty bad experience, wouldn't recommend it at all, bad service, worse food and they don't slip bills. there is plenty of other restaurants in the area which are far better and make justice to such a nice district.
just food. nothing that i couldnt do at home. ok for a menu during the week but for 16€ at the weekend, not a chance. there are hundreds of places which provide much better for much less.
good food, be careful of the quantity (small portion). the beers are (for this one that i’ve tried : catalan ipa) really good.
we spent there a lovely evening with the family, delicious food, fair prices, kind staff. i suggest to book the table in advance, as the space is limited.
good tapas and the mojito was nice as well. a bit over priced compared the average bars in the neighborhood. great service :)
being there watching champions league liverpool vs tottenham, you have to order your next beer a little in advance... 😉 great place, we enjoyed our tapas, very nice atmosphere...
we had “menu del día”. although we had to eat it inside cos the terrace was just for “tapas” and snacks, we had a lovely lunch and an amazing service 👍
the sangria is pretty good!
the best place for watching a barça game in gracia. food, tapas, burgers, bravas, you name it, and a five star staff. toy corner for kiddos, too!
great place, awesome service, excellent drinks 😍 if i would live around, i would visit it daily 😂
perfect place for casual local food with local feel. the place unfolds to quite a spacious one once you go through by the bar.
amazing mojito, super sangria, good people, great service, lots of ham and a lovely evening! highest recommendations!
food was not bad and price was reasonable. there is no break time, so you can enjoy it even if other restaurants are closed.
everything bad... food bad and bland, not tasty. service not particularly nice. i think i managed to find the only place in spain where food is bad.
menu is basic and staff a bit busy but it's ok for sport and local catalan / spanish basic tapas
the food was really delicious and the service so friendly and attentive. highly recommended!
bad service, bad food, bad price. please try here if you want to ruin your pleasant memory in barcelona.
the food, drinks and stuff are amazing. celebrated graduation with friends and had wonderful time.
tad bit expensive. friendly staff and decent food. nothing too amazing.
good location - food questionable and poor attention to pricing on bill - had to point out twice that they were overcharging.

good place to watch football nice atmosphere for barcelona fans
food are cheap and good
this place is amazing! jonathon incredible and very knowledgeable. we had great food and a great experience.

i went to have a drink and eat something with my girlfriend, really bad service, a waiter with glasses and long bear was so annoying, making stupid jokes, offensive ones, maybe because we are foreigners, i asked for a tissue and he squabbled.
fantastic menu of the day here...very friendly waiters too...overlooking a beautiful square.
terrible experience , worst calamari, don’t waste your time and money
bob on! very friendly service and fab food. we had a bonza time 😁
rude, mean staff, wearing see-through masks that do nothing, too. go somewhere else.
very friendly staff, the paella was one of the best during our visit at barcelona
nice tapa place on a typical gracia square. food is quite ok.
bad food, too oily, nit of my taste!
decent place, tons of seating so good for bigger groups. tiny sausages
good service, nice place and many screens to watch football, but food is awful
one of my favorite places in gracia !!! i 1000/10 recommend!
amazing service! food is delicious and well prepared
sold us tap water as bottled water, very unfriendly service, greasiest papas bravas ever
the worst place to eat!! very dirty place and very bad customer service, i don’t recommend this place at all,  very rude waiter.
very nice and central restaurant,  really good taste of tapas.
best find in barcelona. awesome authentic food and great service!
bad food overpriced. no more to add

the octopus was really tasty. artichokes were all right.
the service is not so great, all the waiters were in such a hurry.

good restaurant, the food was very good and one of the few places around gracia that we could grab something to eat around 3pm, which was great. the service was acceptable but not the friendliest to be honest. i did not like much the environment to be fair, with some very weird looking eyes staring at us once we got in for lunch late. makes you wonder about the usual clientele. i would return but definitely before 3pm 😂

the batatas brava was excellent! double fried so it was all crispy. sour cream and a slightly spicy tangy tomato sauce rounded everything up very well. the sardine on biscuit was very lovely too! must try the house vermouth. suitably botanical. fruity version is a tad sweet though.

promptly welcomed in with beautiful service. started with friend calamari and chips. then had our paella which was full of flavour, cooked to perfection. the menu included english translation. the restaurant itself is designed to be an intimate place to eat with friends and family. personally perfect place for a date.

such a wonderful place, everything was perfect! just try it, you won't regret it!
the staff was so kind and friendly, the service was excellent.
delicious food, drink, thank you very much!

great place to stop for a quick drink or snack. service is fast and prices are cheap. there is a lot of indoor space if you’re trying to escape the heat. next door to the cinema also, so it’s nice to pop in for a drink or snack before a movie

best calamares and patatas bravas by far  for me ❤️ i love the restaurant’s vibe too - feels like being transported in the gatsby era! servings were relatively smaller but the taste definitely made up for it!
nice local restaurant with great atmosphere, good tappas  and food. paella and croquettes were so delicious.  located at iconic street in la gracias.

normal food, exaggerated prices for the small portions.  for example two croquettes €7, or four anchovies €8.50... madness!  if you want to go for an aperitif that's fine, but if you want to eat go somewhere else.

i trusted the reviews here and was disappointed. we landed on barcelona first day and decided to check this place out for tapas. the menu was more expensive that i thought. on here it says 10-20 euro per person but we ended up spending 70 euro total, and the food didn’t fill us up. for example this jambon ibérico was 19 euro (15 euro average price at the restaurant)

otherwise, i admit that the quality of the food was really good, but we later discovered that you can get cheap tapas elsewhere.
great service, super friendly and quick. the food was impeccable and served rapidly, warm and delicious!! i will definitely go back

felt like a nice little local spot. it was nice to get away from the bustle of la rambla and the gothic quarter and finding la trini on the way back from the park guell was great. all of the food was good, the drinks were well made and well priced and service was great.
delicious food, perfect drinks, great atmosferę (smiling and nice staff). wanting to go back there! definitely, recommend!
la trini is my to go place when i need a relaxed and cozy place to have dinner with friends. food is great and service too
nice authentic restaurant with local dishes, we loved the squid, so fresh and tasty that we ordered a second portion!
we had some red wine, sangria, highly recommend the scallops, pulled pork, and tuna potato salad it was all fantastic!! service was spot on. ! quit & cozy would highly would highly recommend!

food was solid, we ordered tapas. service was also okay, but they did forget one of the dishes we ordered and brought it at the end when we reminded them. atmosphere was nice. a little bit on the steeper side but worth a stop
pretty good tapas place in gràcia, very nice service and great home made vermut.
i had high expectations but the food was a bit underwhelming. tapas and paella were just ok. the atmosphere was quite good though.
very good place! excellent food! just try it, do not hesitate

wow! first, i have to note that the other google reviews were, taken together, very helpful. the burrata recommendation was especially well taken. the tomatoes on that plate were out of this world. i’m guessing this place does great things in general with tomatoes.

the aubergines entree was quite fine. so was the bottle of red wine and the service.

we only have a few days in barcelona, but we’ll be back for that burrata-tomatoes combo
nice local restaurant with great atmosphere and good food!!
excellent place if you’re looking for a quick bite in barcelona. i ordered the roast beef and it was exquisite. definitely recommend this place if you’re a local or a tourist like me.
the menu del dia was fantastic - good typical food at a great price. dark wood panelling and good service creates a good atmosphere.service is excellent. wine was great.

very disappointed with the service and the food.  was charged e4.50 for one scallop when menu clearly stated scallops.  asked for no chilli on one of the dishes, it was served with chilli. overpriced. my recommendation - go elsewhere.
good value for the money. delicious food, nice place and good staff attitude.
delicious food, attentive service and overall fantastic experience.
we loved every moment of our meal here. from the aesthetics and crockery to the friendly staff and great vibe. excellent tapas. we've recommended to all our friends still visiting barcelona.
what a great restaurant. the staff were actually incredible. we were so happy we stopped by, and you will be too.

2 stars only because the food was not too bad, but expensive for the quality though. the waitress (40's) was absolutely rude! while we were ordering she rudely took menu off my hands, we would way more than the 3 dishes we ordered but she didn't allow us. i do not recommend.

my husband and me also have a good time when we go to la trini. the staff is usually super friendly and the dishes are always tasty and fresh. there bravas are pretty good, so is the pan con tomate. my husband loved the ribs, and bacalao as well. if i am to be critical, i would say the dishes are on the small side.
we had the cod and the ribs, and some rioja. we started with croquettes and ended with lava cake.  very cool and friendly place.  delicious food.
i really liked my gold cacao. nice place.
good place for tapas and vermouth, in an iconic street of gracia.
incredible food. beautiful staff.

quite simply, my favourite bar in the world 🌍
not just barcelona or spain 🇪🇸 , the staff is very nice and attentive with attention to detail which is rare these days.
i love the decoration, the old school vibe, the food is delicious 😋, the cocktails 🍸 and aperitifs are fantastic.
it warms my heart to see this place thriving

the food here is always good. really nice. they do tapas and plates of food. little bit more expensive then normal but it's quite fancy so worth it. gets very busy due to its location. croquette here are really good. had the day menu a few times and it's very nice
the crunchy honey aubergine goes crazy, burrata is better than in italy, and everyone who gave this place 4 stars or less is a psychopath.

amazing food, the place is super nice and the waiters are lovely. really recommended. as well is in the main street of gracia and makes you live the spirit of it. i could go back every week and not getting tired of it

these guys are not afraid to give you their honest opinions and recommendations regarding the food they serve - which means they care a great deal about it! outstanding drinks - they specialize in gin, and trust me, even if you think you don't like gin, let them make you a drink with it. tell them what flavors you enjoy and you will probably be amazed by how much you like what they come up with!

this places has saved me numerous times. when all other restaurants are taking their siesta (seriously?)
i come here at any time and eat many tasty  bites
great lunch place. nice vermouths, and some beautifully presented and tasty dishes (the cod was particularly good). staff extremely friendly too.
nice tapas, but the service was a bit weird because they were rushing a lot.

great food choices, great lunch menu that changes, high quality of food,  very friendly and nice staff, amazing price for all of the above. i was in barcelona for 8 days and ate 6 meals there (lunches and dinners!) and i'd go back tomorrow. highly recommend!
if atmosphere is what you are looking for this is place to go. very helpful staff. my dessert recommendation goes to chocolate coulant with violet ice-cream accompanied with glass of red wine.
great spot! good small plates & drinks to go.

one of the most emblematic restaurant-bars in all of gracia..i think there is no friendlier staff in all of barcelona, i fully recommend you have a go at their expert mixologist and ask for a twist of your favorite drink...it won't disappoint! i guarantee you will have a hard time wanting to leave this place! salud! enjoy
always consistent, and great staff. solid catalán flavor, great drinks. it's a go to option in gràcia. to be clear, not a crazy party spot, it's more respectable than that.
very tasty paella. shared one between four and a bunch of simple tapas items and beer and wine. great price and nice atmosphere
reeeeeeally good food and even better service. these guys have you covered. good at english too. for quality tapas you can't go wrong at la trini. finish off with the home made tiramisù. it's divine.
nice place in the heart of gracia neighborhood. good fusion catalan good. cosy and comfortable place.

mediocre food on a saturday at lunch.   none of us was very satisfied with our dishes. the beans with chipirones was fishy and the beans soggy.  the caesar salad was not even close to what you would expect and the tomatoes (why?) were green.  fiduea was ok but somewhat overcooked.  cheeks were underflavored and almost completely lacking the advertised mushrooms. bream was underseasoned but cooked well, serving of potatoes was sparse.    not a meal that deserves a second chance.
awesome food, great ambiance, honest prices and friendly people.
nice, cozy place to have a drink or dinner. the staff was very friendly and helpful. it's not very cheap, but it's ok considering the area and the quality they offer.
excellent food & excellent service  with a very reasonable cost.  very friendly patrons.   we're texans and had a fun time with an english couple & a dutch
the server here was so kind and helpful! a very cozy spot. we loved the kalamari and the potato, sweet potato, yucca dishes the most.
good food and atmosphere, prices overrated a bit, not a lot of tapas, almost no of them. comments about normal price are from foreigners, but there were a lot of locals when we visited.
great friendly service. delicious food at a great price. lunch time 3 course meal for €15! what a steal.
the ribs are amazing, they fall straight from the bone and are simply delicious, beer is a reasonable price and service was good. thanks for lunch guys

good tapas bar.
friendly and trendy.
service is professional and prices are ok
the place is so cosy! nice to meet with your friends and have a nice drink with some good and simple tapas.
great local restaurant! popular with locals and kind with strangers. menu del dia offers quality at good price.
food was good, the service was one of the best in bcn. shame they don't have a terrace to enjoy the nice weather. prices-quality really good.
really nice delicious home cooked tapas.
best bravas i ever ate, and lovely other dishes too
great food, friendly staff, reasonably priced. have to try the home made vermouth.
good food. beautiful, attentive, multilingual waitress. perfect place in gracia.

special tapas and 10/10 sangria
reccomended
i live in gracia and this is my go to place to take visitors for tapas. everyone always loves it, including me!
great  place and really good food and nice creaw. the only minus is small choice in menu.
very good service. good food. great for dinner or a drink at the bar.
great food, well made cocktails & warm, welcoming staff.
delicious food and good value with daily menu (10.5e). service was swift.
very nice place with tasty mediterranean good. good quality-price relation.
really good place for lunch, good quality and price!
really good food and a fast service, cheap for the quality they offer.
one of the places in gracia that i'd definitely recommend. quality price is balanced and the ambiance is vivid.
extremely rude and unpleasant staff. it seems that they do you a favor reluctantly serving you food. i will not go back
very average. nothing was bad, but you'll get everything better in other places.
excellent food and service. relatively healthy tapas.
really good catalan food. service was surprisingly fast.
ordered food and they forgot half of the order. one of our plates was delivered to the next table and for the other part of the order, when i asked again, they told me the kitchen was closed...
nice local bar/restaurant in gracia. the staff is very friendly.
great menu del dia for great value
great and cheap set lunch menu.
amazing place! great food, very original tapas, super nice staff, top barman!

cute taperia with creative bites and friendly service. the spinach cannelones were wonderful. the prices are good and the location is in the hip gracia neighborhood, with easy metro access and lots of fun boutiques, cafes and area to explore

my favorite restaurant in barcelona. the place is nicely designed and it's not too noisy. the service is friendly and helpful. but the food is just terrific. the unusual tapas of fusion cuisine are well thought out and balanced in flavor. my favorite are the mini burgers in bao buns and the salty chocolate.
nice place to have traditional tapas and feel gracia environment! we got a great time with friends, we ordered 8-10 tapas and shared them for all. food is fresh and tasty!

i'm sorry to have to leave this review. we had a nice meal last night, but our server intentionally over-charged us. i told him to add €5 to our bill for the tip, and i realized after checking my credit card statement that he added €10. i realize i should have asked him to see the amount he put into the credit card machine rather than trusting him, but he also should not have ripped us off like that. very disappointed.

love this place. we came here around noon and the staff is nice and friendly. had some tapas and beers. it was a nice place to go to after a walk in gracia. between 6 and 9 pm you get a free tapa with when you order a drink. sounds like a good deal. we will be back.
the staff were all so friendly, the food was incredible and the beer and sangria we had were the perfect refreshments needed after a long day of sight seeing.
absolutely delicious, well worth the wait. the staff were good too.

very nice and friendly service. they only a few dishes to offer, but you won't believe how high is their quality! they have real gourmet dishes for a very good price. beers and softdrinks are for sure available. i recommend you try the aubergine with cream!
i'll come back!

great food but expensive for small portions.
bar kind of ambience with a tv on.
very nice small spot out of the bustle of the squares. food was really good - got a little lost in multiple orders but was worth the wait. limited beer selection but tasty nicaraguan rum.
amazing tapas place with a twist! the ceviche with mango sauce is definitely worth a visit!

very nice discovery and culinary experience both on the plate and in the glass! we went back twice! the service is impeccable, the atmosphere warm and friendly and the dishes tasty. the owner is very attentive and took a moment to advise us on our wine and food choices. definitely a must!
good place, friendly waiters and excellent food. a volver seguro

secret tip of gracia. one of the best tapas and really attentive service. try the pulpo or the lamb. they have another restaurant jabato, which serves even more deliciousness in tapas.... both my favourites in barcelona.
amazing tapas decently priced and with very original taste experience
it’s a hidden gem of barcelona. everything we ate was delicious.
cosy place, excellent food and reasonable prices. menu is in english which is very helpful.

a classic in gràcia for tapas. with tuna takaki "coca" (thin cracker) and canelons (butifarra and ceps -meat +mushrooms) you can't go wrong. often packed - especially on weekends - however on sundays after 9pm can be very quiet.
i always loved this place. good food and better service. they offer a cosmopolitan version of the traditional tapas and food.... wine selection is short but delightful.
great service, excellent tapas. we tried the cannelloni spinach, butifarra sausage with a swiss/gruyere cheese sauce?, and salmon tartar. tried vermouth for the first time!

amazing atmosphere and very nice food, it's such a pleasure to come here! and the service is very attentive, plus prices are very well adjusted.
it's a deeply enjoyable experience - i recommend the marinated salmon, it's a really out-of-this-world experience!
nice little restaurant. good tapas and service. for the menu they try to be creative and the result is a nice step from traditional tapas that you can try in millions of other places.

four of us visited, thinking there was free flow tapas from online reviews, but were disappointed: apparently they served only one tapas with every round of drinks you bought. the tapas was some jalepenos soaked in oil plus a few pieces of cut sausages. there wasn't enough for 4 people and didn't taste nice, but perhaps it's because it was free.

we didn't try the other selections because they were too expensive compared to other tapas shops right

you might have a good experience here (the othe

wonderful experience. staff friendly and helpful. really enjoyed the atmosphere - somewhere between hipster classy crisp and local. tapas were terrific - grilled octopus and homemade potato chips were they best i've had in spain.
just amazing! the food was extremely delicious (vine and drinks as well). lovely ambient and the people there are very open and friendly
nice place for tapas and wine. the staff was friendly and the price was good too.
awesome modern take on spanish tapas, the sauces for every dish really blew me away! loved eating here, i'd come here again!
simple neighborhood tapas with creative dishes and a relaxed vibe.
simple neighborhood tapas with creative dishes and a relaxed vibe.

a week ago we had dinner at la xula. we had a lot of tapas and a lot of raw fish and meat. unfortunately, just a couple of hours later all of us started to feel sick. four out of five people had food poisoning. not only did we have terrible pain, we also lost two days of our sightseeing trip to barcelona. after contacting the restaurant, they said, it wasn't the food and it must be something else. we asked to get our money back ( we spent 200€ ) , but never heard back from them. i wouldn't recom
best place in town to grab some really good tapas and a glass of wine or beer, the service is excellent every time

excellent tapas - tomato bread, steak tataki, the catalan sausage and mushroom cannelloni, etc. goes well with riojas. everything we ordered was delicious! the salted chocolate (with toast) was the best i've ever had.

try their specials, too. they don't disaapoint.

pedro is the best in town and those canelones. mamamia it competes with my mum's dishes.
vale 100% recommended from the local mayor team
this place is great. the staff are really friendly. they do great food and the drink selection is good. quite creative tapas. we had very nice beef cheeks

biquini de trufa. you know you want it. the sardines with salmorejo are my favorite thing, but everything's quite good. excellent wine selection by the glass (juan gil!). fun, ever-so-slightly classy atmosphere. more expensive than other tapas spots, but more creative and higher quality too.
the food was good but overpriced for the area. the ceviche was delicious!
the food was objectively good, but the portions were tiny and it was way overpriced. the waitress was also a bit rude, we had to scream to get her attention and she seemed annoyed by our presence

very nice selection of good quality foods
the staff were polite, and happily taught us some catalan
we were served promptly, and each dish was delicious, i look forward to returning in the future to try more dishes

good experience. the salmorejo and the tempura zucchini flowers were really nice. as were the desserts, tarte tartin and a chocolate mousse with pepper oil on toasted bread. two people ate and had drinks for around 40 euros.
nice atmosphere, superb staff. enjoyed seating at the bar as a solo traveller. food is relatively pricey, but also really good, loved both courses.
great atmosphere and good food. a slightly traditional tapa bar. for each beer you order you get a small dish. everything we ate was tasty and enjoyable
the food is some of the best i’ve had in barcelona! nice servers and good vibes all around. our favourite was the lamb.
hidden gem that serves free tapas with your order of drinks. food quality is excellent and very friendly staff. highly recommended

we didn’t even had the chance to taste the food because the staff was so rude that we left the place. if you are not spanish you better go to somewhere with a more “open minded globally” service. not recommended.
very very good taperia. staff is super friendly and food is quality.  often very busy but if you willing to eat by the counter a super nice experience.
delicious salmon tartare!

la xula taperia presents us with high-spirited offering that madrid's renowned for in the shape of a draught beer and a tapa – that's a free bite with each drink – and mixes it with creative cuisine. their beers are poured to perfection, and their small and casual tapas are well-suited to their creative style. examples include the tuna tataki and mustard tart, and the 'pringa' burrito made with andalusian grilled beef, spinach and cheese.
one of the best tapa bars in gràcia. the dishes have a haute cuisine niveau. however regular prices.
yummy bikini, burrata, and iberian ribs, but a little pricey for what it was. would still recommend for a snack if you're in the area though!
small menu, expensive tapas for tourist. the food is not special at all.
amazing bar. cheap beers. and they bring you a little tapa

one of the best places to eat or drink something in gracia!
a great experience in barcelona
i do really love the food and the service! a bit too pricey in my opinion tho. still gets my 5 stars!
it's an ok place, smallish with good tapas and drinks. atmosphere is so so but ok for a drink. there are better places.
this place was recommended by a friend. the tapas were great and very filling. it is a small quaint place. seating is limited
a little pricey, but the tapas were really good, excellent service! 5/5 would come back.
perfect place for some taps free with your drink from 7pm till 9pm. as well you can order some specialties...
the pork ribs were delicious! the restaurant has a good atmosphere and the service is attentive.
loved it. nice place for tapas and some drinks. wine is very good
not bad tapas but for the price you pay (10 eur each) you can get way better in bcn.
that octopus will keep me happy for years! i mean everything was brill but you haven't lived till you try that octopus!!! 🐙
one of my favourite tapas restaurant in bcn. nice staff, very crowded, great food.
amazing food and very nice service, though might be very busy in the evening
absolutely worth a visit. innovative tapas and competent staff at reasonable prices in a lively neighboorhood.
delicious food, and friendly staff. i recommend the bufala with tomatoes.
it's a great place, the food is awesome, the staff is super nice and very knowledge of everything, really a place to go
the best pub for drinking good beer and serving a great meal in barca. try the zucchini crema!!
great food, great experience! the staff explained the food with such enthusiasm and the food was fresh and hyper yummy!

well the service won’t leave your indifferent... the food pre prepared ... the music simply awful

summed together.. reconsider
for that price food below average. service poor. no free tape, kitchen was open almost an hour later than advertised.
amazing tapas. our favourite was the burrata 😍
crisp beer in a chilled glass. relaxed vibe. perfect for a drink or tapas.
cozy atmosphere, friendly staff, delicious tapas, really recommended ;))
great food and service. lamb and sausage definitely a must try.
awesome place! great tapas and nice staff.
awesome place! great tapas and nice staff.

летом была первый раз очень  понравилось . во второй  видимо  сменили повара кухня никакая.

(translated by google)
i was there for the first time in the summer and really liked it. in the second, apparently the cook was changed, the kitchen was no good.
very bad service and an extremely rude waiter. food is decent but nothing special.
good place to enjoy some tapas and drink red wine.
fantastic food and vermouth. will definitely recommend.
decent food, no free tapas, quite expensive.
best tapas in town!  ask for what chef david recommends.
i love this place!! realy nice tapas and ambient!!
the wine is good, not so pleasant the food.
good: ambiance and nice personnel who explain the good bites of the day
very delicious tapas and wine
good price, great food and ambiance
food was microwaved
nice quality and varied tapas in the heart of gràcia

amazing seafood in a beautiful setting. would recommend the grilled octopus and squid.

single portions were decent enough...as a solo diner, i could easily try out 3 different dishes. the tinto te verano was yum and refreshing.

stumble upon this lovely restaurant. once we saw the fresh range of seafood on display, we knew it was bound to be great. there was no line and ample seating available.

we ordered the sea snails, razor clams grilled and the arroz caldoso it was delicious. also the octopus bomb and the small white fish bait omelette. diane the waitress took incredible care of us.

best meal we had in spain. ask the servers for recommendations. everything was perfect.
this restaurant will not disappoint. try the lobster rice or the rice of the day if in doubt.
i had a great dinner with my husband here.  we ordered cuttlefish and razor clams.  food was cooked perfect and enjoyed it with sangria.  great staff, will come again when i come back to barcelona.
great quality seafood and friendly service. grilled one was much better than fried stuff! and lobster rice omg hearty and yummy.

i visited this amazing restaurant during my trip to barcelona and i had the best seafood i’ve ever tried! we ordered so many different things and all of it was just perfect. the service and all staff were exceptional and so so friendly. can’t wait to return next time i’m in barcelona.

stumble upon this lovely restaurant. once we saw the fresh range of seafood on display, we knew it was bound to be great. there was no line and ample seating available. we ordered the salmon grilled and it was delicious. also the seafood soup, and tuna and tomato salad. the only downside was a mixed up order by one of the servers, who seem to be very interested in a particular group of customers. other than that, everyone else was wonderful. i would highly recommend stopping by.

came here on vacation from canada and we’re here for dinner twice in three days. it is so good!!! seafood is really fresh and price is reasonable. staff service is attentive and the place is nicely decorated.

we had grilled turbot and sea snails. sea snails were tiny; there were a few we couldn't  even eat, they were dry.
the fish was excellent.

amazing restaurant,
service is over expected, the staff was very sensitive to all request we asked,
fresh seafood, quick service,
very tasty food.
the owner of the restaurant joan hospitality is over expected.
we really enjoyed the evening
the restururant is very well designed.
great barcelona experience.
thanks very much

terrific seafood. the seafood paella was fantastic. the shrimp was almost sweet despite only being boiled. the snail was well made. the lobster was made just right. the clams had an almost buttery texture and taste. overall it was a fantastic experience.

also, the fresh squeezed orange juice was delicious and served cold. a little bit of pulp, but it was fine.

super content with our seafood experience at mariscco, we wanted to experience fresh seafood and they definitely delivered with flying colours!

pretty chic restaurant with friendly attentive staff. we enjoyed very much the boiled prawns which were very sweet, the peppers, fried baby squid and grilled lobster. the highlight surprisingly was the seafood cream, which was super rich and filling - super yummy! the chocolate fondue homemade dessert was delicious, i think they called it the cheesecake

this place for me is probably one of the best one i tried for seafood. one of the big pros of the place - the portions are super adjustable, half portion, specific amount of units. as a result you get to try a lot of things. price is very reasonable, and even lower than a lof famous, but worse places. service is nice, as well as interior (if sitting inside).

seafoods here are extraordinarily fresh with their own natural flavour and aroma. the boss kindly and patiently explained to us their wine and let us to taste before making our mind the one we liked.

if you wanted to try the best seafood and enjoy the great table service in barcelona, this is probably the one you should come.

highly recommended.

we’d doubtlessly come back to visit you again.

fresh and live seafoods with decent price . simplest cooking way with light salts and olive oil to make all the dishes perfect . will decently come back again. during the night i observe most guests are local people, less tourists can defiantly make trust with the restaurant
very nice place in a quiet area, not very crowded when we went there. the food is excellent especially if you are looking for seafood. if you want fish, you'll need to call and order in advance.
seafood was fresh and delicious. we would recommend the grilled monk fish and the clamp, don't miss the home made dessert (forgot the name , see photo). service is good as well.

highly recommended this restaurant for excellent seafood, we started with the fritelli peppers, oysters, fried calamari, spicy prawn (to be dipped with bread). we had their seafood paella for two which is so amazing, the seafood was fresh and the ocean taste is perfect! their desserts is scrumptious we closed with their cheesecake and coffee with milk. service was exceptional and the owner is very friendly and even offered us a liquor to wash down the heavy dinner. you got to try this place your

most disappointing paella we have ever had. if you fancy seafood rice with a lot of soy sauce - this is your place. massively uncooked rice, hard to chew and full of salt with no other flavours. seafood definitely not fresh. oysters were shockingly small. avoid at all cost.
food was great but some food is subjective like the hake and seafood croquettes were too fishy for me. safe bet is to go for their grilled vegetables and prawns. service is top notch.

unbelievable seafood restaurant in barcelona. my second time here and it was even better than the last. the service is excellent - friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. the food is all as fresh as it gets, and the restaurant is super clean and polished. highly recommended for a high end meal in bcn. it’s not the cheapest, but you won’t regret the visit!

food is amazing and i think the price is reasonable. our server (forgot to get her name we dined in 7/8, 6pm) is very nice and kind, even taught us how to eat the delicacy dish - steamed barnacles. the lobster paella is a must try (minimum order for 2 people)! also their scallop, grilled prawn and steamed mussels are all so delicioso!
gallician style octopus is amazing! excellent service and atmosphere is nice.

i had a very nice meal as a solo diner.
the food and wine were excellent and fairly priced. the rodaballo donosti in particular was exceptional.
i really appreciated the warm and efficient service.
i will definitely return and highly recommend to others.

it's been a nice trip from japanese to spanish food we started eating delicious japanese tuna fish and some tasty patatas bravas.its been a nice discovery in our journey to find this beautiful welcoming and elegant place to eat their stuff is extremely welcoming and warm,they made the best of it.
we will return soon with some friends for sure.
thanks so much for the great lunch and marvelous moments.

we ordered langoustine, razor clam and grilled salmon - all cooked perfectly. the seafood was also reasonably priced - mariscco has much better quality seafood, better cooking but less than the price of the more popular la cova fumada  or el quim.

exceptionally large selection of seafood, each of which was very well prepared. i ordered a lobster paella, some clams and a sea urchin. really liked the first two, though the urchin not so much, though i've never had it before, so i doubt it had anything to do with the restaurant's cooking.

i really enjoyed it, and would certainly return.

excellent restaurant. there are a lot of fresh fish and seafood to choose. we had some fish amd octopus. they were very tasty. staff is friendly and they speak english. we also order papas bravas and some bread with tomato - very fresh and tasty. for dessert we had crema catalana wich was perfect.

very good services and excellent sea food and skills, imagine me and my family came here two nights. the location is slightly off the main street,  surely the environment is definitely deserve a recommendation.

this is one of the best meals i have had in my entire life and some of the best seafood i have ever had. we found this place on a whim and i am so thrilled we were able to get a table on short notice. the oysters were amazing, the squid bomb was so tasty, the jamón, sangria, scallops, croquetas - all exquisite. the price is reasonable as well. i just wish we had found this restaurant before our last night in barcelona, i would go back every night if i could. i will never forget this place!

it was really good. the quality of the fish was really amazing and the service was also fast and kind. the waitress and the owner were close to the table for any questions or additional orders. we ate fried anchioves and small fish, pulpo bomb, grilled vegetables, grilled squids, grilled prawn, croquettes, galeian oyster and sangria. the expenses was really appreciated, because the food , the way how they cooked and the atmosphere were all very good.

first of all, i really like the ambiance and the decor. secondly, the food was amazing - tasty & fresh. we had the oysters, calamari, xipirones, lobster & tuna. really tasty dinner. i also loved the cava! cannot wait to go back.
amazing service, amazing food! if you like seafood, great recomendations and after all that a desert to finish it all (homemade cheesecake) this is the place for you

the food was great, very well cooked and tasty. the service was also very good and food came in really quick.
i recommend making a reservation (especially for the weekend) as the restaurant was at full capacity with a waiting line.
food and service were exceptional! freshest and sweetest oysters i've ever tasted. try it once and you'll want to make a 2nd trip.

this was our first experience at this restaurant - and what a pleasant surprise. the food was fresh and good quality - you could taste the ocean. it was a 18th birthday party with the whole family so we probably had everything on the menu. so good -
so fresh. service was top and the place great for an informal lunch. we will be back - also when not celebrating and just to enjoy well prepared seafood 🦞
seafood dishes were great! they also have fresh oysters. i liked the cuttlefish a lot 🦑

we tried the black rice at the restaurant, and unfortunately, it was the worst we've ever had. the rice was burnt, undercooked, and had an excessive amount of oil and ink. regrettably, our stomachs were upset until the next day. overall, a very disappointing experience.

disappointed. i've send back the fish soup. it had no taste, flavorless. the second dish: lobster with eggs and potatoes is very expensive for what really is. the lobster was the smallest one i ever eat, flavorless, tge meat was like rubber. everything was swimming in a lot of oil. the bread with tomato even if it suppose yo be grilled and a bit hard, it was moist and flavorless. crema catalana it was very watery. over all i totally don't recommend the restaurant.

i can't forget the incredible experience we had at mariscco. the seafood was as fresh as if it had been pulled from the water that same day, and the signature dishes were a delight for the senses. we enjoyed fantastic moments with family, all against the stunning backdrop of barcelona. without a doubt, this place takes the prize as my top choice among all the restaurants i've tried.
our dining experience was awesome. the food was delicious and the staff helpful and accomodating!

i had the lobster paella and the seafood soup. it was sooo good!! i love the fact that it came in a cast iron pot so the food remains hot. service was awesome.  definitely a good place to have dinner.
highly recommend as the food was excellent as well as the service and decor, in fact, i commented to the management that i found the restaurant very atttactove.
delicious food. personally recommend tuna tartar with avocado.
nice seafood restaurant. food is really fresh and good. the atmosphere is quiet and relaxing and the aircon is not a freezed tornado ! nice place to stay for dinner

an absolutely exquisite restaurant, the staff, the food and the ambiance are all lovely! very chic and cozy but surprisingly affordable, the staff went out of their way to please and satisfy us. the chef himself came to check on us. marisc co was a delightful discovery, will definitely come back on a next trip! absolutely worth it!
fresh and reasonably priced seafood. a good place for business lunch/dinner.
echoing all the reviews before. fantastic food at very reasonable price! my family requested to go back a second time the next night! great service from all the staff.
they used have lunch menus during week days, now just a la cart so higher prices. compared to la paradeta faster services, higher end fish and more expensive.

extremely good and fresh seafood
the service is top.
great concept
we will return for sure
fresh seafood, i like how they go light on the seasoning to not ruin the sea flavor.

i really enjoyed lunch at this restaurant. the fish was delicious, i ordered rodoballo wit salad and grilled vegetables. salad had a nice dressing. service was friendly and ambiance is very nice. if you are in for fresh seafood in barcelona city center, this is a great place.
amazing seafood restaurant for our final night in barcelona,  our waiter jared was wonderful and helpful with the menu. our recommendation is the octopus bomb @ bbq octopus.
freshest seafood and best paella in the city
i don't how everyone praising cresm of the fish soup, i think its gross! tasted like grinded bones and intestines. the rest of food and wine is good.
the food is very high quality here and one of my preferred fish tapas restaurants in barcelona! the service is very professional too, i have brought friends and family here and everyone has loved it!
terrific quality seafood, great flavors.

great seafood place in barcelona
fresh
delicious
tasty
good service
must come of u a seafood lovers
5 stars
loved this place. choose your fish or seafood and they cook it fresh. nice ambiance and great service too.
terrific seafood. the seafood paella was fantastic. the shrimp was almost sweet despite only being boiled. the snail was well made. the lobster was made just right.
the prawns are truly magnificent, highly recommended, we came at a fine afternoon, and the owner was passionate with very outstanding waiters
what a nice surprise! amazing seafood with an outstanding and attentive service. highly recommended.
all seafood was very fresh and tasteful. i would recommend turbot fish
food was just ok. the paella had just 1 prawn!!!!

good food and fast service. waiters and waitress were very nice and served us with a big smile. atmosphere inside is amazing! nice slow music allows you to have nice conversations while having nice food.

also interior decor is very cozy.

the seafood dishes are fresh and delicious, with a variety of flavors and preparation styles. the menu has something for everyone, whether you prefer raw bar items, grilled fish, or traditional seafood dishes. the service provided is also excellent, with friendly and attentive staff who are happy to make recommendations and ensure that you have a pleasant dining experience. the atmosphere is also nice, with a relaxed and casual vibe that makes it a great spot for a casual dinner with friends or

excellent service, food was delicious and ambiance was refreshing, net and clean. the mushroom appetizer and olives were so good that if we had not ordered food already, we would have ordered more and just eat them till we were stuffed.
english menu available and if you need direction, the manager or lead staff will walk out with you during busy time of dinner and make sure you know where to go. we were so touched by his kindness and impressed.
best sea restaurant i've tried in barcelona. lobster there is a must 🦞
the best restaurant in barcelona! perfect paella, entradas, vino, deserts and service! ❤️
best sea restaurant i've tried in barcelona. lobster there is a must 🦞
the best restaurant in barcelona! perfect paella, entradas, vino, deserts and service! ❤️
worst restaurant ive been to in barcelona, my tuna steak literally came cold and thats an absolute desaster!
super fresh. perfectly seasoned mains and sides. nice ambiance.
very pleasant, delicious arroz negro, friendly service!

my new go-to place for fish and paella in barcelona! met some friends there for lunch and it was just great.
super friendly staff and delicious food!

visited this place for dinner with my friend that was visiting and craving some good seafood and we are more than glad we did. the food was delicious, fresh and prepared really fast, we shared filet tartar, octopus and some grilled vegetables on the side and it was phenomenal. what i can’t forget to mention is the stuff… kim and juan (hope i spell the names right, if not i am sorry) were taking care of us the whole evening and the experience is unforgettable also because of them. thank you so mu
nice concept ! fresh seafood. fantastic service.

we left the place hungry cause we couldn't eat the food, it was that untasty! we ordered grilled octopus which we couldn't wait to taste after a long day of travelling but it was gummy and you couldn't really chew. let alone the taste which was missing completely!
starters were also not very fresh nor tasty, the only good thing we had on our table were the potato fries.

replying to owners comment here: we were walk-in customers, we sat on the terrace so yes, we were at your restaurant. as much

one of the few places in barcelona in which you can enjoy eating good quality food made with simplicity in a cosy and comfortable ambient. juan and his team will take good care of you, really nice guest care. great experience, will surely come back in the future

took my wife here yesterday for her birthday, i can say nothing bad, super fresh with no fancy sauces so you really get to taste the fish and seafood, we had a table next to kitchen so we could see everything being prepared. a good restaurant is not just about the food, it's about the whole eating experience and this place has it all from the excellent service to the sensible prices, also a very good wine list. from a dedicated meat eater, you have converted me. we will return with friends. cong
what a fest! everything was well made and suitable for each type of the seafood we picked.
oysters based dinner and wonderful wine to go with. fairly priced and absolutely fantastic staff. definitely recommend.

we read the reviews and were excited to try. but the mixed croquettes were cold in the middle and not flavourful. the razor clams were not fresh- you could smell it when it reached the table. the octopus was good and vermouth was fine. will not recommend.

one of the friendliest and same time professional services in barcelona. fish and seafood is fresh and very well prepared. the staff is friendly and helpful and willing to answer to any of your questions about their products. the place is also very clean, which is a plus for me, as i have seen (especially the bathrooms) quite unclean places around barcelona. here it spotless clean. cutlery is clean (which again is super important for me in a restaurant). i would definitely recommend this place.

decent food quality but not worth the hype.

service not so great. would not be back.

sorry

this is the best seafood restaurant  in barcelona if not in the world. the atmosphere is great and comfortable: the food is incredible and so tasty. the service is amazing. we had an amazing experience here tonight and would highly recommend this resturant.

absolutely loved the scallops and the octopus, though the rice of the day, the regular paella, was a bit to "ricey" and the rice a bit too wet, but the fish included in the paella was excellent. next time i'd skip the paella and go with the entrées, in particular the scallops, the squid and the octopus. the server was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and the bill was surprisingly low, 53€. i'd definitely revisit and may even do so on this trip.
great restaurant!  food and service were great, cute interior, and it was comfortable.

this is the best seafood restaurant  in barcelona if not in the world. the atmosphere is great and comfortable: the food is incredible and so tasty. the service is amazing. we had an amazing experience here tonight and would highly recommend this resturant.

absolutely loved the scallops and the octopus, though the rice of the day, the regular paella, was a bit to "ricey" and the rice a bit too wet, but the fish included in the paella was excellent. next time i'd skip the paella and go with the entrées, in particular the scallops, the squid and the octopus. the server was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and the bill was surprisingly low, 53€. i'd definitely revisit and may even do so on this trip.
great restaurant!  food and service were great, cute interior, and it was comfortable.

it was the warmest welcomed restaurant in bcn for me so far. i was bit worried about the bad reviews but the quality of the food, the service, the environment were all great. seafood was all fresh. there were not too many choices still enough varieties full of tastes. we were 4 people, fully fulled with about 25-30€ per head. it was totally reasonable. all of us left this place very happy! thanks for the great experience.

there is no way you can find better seafood restaurant in barcelona! fresh, tasty, delicious! amazing atmosphere and friendly, helpful staff!
always coming back here and always 100% satisfied!

отличное заведение, очень вкусно. рекомендую

(translated by google)
great place, very tasty. i recommend
fresh sea food loved it service was fantastic!!
so so good. our host / waiter was just lovely, so polite and friendly. we got the rice of the day which was seafood paella which was just amazing. pedron peppers were fantastic too.

a genuinely pleasant place to gather with friends! they have an extensive list of natural wines, but for me, it's all about the food! the dishes are incredibly flavorful, and you can perceive the creative effort that goes into their preparation.
the best natural wine bar! incredible wine selection, delicious seasonal small plates, cool music, super hip crowds and the nicest staff. it’s a weekly neighborhood spot for sure. love masa 🌀🤍

absolutely amazing place, great natural wine selection. the food paired with the wine was incredible.
really a vibe

go here for the best wines, good vibes and even better food!
the service and staff in general are excellent. ask for wine recommendations.
great spot for evening catch ups with friends.
lovely spot for natural wines and some of the best small plates in the city!
easy 5 star. everything was amazing. the tuna was my favourite

one of the best barcelona dining experiences i've had in my 5 years here. wonderful team, food, and vibe. i can't wait to come back again! it's been on my list for months and so happy i finally made it with friends from out of town on a whim!

as hard as it is to find bad wines in spain, masa successfully gathered a selection you will never find at the corner groceries. but make no mistake, your local día, mercadona or lidld have a much better repertoire for a fraction of the price.
alternative crowd, interesting atmosphere and a feeling you want to be part of that fantasy. not recommended for reality-lovers. i would regretfully like to go back, tho.

the wine recommendations were amazing — their sommelier was 🔥. also, every dish we ordered (carrot spread, hotdog, grilled cheese, charcuterie) were portioned generously & the flavors were surprising (in v good ways)! best chocolate mousse cake!!!

very special and unique place to drink natural wine in barcelona. the food is also incredible.
at masa you’ll find the perfect mix of local people and international crowd.
(best staff in town) 🤟🏾
liked this place. good list of natural wine. this pet mat was what i needed. fresh simple taste.
long wait for a table was worth it. delicious wine and even better food. great place to go if you're vege/pescetarian with plenty of food to choose from.
beautiful cozy space, with the best selection of natural wine and amazing food, a must if you’re in barcelona 10/10
highly recommended! very nice concept with great wine and singular food offerings! one of the must-go places in poblenou.
one of the best places in europe i‘ve ever been to. the food is ecceptional and the staff was super friendly. can recommend this one big time!
lovely place to have some amazing tapas and nice wine. the tortilla and the artichoke are a must if you.
excellent sommelier for a wide range of natural wines. perfect tapas, really nice place to be.

delicious small plates
lovely waiters to recommend good bottles
wine prices high but food v reasonable
the food is amazing, the wine selection too. sophisticated and casual, the best vibes in barcelona, there’s nothing like it in town.

simply the best natural wine bar in poble nou if not in the whole barcelona. not talking about tastiest tapas created by top chefs. thank you for the unique experience. excellent addition to the coolest neighbourhood.
it’s the best place in the world. amazing food and wines and the best staff. would recommend this place to everyone
smashing wines, great food, lovely staff. couldn’t ask for more
great selection of wines, chill vibe, amazing staff. nice sidewalk patio space. take it easy on the orange wines. your body will thank you the next morning. ✌🏼
great natural wines!!! i’d like more food on the menu and definitely at least some ac
came here with a very nice friend. gabriella was so accommodating & is a natural. pardon the pun
went with a friend a random thursday late afternoon. great staff, great vibes and great wines
simply the most fun place to go have a wine and some little plates in the city 🪐🌀
fantastic! lovely people, wines and delish food.
amazing wines, great service, best atmosphere.
amazing place, with a better service. ask for carlos!

spur of the moment meal and drink here.
lovely modern tapas and exceptional natural wines.

incredible place, a very different gastronomy and wine option in barcelona. there is a saying in my country that says "the house is small but the heart is big" and this place is literally that. you will always be received with a lot of respect and love. it's first come, first serve, so you'll probably arrive and have to wait a few minutes to get a table, but they offer you a glass of wine while you wait outside (a luxury).the owner and the guys who serve you are very dedicated and incredibly lo

ideal for lovers of natural wines. great variety. high prices .they do not accept reservations.very friendly service.despite being a menu that is short and not elaborate, it is very necessary that they install a smoke extraction system.nice “modern” place but high quality-price ratio, environment for foreigners and foreign payrolls too.

a place with a lot of personality and quality natural wines. it gives off a great vibe and is ideal for making a different plan and going out for a drink. in addition, every corner of the premises transmits a warmth that makes you feel at home.the amount of food is adequate and the sommeliers are very attentive. if you live far away it is worth traveling and having a good time, 100% recommended.

incredible place where there is an excellent combination between gastronomy and good wine.we waited 10 minutes for a table for 2, the guys, both the waiters and the kitchen, were very friendly, explaining what type of wine we wanted to drink, bringing it to the table and explaining each strain they contained, excellentgastronomy another paragraph apart, excellent i take off my hat with the mussels, an explosion of flavor combination, then the tiradito with mandarin oil, i wanted to take a whole
a very well placed place, super attentive waiters, a simple menu but with good ingredients and some very delicious drinks. 4 plates and 4 glasses x 50e. one of the best places i have been to in bcn.
super cool bar, with a different proposal from what usually exists in barcelona, ​​more cosmopolitan and contemporary. cozy, with good dishes and very good wines.
the food, value for money seemed good to me but the wines were quite expensive (bottle) and the offer by the glass is limited. good atmosphere and good service.
perfect place for aperitif/dinner. welcoming and informal. excellent wines and really good appetizers. to try!
it seemed like the ideal place to have some wines and good food!
very good innovative concept! combination of gourmet dishes with natural wines and excellent service 👏🏼 i highly recommend it
please come eat here. incredible, there is quite a line but it is well worth it

fantastic! a simple place, unpretentious but very cool. very tasty, varied dishes, and super well presented. delicious wines and recommendations.to go with friends/partner and spend hours of laughter, trying wines and small dishes (tapas type). the attention is 10/10, from the entire team, but special mention to carlos.i loved the cheese and kimchi bikini, the bread with extra butter 🤤, the eggs ❤️... well everything.thank you so much!!! i will return very soon.a bit noisy! but hey... it doesn'

it is the wine bar to go to in barcelona! great variety, flavors and quality sommeliers! accompanied by the best food! delights for the palate!!! they serve you like at home and have the best vibe! must in barcelona
excellent food and equal treatment, the vegetables were fresh, everything was very tasty
its strong point is the variety of wines (logical), although the tapas menu is not very extensive, everything we ordered was very very good.
well decorated place with a good atmosphere. great variety of wines. very nice sommelier. not very extensive menu, which for me is positive, original, rich and varied
the food is simple but very delicious. very attentive waiters, they patiently advised us about the wine.the only drawback perhaps is that the environment is noisy, the noise echoes a lot.

it cannot be that you sit down to have a wine and they recommend a €36 wine without telling you the price, but checking the vibe is regulated, and at the same time they do not have a menu. also, these are wines that are half price on the market. i left feeling like i had been hit by an axe. i will not come back

the customer service is very aggressive since they put too much pressure on you to consume to such an extent that you are not comfortable. my glass was half full and they already suggested another one… (4 times)since they opened i have come once a month because the food and wines are delicious but since they recently changed staff i no longer feel comfortable returning.

for a bar that boasts of contributing something to the neighborhood, all they manage to do is make a lot of noise and allow their rude customers to occupy the entire sidewalk without giving way to those of us who do live in the neighborhood and have to get out onto the road. where cars pass because on the sidewalk it is impossible, all this with children, strollers and dogs included.the food leaves a lot to be desired (mediocre sausages at exorbitant prices for the quality they serve) and small

one more place that is clearly made for tourists. although the food is indeed good, the prices are not for people from here, much less from the neighborhood. very loud music that does not invite you to have a conversation with the people you are with. good wine offer

the food and wine were good but it was impossible to enjoy it with the attention, from the moment we arrived we were supposed to know what we wanted apparently, then we ordered some drinks and we hadn't even finished and they were already on top asking every two minutes if we wanted to another when we didn't even call her. they pressured us to eat and drink more and since we didn't order anything else (my friend was still having her second drink), they brought you the bill and told you to leave
they serve various types of wines, healthy and tasty meals, unbeatable atmosphere and excellent service.
wine and tapas 100% recommended. they treated us great and everything was delicious.
if you go to barcelona you have to know this place. divine foodand a unique selection of wines. super warm space attended by beautiful people.

wines by the glass cost between €5-6.5 on the menu, but €7 are charged in the box. when commenting on it, the waiters move on from the topic. for my taste, unprofessional attitude and the place is expensive for what it is.
spectacular.delicious and innovative food.incredible attention. you feel the good atmosphere.music. people. everything super good.i recommend it a thousand times.

exorbitant prices = only guiris go. waitresses who quickly empty your table, giving the impression that they want you to consume or leave. they ask you several times to take notes, which means 0 communication between them.small place, very loud music, so it feels overwhelming. we will not return, let the tourists go
the best natural wine bar in barcelona. with a kilometric and wonderful natural wine list and delicious, seasonal tapas. seriously, a must for those of us who live in barcelona ✨✨✨✨🌞
kind and friendly attention. mix of flavors with its own seal. the mussel sandwich, the anchovy sandwich and the spectacular tartare. excellent place to share!
excellent place for tapas and exquisite wines! i highly recommend it, the attention is the best!!!
they treated us quickly and were eager for us to leave to free up the table. we spent 175eu/5px and they treated us like it was fast food. clearly one of the owners was somewhat impertinent.
i loved the place! delicious food! we were treated very well and the wines were wonderful! highly recommended!
exquisite variety of wines, surprising food.the only fault is that they don't have more tables on the terrace.
bad and more expensive than buying shoes for a centipede. i was hipter, the wines were cheap but one sip lasted me a lot, i'm a worker and i drink a lot. i would not go back

what a shame! a pleasant and hipster decoration that makes you want to be outdoors and yet... unpleasant service, only 2 tables outside whose assignment makes no sense. inside it's nonsense. almost nowhere, we drink sitting in the hallway being pushed around all the time with the impression of sitting on the neighbor's lap. all the conversations get mixed up in one big mess. the music selection is good, but the sound system is bad and too loud, making it stand out half-deaf.the wine selection i
amazing place and 100% recommended. super good atmosphere, high quality natural wines and very good tapas. the owners are lovely and you are guaranteed to have a great time. we will be back for sure.

a place that engages...... where one feels good right away. dishes with flavors and particular care when serving. excellent wine list... the only problem is that, before leaving, you wonder when you can return...

very delicious food but the experience was very uncomfortable as it was very hot! it's a shame that you can't enjoy all the details of the place having to leave because we couldn't stand the terrible heat (we were very sorry for all the staff who were also suffering and trying to do their best)
nice atmosphere, we took some advice but the wine wasn't that great, it tasted like water, a little expensive
the tapas are very delicious, the wine a little expensive
the best place with organic wines in the city! a great selection and a very relaxed atmosphere. a mandatory afterwork for all 22@ geeks! 🍷🍷🍷
fantastic! open in madrid urgently, we need you: your wines, your good vibes, your simple delicacies.

i recommend trying the new hookah flavors they have, the one i liked the most is love 66. and for cocktails, please try the malibu one with lemon and sprite.

not recommended. i organized an event there last week for which they asked me for a deposit, which they would return as long as we consumed more than that amount (which we did). the owner told me that at that time he did not have cash but that throughout the week he would return it to me by bizum or transfer. since then he has been missing, cell phone turned off, he does not respond to messages and the bail was never heard from again. don't be fooled and don't organize anything there at all. th

exquisite place, excellent service, clean and incredible, i am delighted, the owners are extremely friendly, very good prices and incredible cocktailsit's just ordering a song, a cocktail, a gin or beer.i'm leaving delighted, i'll be back100% recommendedthanks guys.

i don't recommend it, you can't talk, because of so much scandal and noise from the people, you can't hear the music, there is practically no space to move. very unpleasant
