this restaurant is excellent! it is traditional catalan super homemade cooked meals, all products are fresh, the salat is the best, and the cheese cake is soooo tasty!!! 100%!!! i did take the whole cheese cake away!!! you can make a reservation and its sooooo delicious! better call a day before or whatsapp, laura
great restaurant. great food, and friendly service. a true barcelona feeling. the place is here since you 1918. really a good neighrboury spot.

food is bland and the people who work there are kind of rude and aggressive, not very understanding and compassionate.
wouldn’t recommend to anyone.

we don't speak a lot of spanish, but enough to ask if they had an english menu (i think theirs is in catalan), to which they asked us to wait a moment. as it turns out, they translated the menu to english just for us, which was incredibly kind.

we had fried fish and steak with gravy and potatoes, all of which was delicious. the food came out from the kitchen quickly, and service was good.

muchas gracias!
the food is ok, but the waiting times are a bit long. if you visit with a large group, be sure to make a reservation.
beautiful family run eatery, awesome prices and you can taste the love in the food!

let's see, the food is good and looks very good, the bad thing is that there is a lack of staff because there are two people for so many tables inside and outside, the service is slow and instead of eating in an hour, you can miss it the time waiting.
traditional market cuisine, good quality and quantity for €14.50, the menu of the day. try the cheesecake, delicious! the service is a bit chaotic but friendly.
a decent restaurant. the price of the menu is very appropriate for what they serve. the food is well made and homemade, but a little salty.
it is a very quiet place with a charming atmosphere, very good service and abundant dishes, to return and recommend without a doubt, thank you
a very close treatment, in addition to having the best cheesecake i have tried so far. specialty: purcheta
the food is good but the portions are a bit small. the cheesecake is the best.
good food and good company with unbeatable service. bar restaurant of a lifetime with delicious dishes!
good and varied menu, with finger-licking homemade desserts. very friendly treatment, they are attentive and pleasant. the terrace is great in good weather, spacious. highly recommended :)

everything was delicious!! we went a week ago with work colleagues and the truth was that i was surprised by the value for money of this restaurant! the service was very friendly and the portions were very good, without a doubt we will come back another day!
very delicious food and the waiter was charming :)
i'll be brief: the best cheesecake i've ever tasted.eye that the rest of the lunch was also first class. super recommended

even if you don't "feel like it", go in, do it, a typical bar, very attentive to its customers, fast service, abundant menu of sandwiches, and the truth is that every day they surpass themselves in the preparation. all very rich and appetizing.it has changed owners, and although they are missed, the truth is that the quality is maintained and the site is somewhat better, without many changes...

it is a very cool restaurant but i have to say that, in the times we are going through, the staff should wear a mask, more than anything because of the risk we run with this covid thing. you can, for example, cough, and we don't know what it could be. better to avoid dangers, and even more so by being close to each other and handling dishes for customers. otherwise the food is very delicious. thank you! ;)
a family restaurant, with food that has a pretty good quality/price ratio.an ideal place to go often.
everything is very rich. we entered by chance and were pleasantly surprised. the spectacular flans.
very good food they serve at midday. good quantity, quality and price. we will definitely return. thanks and see you soon !!
very nice, but it would be good if they complied with the schedules that are on google. it's 10:30 on a saturday, and it's closed. we came from the other end of barcelona...
splendid, perfect quality.great food and good quantity, great service.
just right. good food but portions a little smallthe place may need a coat of paint and some attention to detail.

i am a sporadic customer and the discovery was incredible. the sandwiches are spectacular, ideal for eating in the morning... and at lunch, the menu fulfills the three b's all accompanied by the professionalism and friendliness of the staff. they definitely have a loyal customer base.

a real treasure to discover! hidden among the streets of the new village, we find this wonderful restaurant with market and seasonal cuisine. dishes prepared 100% homemade and of high quality. a gastronomic experience, at the price of a neighborhood menu. exceptional
everything is very good. perfect portions. service 10 very friendly and attentive. they are fast and you can see the quality and care in the kitchen.
very homemade and delicious food. the best in the area without a doubt.
the food is good, but they have a waiter and a cook for 50 customers, they make the poor waiter dirty... hire people, sir, owner, or work yourself if you can't.
a gift to find a restaurant like those of a lifetime. a survivor from another time. careful and elaborate kitchen. a place where everyone can be brought. 10/10
delicious, very homemade menu with the option to eat grilled every day. i love the grilled marinated secret.
great service and food quality price!!!!

i have known this family bar restaurant for 32 years, with the passage of time it has been improving and since the son has run it, it has improved a lot, he just needs to dare to transform it into a restaurant, which with the quality of its cuisine, in a short time he would be recognized as one of the best in his area, let's hope he dares to take the step.
quality homemade food. i will repeat.
great service, great menu of sandwiches and a simple but filling lunch and take away menu. it's true what they say about not trusting appearances.
quiet zone. the premises are properly conditioned. the best thing is the product they serve and the professional and human quality of the two people who serve it (father and son)
just perfect! the food is delicious, the waiter mr. carlos a showman, grandfather jeroni we would all like to have him at home and the cook, mr. sergi a handyman!
great price quality, highly recommended and great treatment.
very simple at a slightly expensive price. normal pulling down quality-price.
homemade menu food and really very good. the treatment of the staff is very friendly and close.
very good food, but they only have one waiter to serve the entire restaurant. endless waits
daily menu, homemade dishes, good portions of both starters and seconds, option of dining room or terrace and at a good price.
they have a very complete lunch menu, which is usually quite good. it is not the cheapest in the area but the quality they offer is optimal.
very cozy place. good atmosphere and excellent menu. highlight the rabbit in garlic x lick your fingers
always my pleasure. super nice service and highly recommended food. simple, but great.
very calm environment. a lot of peace. excellent service. like at home.and food like at home. exquisite, very varied.
basically the food was very good but there were very few staff so everything took too long, there were mix-ups on the plates, etc.
local for many years in the neighborhood, good service and good product, it could have more variety but it's not bad and in summer the terrace is appreciated.
traditional cuisine with sergi's personal touches. to enjoy without rushing. an excellent ember.
good food, very pleasant service, advisable to avoid peak eating times
great attention from the waiter, familiar surroundings and homemade food
restaurant where you can taste the homemade and very good menu at a good price, correct and very fast service
delicious food and pleasant staff although service can be very slow
impeccable menu! cheesecake you can't miss!!!
a very elaborate menu and homemade desserts, the best value for money in the neighborhood.
good treatment and good homemade meals at a good price. also very good breakfasts.
family restaurant with homemade food and very friendly treatment from the staff.
very good menu, and very good take away
very affordable and varied menu, legendary neighborhood bar
good sandwiches and menu. very friendly staff.
good place for a good and cheap lunch.
great homemade food. and very attentive. from 10
neighborhood family restaurant with popular dishes and good prices
good treatment and the menu is extensivei recommend
everything was very good. quality kitchen
good food and very nice waiters
very good homemade food and unbeatable service
cheap menus, traditional bar!
we ate very well, and the place is very cozy
the only place in barcelona where i have found jinseng coffee!
beautiful!!! fast and delicious
simple. fast service, attentive
casolan food...you feel like you're in a top class family!!!!
correct menu without further ado
good for breakfast and lunch
restaurant with tradition

in one week holiday time, twice we have had a dinner.  the food is good and their hospitality is amazing. we don't speak spanis but the waiter took all the time translating the menu (despite an english menu was available). also the location is very nice.
nice restaurant with decent prices. almost all their menu can be ordered gluten free, including pizzas and croquettes.

unfriendly service, bad service!!!
very small portions for the price and not the best quality.
really nice staff, nice little terrace and the food was really good. pleasently surprised!
overpriced small portions, unfriendly staff
plenty of gluten free options. including pizza!
lovely local food. catalan menu.

book before going especially if it is during the weekend. local with terrace, next to the beach. convenient if you have spent the morning in the sand and want a good dish. the rice is very good and tasty. the only bad thing about this place is the eternal wait for the dishes and/or drinks, whatever the dish chosen, it can take up to 30 minutes. otherwise very good.

great lunch menu, the treatment by the employees is exquisite.the price for the weekday menu is 12.90 euros, and it is clear that the raw materials are of good quality.they also have a good terrace for sunny days.

we enjoyed a very pleasant dinner. the treatment of the waiters was impeccable, very close and at the same time very professional. very delicious dinner. and the terrace is comfortable, although it needs some renovation. the fried squid and the very delicious rice dishes.

excellent food and place! canned rice is perfection! but above all, the attention of the majestic majo, an adorable lady who recommended what to choose and made the moment even more pleasant. thank you!! we will be back!
excellent restaurant, with a quality weekday menu (€12.50), very friendly staff, they have vegetarian and vegan dishes

we had a spectacular dinner, elaborate and delicious food, with different dishes and details such as "garum", a different sauce that i have never tried and we loved it, the treatment of the waiter and the owners was perfect.the stek tartar......impressive...we will repeat!!!!
we really liked the food, excellent location, the only drawback was that the service was not good, i guess the employee was not having a good day, otherwise the food was very good
a perfect space for a quiet dinner with good food on the table
the food is well prepared, but the portions seem small to me. the right deal.
the truth is that i don't recommend it, in the gastronomic sense, then as a cocktail bar i don't know. only this is on the menu of the day, and count 12 euros with something. no comments
reference site in masnou, it has incredible charm. food of great quality and preparation

beautiful site. an old house with coffered ceilings, a warm atmosphere with modern touches in the lamps that achieve a harmonious whole. a patio in front where the tables are dispersed orderly among trees, hedges, flowers and provide refreshing and natural shade as well as feeling like one in a family garden. precious! and the food...spectacular i would have repeated the other dishes on the menu. what i ordered was so good that just thinking that it would be the same with the other dishes, just

cozy place with good menu and varieties. good cuisine and good products. in summer they have a terrace and dinners are very pleasant. always reserve before you go. the bad thing about the place is parking, which is all pedestrian around it and narrow lanes, so you leave your car very far away.

very good cuisine, exquisite dishes at reasonable prices, constantly evolving menu, good atmosphere. i only go occasionally when i can afford it and i feel like enjoying the food. i advise not to miss the onion soup and their rice dishes, each one more spectacular.

the quality of the food is very good, i am not going to say otherwise, both the starters and the rice dishes are very good. the shame is that the service is not professional, with a multitude of errors that make you demand everything little by little, lack of cutlery, glasses, bread, drinks...but the most important point that makes this score worth it is the exasperating slowness of the kitchen, it is incredibly slow, and makes the experience in the restaurant terrible and not worth returning.i

awful. they see you waiting at the door and they ignore you. they are rude and they treat you badly. it takes them a million to take your note and bring you the letter. the owner is stupid and arrogant. it seems that they are only interested in the type of customer that is regular (i'm assuming) and posh, in addition to the owner or boss in the middle of the terrace scolding and disrespecting two of the waitresses in a bad way. it's a shame because the site is very cool. i hope the food is at l

it's a shame that they let the quality of this place go down so much, the only good thing they keep is the terrace. service that makes you feel uncomfortable and that serves you with very little enthusiasm, small portions and very fair quality. if you ask for ketchup to accompany the fries, they charge you for it. anyway... i loved going there but i won't go back.

i really liked the frozen ginger for the tuna tataki. the quality of the product is very good. the grilled octopus is delicious. perfect personal attention. to put something not so good, the noise at times from the national highway. total for 2 people, 75 euros, it would have been better if it had cost around 60 something, but i was happy to pay it. thank you masvell

they are very slow but that is not the worst. the treatment received by the owner was shameful, yelling for politely telling her that the amount of rissotto was very small, her response was loudly that she has to pay a lot of taxes and vat declarations, etc. to the treasury. (we're talking about a €14 mushroom rice dish where they serve you an amount that even a child will leave hungry). additionally, when clearing the plates, he offered the rissotto customer the leftovers from the rest of the

we went for lunch with two menus. beautiful house, very nice, although the service is slow and very unprofessional. and that there were no people. i don't know what must happen in a day of many services. we couldn't have coffee because we didn't have time..two hours for lunch.it's a shame, because the food is pretty good.we hope these constructive criticisms are positive to improve.

it's as if you were at home, if you want a beer you'd better go get it from the refrigerator, because if you wait for it to be served...i've also had the misfortune of trying to eat here. a very nice place wasted with a kitchen that i want but i can't at prices that i can afford. disastrous result: empty wallet and stomach.

the pizzas in this restaurant are very good, and it is very nice to dine on the terrace in the summer, although being a restaurant on the n-ii, it is a little noisier than desirable. they also offer a weekly menu which, without being one of the best, is not bad.

we will not return to this restaurant mainly because of the treatment received from the owner. we ordered tuna tataki and the portions were very thin. we rejected the dish and the woman became defensive, exposing us to other customers.

overpriced prices, child portion...unprofessional service like clearing the plate while the other person is still eating or 6 people serving but going around in circles. only speak catalan..no goodbye or thank you. above all, remember to take mosquito repellent.

12 and i eat for a menu like this... and i order a beer (1/3) and the waitress tells me that it is not on the menu... it's just that things are about margins... the fresh sea bass on the menu. it is not freshly caught. what a mania for boasting about freshness... with how nice it would be to say... "tasty" grilled sea bass! the restaurant terrace is the best. the shade of two plane trees are the delight of the restaurant. without excesses, almost 17 euros. a little expensive, but in the month o

extremely slow service... we entered at 2pm and they didn't serve us until 3.15pm. small portions. the pizzas are cigarette paper...and the calcone is ridiculously small (dumpling size). good treatment by the waiters, and bad treatment by the owner...arrogant and arrogant. if you are hungry, don't go, you will die waiting, we left without ordering dessert or coffee for fear of putting down roots there...
a bit pricey, but the terrace is worth it. live music on summer nights

simply acceptable quality, small portions and high prices (some very simple bravas: €6.9).all this together with a service that tries with good will but lacks personnel, makes mistakes, and goes very, very slow.we will not return.

i will never go back. several tables have complained about the terrible service (they returned the change badly and the slowness was incredible). first of all, we had to wait almost a quarter of an hour for them to take notice of us. as if that wasn't enough, we had to wait another 20 minutes for them to bring us the second one. the owner lady has been very unpleasant and instead of apologizing to us and the other customers she has justified herself by saying that it was hot and that we were th

very good experience, there were 4 of us and we made some first-class tapas and different second-class rice dishes, all delicious. dessert, a tiramisu, a strawberry infusion with ice cream; a tarte tatin and a natural fruit salad, all delicious. all washed down with a spectacular cava sangria and 4 coffees to finish. all in all 132,-€ ... it's not cheap ... but really the cuisine is first class ... and the service very attentive.

it is an exceptional place, ramón is attentive and delicate in his treatment as in his kitchen. not far behind are the rest of the team who advise you on dishes and wines in an excellent way. without a doubt one of the best restaurants in maresme.

we were 3 friends and a 1-year-old girl and after 36 hours the adults started vomiting and having diarrhea and the girl had a little diarrhea. gastroenteritis of infectious origin. calling for a week to report and no one picks up the phone. a nightmare.

i went with some old university friends, ...and the food was very good, traditional. we ordered two different rice dishes: marinera and sepietes (black rice), very tasty and well cooked 👍🏆...before the rice dishes some tapas and homemade sangria to liven up. the tapas with capital letters, bravas, encenalls de carxofes, pà amb tomaquet, croquetas, embotits...quite correct. the sangria with good color, balanced, resultona...lacked a little more fruit🍊🍏🙄, but good. they invited us to some shots,

if it weren't for the terrace the place would be left without diners!! the menu is not bad for a "beach" place, although the price-quantity ratio leaves a lot to be desired!! the wait time for service is exasperating. they tell you that it is 20mn for a rice but it turns out to be more than double and to make matters worse the waiters are very few attentive and friendly.go so as not to return the truth!!

we tasted different rices, there were 4 of us and we shared three rices, excellent wine and mussels starters with coca bread, we rounded it off with 3 more desserts and coffees. in total 30 euros per head. the attention has been excellent, they have explained the secret of each rice and they have been concerned at all times.
a classic restaurant located next to the el masnou casino, we were noticed after half an hour of waiting, the dishes were decent, but the quality did not live up to its rather high price.

correct food, but scarce and expensive. i ordered risotto, a very small portion, i mentioned it politely to the owner and she treated us badly and shouted. they should take care of customer service, as well as the portions. i do not recommend it, the masvell is not what it was.

i had dinner yesterday by chance and i was delighted. the place is beautiful, the service is attentive and friendly and the owner is pleasant and eager to chat. tataki, masnou pizza and entrecôte with a cava sangria, for dessert a chocolate cake with crème anglaise and two coffees, everything rose to around €60, a more than correct price. i will return for sure!!!

i like to eat there, the menu of the day is perfect, there is always something to choose from that i like. you can be outside in a patio with some trees that give you good shade in summer or inside which is very good. the service has improved and it is appreciated. the price is also good.

dining on the patio is a highly recommended experience. we had no problems with the service, being well attended to. ajoblanco, salmorejo, fried squid and octopus a la parmentier: very good! we liked seeing the head waiter around the patio (the owner?) discreetly supervising and saying goodbye to the diners.

fast service but very little value for money, beer grande is media, bread in advance 3 slices to share with 3 people, pasta half plate with sauce with almost no taste, not all staff are friendly and at checkout it took 5 minutes for the cash register worked.

slow, unprofessional, rude and very bad service. but the worst (difficult but yes, worse!) was when the housekeeper came out (i guess, she didn't show up) and in a totally aggressive attitude (with her fists on the table and in front of my face, like a gorilla) that defends territory) has been shouting, threatening, with a total disrespect that is alarming.disaster!

the customer service is terrible, very low quality-price ratio, the lowest in the area from my point of view. very expensive and little on the plate. there are other restaurants that deserve more attention in the area. never again! not recommended at all.

service from the waiters correct, but the treatment of the owner poor. and several accidental errors when presenting the account. it happened to me, and to other friends in my gang. sorry i won't be back.
quite varied weekday menu, and with a good quality/price ratio (€12.50).best of all, the terrace is very spacious and pleasant.

restaurant next to the masnou casino. nice place with outdoor garden. correct menu with seasonal specialties and suggestions. affordable price and friendly service. good place to share with friends (preferable with reservation, since it is not very big).
excellent service and family treatment. the staff is trained in allergy issues and the menu shows dishes suitable for celiacs. they also have vegan dishes.
cozy patio where you can eat and have an exquisite evening

rating: correct (3 out of 5)feature: no surprisesquality: standard (3 out of 5)--local: on paseo de masnou you will find this restaurant already established in the town of maresme. the place has a large and refreshing summer terrace and the interior is reminiscent of a traditional restaurant.food: for a town restaurant it's not bad. the pizzas are good and if you order another dish (meat, fish) don't expect to be surprised but you can eat it.price: the price is correct, about €15 per diner.conc

not recommended in summer, it takes an hour and a half to serve you, if you complain to the owner, she will scold you by telling you that you are impatient because you are hot and hungry, in a more than arrogant tone.... unfortunate! the waitresses are very nice, it's a shame they have to put up with the owner's bad manners... advice: look for another restaurant.

i have tried the best paellas in this restaurant, apart from the typical ones they have soupy rice which is amazing, the coca bread is another highlight and the starters look very good, the price is around 20 - 25 per diner, if we talk of some first course and a good paella/soupy rice, in summer i recommend booking as sometimes it gets very crowded.
nice place for a summer dinner under the trees. correct service and varied menu, we went during the main festival and were very satisfied. convenient to reserve.
we have eaten a menu and we did not like the quality of the products at all. the outdoor terrace space is the only pleasant thing. not even the attention is worth it. i do not recommend it
the dishes are well prepared and delicious!! i was a little shocked by the format of the letter because the image doesn't fit the site at all. i was surprised to see that they serve takeout pizzas.
beautiful place, the food is very good, but in small quantities, if you don't eat it, you are very hungry, a piece of pam torrada costs 2.35 and i find it very expensive.the rest is perfect

it can't be that they charge you €17 for a plate of monkfish and that the piece they give you turns out to be frozen and that when they serve it to you it's still frozen.and that they don't apologize in any way or pay you any kind of attention.
calçot open buffet menu. the quality of the wine was weak but the sauce and calçots were very good. price is a bit high but if you eat a lot it's worth it
restaurant with a very pleasant terrace, between trees and the old house in the background. cockroaches a 10!! with alella wine and very tasty lobster noodles!!!

it is a very good restaurant.they have a patio where you can have a very comfortable dinner, there is food for people with gluten intolerance (gluten intolerance) and the staff is very attentive. precise quality is very good.

we made a table reservation and when we arrived they told us to sit wherever we wanted, leaves from the trees all over the place, discussions between the boss and the employees, some waiters with unfriendly faces, and as if the task was not theirs. very unfriendly, exonerating some.nas
there were free tables and we were seated in a corner next to the toilets. very good pizzas and hamburgers. we will not return because we were not comfortable

very nice for lunch or dinner, mediterranean cuisine, with a terrace, but be careful that leaves fall from the trees on the table and in the drink depending on where you stand. avoid being under trees!
ridiculous portions so you can't even enjoy the deliciousness of the food, the price is expensive for 4 literal tablespoons of soupy rice in this case, and you wait 1 hour between dishes.
the place is very beautiful. especially the outside part. there is no coverage inside or wifi. regular attention. the food good. something expensive

today we went to eat and the galician entrecot of 250gr., 150gr. of bone and 50 gr. of entrecot, in addition to dry and with a bad color, when commenting about it, they did not even pay any attention to us, it is evidently that they don't care about the customers, only making money... a shame, since the place is beautiful
very good food, good service although some portions have been made a little smaller than before.
cozy place although not entirely well exploited. very slow service, but very good treatment. fair food at a high price.
terrible service. we waited 40 minutes for an amianida and after complaining the manager came out in an ironic and borde plan. not recommended
market cuisine and proximity. ramon the owner takes very good care of all the customers. good terrace and very central

they should rethink the business, saving on staff does not make any profits, the owner is arrogant and arrogant, if you like it, fine, and if not, look for another place... of course... she tells you once you have paid 😉
very good restaurant. very good quality homemade food! very good treatment and with a perfect terrace for summer
we were a group of 12 people and the dinner was quite good and the main course was of quality. i was surprised that the restaurant was completely empty.
the food is very good, especially the desserts. a little expensive for my taste but very delicious.
good food but pretty lousy service. we went to eat and it took us an hour to serve us. very disappointed.
quality daily menu. interesting menu at an affordable price. interior of the picturesque place
very good food, made with quality products. a good place to go to eat.
the service has always been excellent. medium-high prices but with quality: i recommend the pizzas.
restaurant with a charming garden, ideal for eating al fresco, the menu for €12 is perfect, and the service is very good and friendly, i recommend it
it is eaten quite well on the daily menu, although small quantities, there are seconds for vegans (important)
gluten-free food, almost the entire menu is adaptable and so is the menu, the service is not very good, some waitresses with long nails that are not very well maintained, the food is ok...
very good food and good price. fairly complete menu. house staff not pleasant
it is in the center of the town, has a terrace with bananas and shade. the food is very good as is the service.
very cool place. we have ordered two paellas and a hamburger and everything was great!!

i give it 3 stars because the food is good...but they are too slow in the service...you get bored from waiting so much...i won't go back...there are places where there is also good food and you don't wait that long...it's a shame because the food yes it is very good.
super good service, friendly, affectionate, excellent. abundant and good quality food. economical price. i will repeat. thank you mabel.
we have been today, the service was great and the food was first class, we will return, a place to recommend

gracia is full of hidden gems and salero is one of them!

one of the pros is that it is quite easy to get a table with no need to book a week in advance (a day before you still have a good chance!) which is very rare at such good places in barcelona.

salero has a good selection of tasty wines and the staff is happy to help with the choice.

the concept of the menu is quite interesting: a mix of middle eastern and asian cuisine is very harmonic. the food we got was absolutely delicious. my perso

amazing place! we booked it for a birthday celebration during the fiesta de gràcia with a group of girlfriends and we had the best time ever. the food was very good, service was exceptional and the atmosphere was 10/10. thank you for making it special for us🎂🎂🎂

a very cozy restaurant with tasteful decor, friendly service and solid neighborhood crowd (gent del barri).

we got a few drinks and some appetizers as the kitchen was closed (reopening at 8pm) but it was a good place to hang out for a couple hours. we will be back for food!

cozy atmosphere and excellent service, the food does not reflect the value for money (100euro two persons, note we are foodies). we were forced out of the table for the next client while we had still wine...we had never received a notice during reservation or during acceptance.

therefore not recommended. respect is respect. however, the staff were excellent 👌

an absolute delight! if you’re vegetarian, this is a must go-to while in barcelona. perfect blend of mediterranean and asian, very unique, in a hip quiet neighborhood. definitely try the baba ghanoush dish with fried tortillas!

we had new years dinner at salero. my friends were there for the first time and loved it! it has been one of my favorite restaurants in bcn since 10 years. great food, friendly service and cozy and stylish atmosphere. we will definitely keep coming back.  👌🤗
so cosy place with friendly stuff and delicious food! im glad i discovered it ! highly recommend!

average food, expensive prices. this is an attractive eatery in the heart of vila de gracia. we had lunch on a warm saturday afternoon, the doors were open to let in the breeze. we sat at a table beside the open door, very comfortable and delightful ambience. sadly the food is very average. we ordered the babaganoush and pumpkin with crispy chips, a little under-flavored. the calamares with noodles were pleasant but again very mild and lacking in taste. the merluza was overcooked and dry. prices

i was there with my partner having menu del dia today. i had a “crema de guisantes + mint” (a peas cream soup with a touch of mint) as a first dish, “japchae” as a second dish (noddles with vegetables, mushrooms and spices) and as dessert mel i mato (a catalan dessert made from cheese and honey).
the food was good, nothing extraordinary. the place is cute, the atmosphere is nice. the waiter was very kind explaining us the menu in english.

the surprise was at the toilet, where a very peculiar so

could not be happier with our experience with salero. our canadian group (9) was large for the venue but the staff was pleasant and helpful. all agreed that the food was excellent. be glad to return next time in barcelona.

delicious food and great service. loved it.

my friend is gluten intolerant. and this place served one of the best gluten free dishes and even had desserts.

definitely coming back for more.

i originally picked the place for its nice, chilled, almost romantic atmosphere. but also cause it offers many veggie options; the tofu pad thai was the highlight of the dinner. some other dishes were a bit too simple for me but i recognise the quality is high. 4 out of 5 as now that i have been i see this more like a quick bite with friends than a unique, one of a kind cusine
incredible food. 10/10 vibe and amazing ambiance. a friend of mine recommended the place and i was blown away. specially by the croquetas. will definitely come back.

an incredible experience! went twice during my stay in gracia. bruno was our waiter both times and was extremely friendly and helpful. food is amazing and is nothing short than 5 stars. thank you again, bruno!!!

walked by earlier and thought i would take my wife her for a midday date. staff were very friendly, atmosphere was great. we had the soup and baba ghanoush for starters, both were excellent. noodles and lamb tagine for main. honestly, the lamb tagine was the best i have ever had. fantastic all round. will be back.

this probably didn't match my taste but i didn't find the food that great how other reviews says... it was expensive and disappointing. stuff was slow and i have a feeling they avoid me because i didn't speak spanish. it seemed to me like ages when i was waiting for payment...

good ambiance, good food. we went for dinner with friends but they came to ask for orders before we even sat down. then 2 other people came and asked for the same…
we were aware that we had 2 hours to have dinner but they were so pushy by coming and trying to get the orders.
apart from that all was good.
amazing place with great atmosphere and service.

lovely place, we got a table without a reservation just before 2 pm, and it got really crowded afterwards. the lunch was tasty (includes starter, main, and coffee or desert plus a drink, the decor is beautiful. it was a bit slow to get our bill as it was very crowded, but overall a great place. the lay out and the design is really beautiful.
good food, large portions, excellent service. local restaurant always packed so book ahead, specially at weekends.
good food, good portions, very friendly staff and good value for money.

wow! what a hidden gem. went here on a recommendation from a friend who lives in barcelona. the setting was sublime, and the food was mouth-watering good. the wait staff were also attentive, funny and warm. such a great experience. we had humous and artichokes to start. our mains were the kaju curry, the fish of the day, prawn pad thai and a tuna maki roll that was low-carb. yum. happy bellies. food for the soul.
ww had pre-ordered meals. grilled dish was good. a bit noisy. a tavern style.

excellent place.
first class food and heavenly deserts.
a must go.

we just walked around the neighborhood looking for a place for dinner.
the food was amazing the place was nice and cozy great atmosphere.
you should try if you in barcelona
amazing

so the food isn’t that bad, but it’s overpriced for what is offered. the place is beautiful and cozy but they have that one waiter with the brown hair that probably has the worst service in the city.

we had ordered the duck rolls, and in the opinion of us 3 who had ordered it, it was disgusting and stinky. that waiter handled the situation in the worst possible way. the rolls literally stank and where un chewable and vile.

such a shame that a place this cool has staff so unworthy. hopefully, m

one of the best restaurants in town: fresh, original recipes,  fantastic service. the place is decorated with exquisite taste, every detail is cared for. and i haven't said anything about the desserts...
delicious food, chick atmosphere, lovely friendly service - will definitely make it a regular place to visit!

attributed this rate because you cannot trust their online reservation system. can’t rate the food -  i haven’t tried it as there was no table available for us despite having a reservation.

if you book online, i recommend calling the restaurant to double check if they do have a table available for you and your party before heading there. otherwise you might end up without a table, trying to find a place in another restaurant on a friday night (fortunately found an awesome one nearby - with tast
delicious food and super nice staff!

the place is very warm and well known in the neighborhood. if you want to eat or drink something it is almost imperative to reserve in advance.
moreover this restaurant gives a part of its profit to associations to help the people in need.
the dishes as well as the accompaniments are super good and the waiters are adorable.
i warmly recommend you this restaurant.
everything was very tasty and with the proper level of service.  after moscow, where you can find a restaurant for every taste and budget.  this place is just magical.
simply fantastic. i love this place, the food, the location, everything!
delicious food for a reasonable price. it has a very nice cozy interior. good service.
what a place. great ambiance, excellent food, even better attentive service. a little on the pricey side but you pay for the quality. couldn’t be happier with this place.
i want to invite everyone who works here over for christmas dinner. absolutely amazing food … best gazpacho i’ve ever had and the people are so nice. thank you for an amazing lunch! we’ll be back!

worst restaurant i ever been seen. i like your food and it was good but i didn't like your  behavior. his behaviour was like everytime when i ordered some food he  argued for no reason. please do some act on that waiter i didn't know his name i was also tourist.. thank you.
very tasty burger meat (careful it comes without bun)

the teriyaki chicken pagés was very tasty i like this place a lot.. good service..
good lights.. and very good
flavors…

the food and service at salero is amazing! mr. joakim is a super service minded person with always a smile and always available to take you through the dishes and recommend! love the ambience as well as the decoration! unique in everything muchísimas gracias
amazing food, lovely place

we stumbled onto this place since we couldn't get into a few other top restaurants without reservations...and were happily surprised. we ordered the lamb  tagine (awesome), duck rolls (phenomenal) and our kids had the steak and hamburger which both finished entirely. it was our last night in barcelona and this meal couldn't have been better!!!

great place!) very delicious meals, cozy atmosphere and friendship staff!
we'll come back!
nice staff, nice ambient, good food :) the food was served really fast

we were 5, having drinks, laughing and making jokes between each other. nothing extraordinary or drunkie. and the waitress asked to keep quit at 20h00 because other people started coming to have dinner. hilarious attitude.

just stopped for a quick tea and i realised after a while i forgot my wallet home. the stuff was so nice and understood my situation and told me with a big smile there is no problem i can pay next time. was embarrassing moment for me but they made me feel ok about it.

the restaurant is clean and the music was really nice also. i’ll definitely go back for food as looked amazing.

😊 gracias

we ate more or less correctly. but when the bill came they doubled everything we had ordered. never will come back as when we complain about the bill being wrong they didn't even need to ask what was wrong in it, they already knew. none of the two waiters that were attending us even apologize for the mistake.
the food is great, the people are nice and a very good vibe. the neighborhood is very cute just as the place ! perfect for a date spot to have a nice glass of wine
loved everything about it - the place, the food and amazing care that goes from using local, organic ingredients to how al dishes were presented. we will return!
calm atmosphere, soft music, excellent service, delicious and generous dishes. will return for breakfast and aperitivo!
good food made by people who clearly care about what they do. book a table, because people are trying their luck all the time!

hmm, me and the misses had a great meal here and would love to go back there again.. great steak, and even burata on the menu. we were helped by a very effecient team of people and the people in the kitchen were the best, team philipines.. i was amazed by the speed and efficiency they had.. i'm a bit surprised other people don't share that experience as much as we do.
amazing diversity of cuisines. everything tasted fresh and delicious.
i made a queue 10 minutes before closing time for a couple of drinks to go and when i reached the bar they told me it was closed. i would have appreciated them telling me beforehand. not coming back

salero has been my absolute favorite in barcelona for more than 15 years.  the food and staff are incredible.   it was a regular place when i lived in barca and its always on my list when i vist.   the steak is increadible.
a old and cool barcelona classic now in a new beautiful spot in the heart of gracia.
great food, friendly staff.

amazing food, weekdays daily changing three starters and two maincourses to choose of - at least for lunch, don't know if different in the evenings - and the weekend you have a vide range to choose of! will be back for sure
whoever created salero has great taste - beautifully simple but cosy interior and quality food and drink to match. highly recommend
very cosy, decorated with a lot of taste, extremely kind and professional staff, great food and music! highly recommended.
good dishes, nice small place, service ok but desserts needs improvements. i will come back
kids friendly staff, delicious food! cozy and nice atmosphere. great wine list.
really good catalan food. doggie friendly as well. maybe not the best coffee but food and place is too in my list for bcn.
great fusion food, good ambience and amazing host all of it without burning a hole in your pocket. good choice for dinner.
the environment is really cozy! good menu del dia. really good service
small place however very cosy. food was great.
okish. the baba ganoush and pad thai were definitely not the best i ever had.
great food and drinks, friendly staff. reservation recommended
great place but please fix your opening hours so they are correct
friendly staff, food is healthy and decent.
where the locals go.   we had 3 glasses of wine,  1 entree and a latte all for 12 euros
fantastic atmosphere and tasty food
my hole family got their food, ate it and got their dished before i got my plate... they didn't even explain or care about it.
best restaurant in gracia.
small portions, typical tourist catchers
beautiful environment, tasty food
as usual, a very good option!
delicious, beautiful, friendly, perfect
great for a cocktail

we arrived 10 mins before the midday (1600) kitchen break but no problem - we were asked to order promptly and despite a few choices not being available were served extremely promptly with some great tasting food - desserts did not disappoint.  very enjoyable some great wine at modest price. and able to chill post meal.  overall a very pleasant experience.

they had recommended the restaurant to me, and it was a great success. the food is delicious, the attention of the girls who serve you is 10, and the place is beautifully lit with a wide variety of designer lamps. very, very recommended! we left a scarf on the table and one of the girls ran a long stretch of street until she found us, love 😍

this restaurant stole our hearts!we came on saturday evening with friends and there wasn't a dish we didn't like. all really delicious and well balanced. also plentiful dishes and excellent quality/price ratio. the service isn't bad either.i can't wait to go back

a very welcoming restaurant in the middle of the gràcia district.the service speaks catalan.ideal for vegetarians, but also with meat and fish options. the desserts are very good and will not leave you indifferent!it is worth keeping for future occasions.book in advance.

i love this restaurant, one of my favorites in barcelona.very careful recipes, very tasty food, a very relaxed atmosphere with calm decoration and lighting.generally, there is not much noise and you can quietly enjoy dinner or lunch.i especially recommend the seaweed salad, it is incredible. 🤤and i also recommend saving room for dessert and trying the leonor cake.

my favorite restaurant in barcelona!this place has something special, and both the service and the dishes are incredible! we always order the homemade vegetable gyozas, the rice paper rolls with red tuna, avocado, ginger and chili, the lacquered duck rolls (star dish, highly recommended) and for dessert, the brownie never fails! all the dishes i have tried on different occasions have a unique flavor!

we found this top restaurant walking through the streets of gracia. the food was wonderful, they have many gluten-free options. extensive menu with very delicious starters and the best dishes to judge when you go. the staff is second to none! we will see each other again soon for sure!
excellent place for a good lunch! attention gets the best score!!
i love eating there! the food is homemade and spectacular. the service of the workers cannot be better!!

if you are looking to eat quickly, with pleasant service and want to feel at home, don't miss this restaurant.€9 daily menu, including dessert or coffee.it's fantastic to eat in a bar that doesn't want to fool anyone. simple restaurant, homemade food, pleasant service, and cheap that we want more.some delicious potato omelettes, both for lunch and for breakfast.thank you vicente for being like that.every time i can i go to eat.vincent

as for breakfast, i would highlight the wide variety of hot sandwiches for breakfast. i highlighted the quality of the ingredients, the speed and friendliness of the service, the very affordable price and the impeccable cleanliness of the premises. highly recommended.

perfect. vicente is unbeatable and fran treats you like mr. i recommend it. don't ask for elm pears but in terms of food you will be served, cared for and well eaten. good price.be careful not to get confused with the one next door!!
quality, price, good service and the atmosphere is very good. a good place to recommend
i have been going for 5 years every day, the daily menu is varied, healthy, balanced and at a good price... and they are also good people, what more could you ask for for 9 euros?
very cool, good value for money and the waiters very friendly and attentive. i went to have a daily menu and i recommend it
very good food and very good service, quality and price. i recommend it!!
good homemade food!! and good attention.
with vicente, a charming guy, incredible treatment. after going twice you already know what you want. a 10
perfect for breakfast. great deal and good quality-price
menu at an unbeatable price! good customer treatment. the best is the paella on thursdays.
i eat almost daily and the service is very friendly, the food is very good and paella is brutal.
+the food is very good-they have a3 on the tv-they take a long time to collect- it's expensive
excellent value for money with very attentive service
a very correct menu and unbeatable service
menu with two homemade dishes + drink + dessert for €9my everyday meal!
very good quality price
the best attention. very hardworking people
fantastic place, lunch and meals

we were recently visiting barcelona for the first time and stayed at this hotel. the area that the hotel is situated in is not ideal for those looking to explore barcelona. it is in a sketchy area that is desolate and everything is covered in grafitti. seems kind of like a ghost town area where there were previously a lot of establishments that were closed down and boarded up. it is not near anything. the hotel itself looks beautiful and modern and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful.

this hotel will not disappoint. fantastic location and the roof top terrace was fantastic! a short walk from some lovely bars and restaurants in the pobles nou.||around 10-15 minutes to the beach and 30 minutes to the centre. ||we did not use the pool facilities or spa but the overall appearance of the hotel was clean, modern and spacious. bed was extremely comfortable. ||i will definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel for location and value for money.

location - not the safest and far from the centre
not clients oriented, my boyfriend had a birthday , no offers proposed, also we had the problem with booking the breakfast, stuff wasn’t helpful.
bad was comfy and room was clean. spa is too much small. so we booked this room because of spa (totally not worth it) and breakfast (which was not included in the end for price for room with breakfast).
i would not stay here again

dear all , my name is linda allevi and i stayed in the hotel for the last 4 days the location is good but the stuff is really rude .they made you pay for 4 stars hotel but the service are not .
not welcome kit you must go to the reception and ask them.
bartender and receptionist are super rude .

this hotel is modern and just a short walk (15mins from beach, 30mins from la sagrada famila) from all the major sites.|all the staff are pleasant and friendly. ||our room was modern and spacious, clean and with good air-con. couldn’t hear anything else in the hotel or from outside (we were on floor 5) ||breakfast was buffet style with plenty of choice.||we stayed on a half board basis so had evening meals in the restaurant. each night there was a choice of 3 starters, 3 mains and 3 deserts. fol

nice room, great and friendly cleaners. restaurant wasn’t good, staff wasn’t so friendly. got breakfast options was always cold, spa needs major updating compared to how stylish the foyer is and the rooftop. was underwhelmed but overall was an okay place when you spend most of your day out anyway.

there is a disco next to hotel, we couldn’t sleep until 3:30 a.m. only then the sound went down. so it is a good hotel if you go to sleep at 4:00 am. apart from that it is a nice hotel close to city center and beach.

the main asset of this hotel: the rooftop bar with an amazing view on barcelona!
rooms are comfortable and spacious - the only downside i would say is the thinness of the walls - making each moves of the next doors neighbours loud and disturbing.
otherwise staff is nice and welcoming.
expect to be a bit outside of the centre though. 35mins walk from gothic centre and 1h from parc güell.

nearly 5 stars for everything but location was a tad out of the centre of activity of barcelona. however it is easy to get to places with a great metro system nearby. the hotel is awesome, comfy clean rooms, and a bed so big you need to txt your partner to chat to them. staff so friendly and helpful, and spoke good english as well. restaurant was loverly, and bar aswell. all in all, it was a beautiful place to stay in the beautiful barcelona.

the hotel is well located close to la rambla del poble nou. the service was really bad. the room was small, very basic but clean. the spa is too crowded and the pool was dirty. the worse part was the noise. you can hear the neighbors snoring. not worth the price.

i found it unthinkable that if a hotel staff says to leave the telephone number and that i should shortly expect a call back but in the end nobody calls back after days. this is the basic of a hotel service. not reliable at all and also when i called back to made them notice this they didn’t even apologise. very bad.

this is not a 4* hotel. rooms are clean for the most part, but the interior looks like it was rushed to be finished with small details being forgotten. breakfast is at best... ok. variation is limited, with no vegetables and healthy choices...? forget about it.  old eggs that were hard boiled and saved for the next day lay out for breakfast. just a disappointment.  the spa was a disaster where the water in the pool was well... imagine the smell of chlorine and the color of piss! mold on the wall

we booked the hotel for 7 days and we left after 1 night. the stuff at the reception was so unfriendly, we felt like we weren't welcome there. the room stank totally, is was so loud because you hear everything from outside and from the neighbourrooms and it was so so so cold the whole time (there weren't even normal blankets!!!). breakfast was ok but the breakfastroom was totally full and so loud.
the rooftop is permanently closed, we didn't even see the rooftop!!!!! and when we asked they could

we stayed for 3 nights over a weekend, 2 adults, 2 kids.
taxi from barcelona airport was 20 min drive door to door, not expensive.
staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean , spacious and great for families. the kids enjoyed the restaurant, breakfast buffet and pool, also running up and down the stairs.
the stairs are very wide and shallow to climb if you don't want to take the lift.

hotel rooms are clean. bathroom is nice. most of staff is friendly (receptionists). lady in spa less friendly. spa is small. you have only one hour a day in the spa. but that’s more than enough. it’s small. rooms are little noisy, coffee facilities are out of this time. nespresso is the norm these days. metro is not that close by. (10 min walk)

we stayed 3 nights in this hotel, we were 10 persons in different rooms . the staff  was very rude and racist. i called the room service, they turned off my phone more than 5 times . most of the time the doors of the rooms were not closed but remained open , and last but not least, the purchases we made from sephora  were stolen from our room. we asked for the cameras to be opened but they refused and continued to make fun of us saying that they thought they were trash and threw them down. || we

we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. there was no security. the reception staff was very uneducated. the children's pool was not open all day. we had a problem, something was stolen from our room, and the hotel did not take responsibility, there were no cameras to see the theft. and when we told the reception about our problem, they were unprofessional and laughed at our problem.

hotel is overall modern and nice looking. the staff were all really friendly and pleasant. ||the hotel isn't in the nicest of places but its close to everything via taxi/public transport, we also walked to a lot of places if your walkers.||i used the spa once and didn't  go back, there are no beds to lie on around the pool and the pool is so small you cannot swim in it if there's more than 4 people in the pool which is disappointing. we only booked the hotel due to the spa. i wasn't given a towe

spacious and clean rooms, a comfortable bed (i have a back problem so sleep can be and issue), a free mini bar and a really generous breakfast buffet. conveniently located, within a walking distance from two metro stations (a 3 and a 7-minute-walk respectively) yet very quiet. polite and helpful staff, always at your service with a smile on their face. i would definitely choose it again for my stay.

we didn’t have a good time at this hotel. the location was out of the way of the main part of barcelona and was quite sketchy. check in was at 2 but we didn’t get our rooms until 3:30 and found the images online were misleading, finding out that the family room is the same size as a standard double.

the lobby showed no signs of security except for friday and saturday night, and as a result our friends also got their passports stolen from the hotel lobby on the day we were leaving. the hotel was

great location to explore barcelona.  take a bike where you can. rooms are nice and clean could have done with more light. only one window felt dark in the day.  tv only like two channels have english subtitles.
spa was a lovely extra.  calm, relaxing. breakfast was lovely. food cooked well good selection and extra cake avaliable every morning. easy for taxied to be taken to and from the hotel. staff where very friendly and food at the hotel restaurant food was lovely. would come here again.

we had a horrible experience at the roof top bar today. the roof top ist beautifully designed which gets massively downgraded by the bad and annoying music playlist. the bartenders are inexperienced & the drinks especially the cocktail choice is very limited. the caipirinha was a 1/10. way too much ice, a small glas and the far too much sugar - price 14€ - ridiculous. the 4 cheese pizza took ages and was not eatable. far too much cheese than usual. you couldn’t taste the dough or even see the to

good comfortable business hotel in fairly urban area outside the city.|rooms clean and comfortable, no complaints there, views urban and uninspiring.|bar, breakfast room functional, staff very pleasant.|breakfast good.|limited tapas menu in evening - but good, bar dominated by tv and loud back ground music of non specific type playing everywhere!!!|spa small but good, pool is more of a plunge type, don’t take swim goggles!|overall it’s fine as a place to sleep.|better options available i think.

well, hotel is looking good when you dont look for the details. as you can see in the photos room is damaged and look like renewed but really isnt. spa is really small and the water was green and stinking and also you have to wear cap to the small pool which is nonsense to me.. overall the personel there is fine and the breakfasts are also kinda good. hotel is located in industrial area which is looking dangerous in the night. but really for the price the hotel is polished misery.

rooms, free mini bar and free spa is perfect! location wise have to walk into places which is about 30 minute walk. tv didn’t really work and we ended up having to just watch the news whilst having to get ready, noisy guests also but understandable as everyone’s enjoying their holiday! i’d definitely say more of a young persons hotel to stay in

it is a hotel with a bad service, they were not responsible for lost items in their hotel. the service of the staff at the reception was||arrogant. they stole from our room. very expensive and no security. there were no security cameras to verify the theft. despite the fact that the doors had a card to enter, you could easily enter from the outside as well.

very bad experience at hotel salles pere iv. they are irresponsible, there is no safety, especially when it comes to children. even though they had a card, the hotel rooms opened from the outside without a problem. i didn't like anything about that hotel.
the wait staff is very rude.
very expensive, and does not justify the price.

stayed here for a week end of june 2023

location is great for the beach and for the city centre being about 25 min walk to each.
the area itself was quiet, there are convenience stores dotted around but getting things late at night can be an issue.
there is a bar directly next door and also across the road, both were busy but not particularly noisy.

the hotel itself was nice, very clean and well equipped. there are two lifts, our room was on floor 7 and there was occasionally a short wait for

this is my 2nd year at this hotel so i feel confident in saying my impression wasn't just unlucky the first time.

arriving at the airport the arranged taxi driver was about 50 minutes late and when we called the hotel they simply told us to keep looking. eventually after the hotel called her we finally met and she arranged a drive for us. it was very tiresome and the hot airport didn't make us feel amazing dragging our luggage around looking for someone who probably wasn't even there at first.

a short walk to the metro,easy  walk to the beach and other areas. we had a nice reasonably priced evening meal in the restaurant. room was clean and comfortable, light and airy. mini fridge was useful, small supermarket on the next street. not many restaurants close by, short walk away. breakfast was a delicious feast every morning. the pool and spa is smaller than it looks in the photos, bookable at reception. peaceful area. we walked around the port area where there’s lots of restaurants then
amazing hotel! they gave us the suite instead of a room as it was my mrs birthday. complimentary drinks etc was a lovely touch. spa facilities was good as was the service. would recommend.

positive : good size room, comfy bed.
negative side: we didn’t get what we paid for swimming pool was tiny full with people all the time obviously because hotel is full. spa receptionist very rude. spa tiny super wet everywhere ! bar didn’t serve us cocktails as it was very busy they said, i was happy to wait but still they didn’t want to do the cocktails and manager was super upset with us cause we said we will wait ! normally, i’m not very picky with hotels, but this hotel was very bad organiz

definitely not a 4* hotel and the price ist not justified at all.

positive:

- breakfast buffet
- the staff was helpful
- free minibar
- good area, close to the beach, public transport and city center
- good cleaning

negative:

- i was staying during my birthday, no happy birthday or anything special. didn’t even offer a drink even though they realized it during the check in.

- pretty loud in the night, you hear the people from the bars outside

- you can even hear the people loudly moaning n

we loved our stay here! the room was clean and comfortable and the hotel was not far from the metro. there were also a lot of activities and bars near the hotel so we could've honestly just stayed in that area. also, the food at the hotel was very good! we opted for the romantic package was amazing - i loved the personalized touch. it included the spa, champagne, and free breakfast. finally, i loved the bathroom. the bathtub and shower were like heaven.

it's location is great, as a family having separated rooms and a sitting area was very ideal. the staff were welcoming. the supermarket downstairs was very helpful. the view from balcony or the other wondows were on the down side though. we could not find a fabulous cafe around we usually get a taxi to the best ones around.

we stayed 4 nights in this hotel and were extremely impressed. the hotel was super clean, the rooms were comfortable, and the spa was lovely. we were on the 8th floor and it was nice and quiet. our friends were on the second floor and reported no issue with street noise, as some of the other reviews stated, as the windows provided excellent soundproofing.

we didn’t add breakfast to our booking and regretted that when we met up with our friends. we ended up having breakfast at the hotel every mo

rooms look nothing like shown, supposedly gave us the wrong room because what we saw was not what we paid for. ended up changing our rooms but then got a room with a tv that didn’t work, we weren’t bothered as we were on holiday. seems like they give people smaller rooms hoping they won’t say anything but as the cleaners were cleaning we managed to see into other rooms which looked like the rooms we had excepted to stay in. before the room change we were in what looked like university accommodat
surroundings are not nice. receptionists are just ok, not friendly. forgot that i came here two years ago until i entered… otherwise wouldn’t have booked it again.

the room is well maintained, the bathroom is nice. the service is good, everyone polite and helpful.

unfortunately the room smelled like cigarette smoke.  the street was really loud at night, a lot of partying going on. the pool is small with water too warm for my taste. the ac is loud in the room. the room walls are quite thin, so prepare to develop an intimate relationship with your neighbors: you can hear every word.

apart from the noise, the location is convenient, many things are within w

loved it. spa access was fantastic especially travelling as a couple. we broke up the day by going to the spa in the afternoons where it was the emptiest. great location, walking distance to lots of great sights and the bar next door has cheap drinks and tapas. they were so accommodating to us when we needed our bags stored because we had an excursion booked after check out. thanks for everything! would love to go back

the service was really not nice. they offer room service but none is picking up the phone. i only arrived late at 10pm and tried to call for 40 min. i had to go down and then they said food is only until 10:30pm (no info about this) super annoying! also most rooms have not a nice view. the spa is a bit dirty.
the staff seems overworked and also a bit rude. the guy from the room service was screaming at me that food order is only until 10:30 and i was there 10:45pm and told him that none is picki

the rooms were clean and well maintained. they were spacious and comfortable with a nice bathroom. the staff was friendly and the room service was also very good. the breakfast was great! the dinner was quite good, but was pretty expensive.
the only drawbacks were that noise from the street and other rooms were quite loud. also, the complementary wifi was quite slow.
it was a great stay overall with easy access to many places that we wanted to visit.

hotel was ideal with no complaints, it is situated just outside the city centre about a 20-30 minute walk or a 15 min metro. the hotel room was modern and seemed refurbished which is good. it has a rainfall shower, safe and minibar. the rooms are a little low on light but manageable. also has a well lit work space with supportive chair, by the work station there is also a hdmi port for the tv. breakfast was 10/10 and the staff are also polite and helpful. i used the steam room and sauna the saun

the hotel has a great location and you have metro and great connections near. the room was nice and the beds are comfortable. the breakfast is outstanding and the restaurant inside the hotel also has some great dishes worth tasting. the minus is the funny working slow elevator, unstable wifi and the sound isolation is not the best in the rooms. great hotel overall.

very poor hygiene
area is full of homeless, and drunk people

did not match the expectations.

staying at sallès hotel pere iv with family.  firstly, i can say we had no problem with noise, we were on the 9th floor, i would think lower floors may be noisier.

it's old fashioned but that's ok, in a few years from now they can sell it as vintage 😉

the staff are cold, unfriendly and detached. they should be reminded that they work in hospitality, i felt like i was dealing with prison guards.

breakfast was fine, very sombre.  not many happy faces on staff or guests.  a bit depressing really

on the plus side, great quiet location and off the tourist sites , hotel very close to a metro station and bus routes, very pleasant and helpful staff, the front desk is multilingual and an appetizing breakfast buffet that was included on my reservation. also the hotel has its own parking for a fee. on the less plaisant side, the room was long and narrow, i bumped many times against the tv because of lack of space, the shower knobs needed some repair, and mildew on the bottom rubber joints of th

for our 1st time in barcelona, we booked rooms in different hotels. here is our review for sallès hotel pere iv : we enjoyed our stay and especially the spa and the breakfast.

because it was december, we did not have difficulties to appreciate the spa that offers a swimming pool, massage jets for our feet, dry and moist sauna. the room was clean and comfortable.there was a sofa bed for additional  guests and the bathroom was nice as well.

talking about the breakfast, we believe it is one of th

staff super friendly and helpful,
everywhere is super clean.
roor top bar area is fabulous
hotel was great. room was clean and spacious for 3. food was good with a range that fits all. the spa was very relaxing. the staff we're helpful. close to metro and plenty of taxis.

the hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. its close to the metro station which makes it convenient, but there isn’t much to do in the very direct neighborhood which makes the location a bit less nice. our room was facing a large construction site but we didn’t hear too much of the work going on. wifi is very poor (at least on the seventh floor) - you cannot use it for work or streaming services. airconditioning is okay, television is large. small fridge under the desk. usb plugs available as

great breakfast and clean rooms with ac, albeit loud. not a nice area/view but close to metro.
spa made us wait 45 mins for booked treatment, we left without it. also kids were allowed to play in the tiny spa at 7 pm.
restaurant had nice food but we were rushed, for example weren't allowed to pause between main course and dessert.

we had the best hotel experience. we booked 6 nights with breakfast included and it was amazig,the room very clean with cleaning service every day, spa very relaxing and quiet,breackfeast with a lot of variety product. we stayed at the 3 th floor and it wasn't any noise from outside.

the personnel is definitely 5 stars. thank you guys.
it’s just that the rest of the hotel seems like its glorious days are long gone for the price we paid (150€/night). here and there unrepaired damages, breakfast not well-thought (but bigger buffet), etc.

this is a racist hotel.  the night reception at the hotel spoke very unreasonable and racist language.  i will suggest that the company department should not book this hotel for exhibitions in the future.  when i ask for a complaint form.  they refused to give it to me.  terrible staff who discriminate against foreigners.  march 2, 2023
very clean and cozy  ❤️ close to sagrada familia and the centre as well.

honestly this place is only good to stay for people who actually want to party in the next door very busy club. i am amazed how any hotel can exist next to a club that is so busy every day, that you have crowds outside the place and what comes with it noise.
our room was literally wall to wall with the club, impossible to get any sleep until 2:30 am, when it actually closes, and even after that time party goers still stand on the street drinking and making noises until probably 5-6 am. we compla

had a look through reviews before booking and all seems good. upon arrival, the hotel is clean and although located on a street full of graffiti and clubs etc, it looks decent enough. room is simple and clean however for a hotel in the heart of barcelona that boasted free wi-fi, you can’t even load pages on google. first hotel i have stayed in that offer wi-fi but it’s so slow you revert to use your own 4g instead. the bed is uncomfortable and the view is across other hotel rooms. unsure how gen

nice enough. location is by a few spanish nightclubs so the streets around are very busy on a night and the noise can be heard in the rooms.

the hotel walls are paper thin so don’t speak too loud.

staff are nice enough and the rooms are clean and tidy.

firstly, we didn't find the bathrobes in the room,called the reception and nothing happened.
i had to change the room due to a blocked sink and the noise.
the spa is very small and it is frustrating to call all the time to make bookings to be allowed to use it.
the breakfast was repetitive and not amazing.
the reception staff is not well trained, i may say quite rude or they don't care about the clients.
all in all this is not a 4star hotel. the price is too high for what this hotel provides.
we

really nice luxury hotel,-free spa access...rooms always clean. cleaners respect the do not disturb sign. very very good location. only problem is the wifi is bad in the hotel-watching queen elizabeth ii funeral kept cutting out...

in my opinion, the hotel does not meet 4 stars.
the hotel smells very bad, there is no toilet brush in the toilet, the soundproofing is very bad, if someone on the floor closes the door to the room, all the doors and walls shake, the water in the pool is dirty, the breakfast is poor... the hotel is not even close to 4 stars.

i stayed here for 4 days. i did not want to leave.. the service was on point, so lovely and welcoming. the food and drinks were perfect size for a reasonable price. the location was perfect, we were not in the middle of the city hence some quiet and peace however if we did want to have some fun it is only 10min to get to the clubs and bars. i cannot say 1 bad thing about this place. hopefully soon i will be back

good location, 15 min walk to the beach.
would like to thanks karolina for her welcoming was really a great pleasure!
room are spacious with all needed facilities. clean and well furnished.
the spa is great and massage are of a good quality. (the only thing that could be changed is the need to go to reception in order to get your voucher for spa everyday, i think that could be arranged in another manner)
do not hesitate it worth your money.
again thank you karolina and hope seeing you next time.

stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. hotel was very nice and clean. staff was friendly, especially the man with glasses behind the bar. the pool was also good to have. the hotel is in a good location and i highly recommend it.

the room was excellent and we enjoyed the variety of the breakfast. cleaning of the room is done far too late, procedure is it has to be finished by 6pm we had cleaning at 5.30pm, it should be finished by 3.00pm at least, when you come back after a long day you don't expect your room still to be cleaned. the spa was good but should open from 9am to make full use of the facilities and if you expect customers to wear swimming hats in the pool these should be supplied by the hotel for free.

the worst hotel in barcelona!
do not stay here the hotel is not a 4 star. there are clubs surrounding the hotel and streets can get very busy and noisy, so much so that you will not be able to get sleep.
the rooms were also very small and the beds were extremely uncomfortable. the ac didn't seem to be working correctly either, we often found ourselves opening the terrace door to cool the room.
the staff are not great either, along with the housekeeping. we constantly had to call downstairs every

good value for your money, with spa access 1h daily, nice 15m2 indoor pool. 15 min walk to barcelonita beach, and metro stop 5min walk. great multi-language speaking staff. mini bar and electric kettle in room.

very clean well located hotel. short taxi everywhere can walk to many shops. nice spa and decent pool. the ac doesn’t really work well and all the rooms seem very warm. hallways are very good climates.

the staff is very friendly and even offered to help us find a sitter so i could go out with my spouse!

the hotel is very nice, reception is very helpful.
breakfast staff is also very pleasant.
the room was nice and modern, but it was too dark. extra light is needed.
the wifi signal in the room was very bad, but is was good at the reception/restaurant/lobby bar.
i didn't like, that the "1h free spa voucher" in the end is not free, cause you have to buy a swimming cap and special slippers to enter spa.

stayed here may 2019 and was a rather disappointing stay. the staff were generally good. the room was very small (226) and a little tired. the towels and robes were not clean even with several replacement towels. the spa was a total disappointment so don’t book for that. the wifi was a good speed if it was still 1995 except it isn’t, absolutely awful. on the positive the location is good for bogatell metro station and therefore easy to get to from the airport. also very ideal for the beach! unfo

hotel was generally excellent, located a few minutes away from metro and only 10 minute walk from beach.  was very impressed with interior and decor and it was clean and spotless throughout.  room was very good for family of 4 including 2 teenagers.  breakfast buffett offered had a good selection and although room was completely full on all 3 mornings it didn't feel cramped. finished days sightseeing in bar and it was reasonably priced.  front desk staff were very helpful and friendly and even p

the room was clean, terrace was spacious and relaxing, spa was not a spa, cold and dirty swimming pool, the shower were cold, sauna don't deserve the name especially the finish sauna, the second "hot box" was out of order. i will not start with the employee how unprofessional and rude they were to all costumers that came in to use the spa. no towels were provided for the spa nor a possibility to dry your hair. going back to the room with wet hair and body is very unpleasant. overall i really don

the room and bed were just huge and comfortable.
the bathroom was nice and clean.
the breakfast was really good and you  have lot of choices even vegan options.
for the price at the time we went, december, it was well worth it.
i just wished some parts of the neighborhood were better.

very good. very clean plenty of clean towels and the room was lovely, but lacking coffee and tea ficilitys it would have been nice to have a coffee in there as we had just traveled from france and wasn't in the mood to go down to the cafe that was full of noisy spanish and kids running all over the place, other than that its worth the money and very easy to get back on the main road to spain i would recommend this hotel to travelers .

super facilities and friendly staff in reception and bar area.
the bedroom was lovely and modern, lots of plugs and charging points.  bathroom was a great size and had a powerful shower.
the prices at the bar for food and drink are very reasonable for a hotel in a big city.
can't recommend this hotel enough!
