very comfortable hotel. shower in the room was a little weak (poor pressure). but otherwise the room and bed was very comfortable. breakfast buffet was very good and always well stocked. the bar and restaurant were highly overpriced. go next door to d9 of you want a drink! the spa is a little small but very clean and again very relaxing for what they do have. the spa treatments were really good. definitely recommend. the location of really good also - 8-10 minute walk to nearest beach. 2 minute

big rooms and comfy beds. nice breakfast and polite service. was a bit noisy from the night club next door one evening. the biggest flaw is the "spa". i would not call it a real spa and it was quite a disappointment. also you need to spend 5 euros on plastic shoes and a silly hat. so do not book the hotel because of the spa.

i still live in the hotel with multiple rooms with my friends, the hotel room is so very hot and i went down at 3am cos my son woke up
crying and all i got was attitude and i had to say sorry for the room being hot because only then would i get a fan, i paid a bomb but all rooms are very hot bad experience

if you really want a good sleep this is not a good place. the sound isolation does not exist, you basically hear every sound coming from the street and from the room next door, also the heating system is based on air conditioning so if you come into a colder season you will hear all the night the hurring sound from the air conditioning. if you also have the "luck" staying near people who slam doors and scream at 2am your sleep is gonna be ruined totally.
so 2 stars because the breakfast was pret

we like our rooms a lot. soft bed, clean rooms and bathroom. our main room was elegant. breakfast was outstanding with many food selection. located outside central barcelona which give us quietness. overall cleanliness of the hotel was exceptional. we will not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. high recommendation to other travellers.

the hotel offered excellent accommodation. our room was very clean with good linen, tea and coffee facilities and a modern bathroom with a powerful shower.
the hotel breakfast was amazing with so much choice to cater for all cultural preferences.  the staff where very helpful.

great experience during the christmas!  nicholas from reception is doing a great job and is a real asset for the company! the breakfast is great in mediterranean style, service was great as well. the spa is a gem for the company and we feel relaxed during our stay. definitely will come back !

the breakfast, staff and hotel were all very good, the staff were very helpful and polite. the room had all the amenities and was very clean although the wooden floor was a little damaged and needed a repair and the extractor fan in the bathroom didn't work. the spa was lovely but guests should be forewarned that to go in the pool you need a swimming cap and spa needing flip flops which although the spa is free for an hour you have to pay 5 euros to buy both of these items per person.

i was looking into staying here but i decided against since:
1-poor customer service on the phone. i called with a few questions and they wouldn't even let me talk!
2-the access to the spa facilities is just for one time / one hour irrespective of length of stay. so i concluded that this place was not worth the extra cost per night for just the privilege of spending up to 1 hr in a hot tub...

great stay, everything has that minimalistic feel to it. clean, white, and simple. the gym is quite small but it has what you need. the buffet is amazing and can cater to all dietary requirements from what i could see, location is about a 15min walk to the beach, but right next to the subway station so getting around is quite easy!

amazingly helpful staff and great room. the restaurant and room service is very affordable and spa treatments are easy to book. could walk to transport hubs and to the shops and our music venue was down the road. amazing

great location for the metro, 5mins walk & the beach took us 15/20mins walk. really good service and hotel was very clean and fairly new.  we arrived early and were allowed to leave our luggage while we went for lunch.
the reception staff were great at helping us work out our route for attractions.

on departure they booked us a taxi and made us a goody bag at 5am for our journey to the airport, really nice gesture.

we didn’t have time to use the spa, but 1 hour a day was included in our price.

the guy david at the front desk reception on october 21, 2021 around 11:20pm was very, very rude. there was an issue with availability with the parking deck and rather then explain their policies, he would not let me speak. i am a guest at the hotel and he kept cutting me off and telling me i would not be right in this situation. i was not seeking to be right but to understand. because earlier when we checked in, they let us in to the parking deck. no one explained to us we had to pay, which wou

it is a nice modern hotel. it looks like it has had a recent refurbishment. the hotel is clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. the bathroom was very large and had an awesome rainfall shower. the only reason for the 4 stars was the location feels a little unsafe after dark and the room was very warm, even with the ac turned low.

fantastic hotel. staff were very polite and helpful.
room service was top notch as was the restaurant.
spa was great although the jacuzzi was not working when we visited. we only went to the spa once however , it's a nice extra if you want to cool down from the heat of barcelona.
one bug bear was the wifi connection within the rooms was poor.

overall a fantastic hotel, very nice, easy to get to, lovely staff.

very nice hotel, food we had was room service which was delicious check in easy very clean hotel,only downside is location it is a 30 minute walk each way to the main city areas of barcelona could not find the metro.
nice hotel would return

overall the hotel is good. nice spa area inside. placement is not so good (not attractive around), but 15min walking distance to the sea.

bad:air conditioning in the room is not clean - both me and my girlfriend were coughing (not because of cold) until we just opened a window...

definitely not suitable for business trip.
very loud with thin walls - you can hear all the people walking around at night speaking loudly so forget about good night sleep.
gym is only open from 9 am so no chance for workout in the morning.
no iron in the room and very difficult to get one. staff not very helpful.
i recommend to avoid if you can.

nice hotel with friendly staff. overall clean but sometimes things were missed. nice views from the balcony. decently close to most tourist sites, right next to a metro stop, but not central to a large number of restaurants. would recommend

i was not a hotel guest and just visited the spa and it was very welcoming and amazing. the spa receptionist lady is so well trained and she makes it comfortable for you and reminds you that someone is there for you if you need assistance or need something ☺️! the spa itself is beautiful and for sure thinking of coming again.
hotel was clean, staff are friendly. breakfast was really good. the hotel has poor wifi, had to change room and still same issue. not sure how a 4* hotel has wifi problem.

the hotel buffet was small but still contained everything you needed. there was also a spa but what was annoying, was that you had to buy flip flops to walk about 4 metres. you also had to buy a hat for the swimming pool (if you didn't have one already).in our room, one of the beds were too small but the hotel was really kind and they let us switch rooms. all the staff were really kind and friendly and the hotel was beautiful.
all nice until your local friends departed, so would not recommend for tourists or quiris!
amazing cocktails with vintage ambience 😀 a great place to be!
great atmosphere. the barman is awesome and makes the best moscow mule in barcelona.
it is now one of my regular bars i visit, that's thanks to the staff being always friendly.
great staff, great place, definitely worth a visit and i will be coming back
very nice barman and his cocktails are also good.  cocktails very cheap only 6 euros :)
really great atmosphere, very friendly, and great bartender to top it off!
informal local place with great atmosphere. staff is super friendly.
football on tv, prices very good. no tapas tonight though.
very friendly staff and cool interior
this is a fantastic little hole-in-the-wall joint!
good music and halloween decorations
nice and cody bar
nothing special, a bit dark and dreary
super nice staff.

a fantastic place! it has a very original asian atmosphere.the soup is very good, i tried the pork one and it was very tasty. a very important point is that they have a vegetarian version of almost everything, which by the way is also very delicious.the staff there is very nice and attentive.

personally, i like places where you can talk to local residents and if you feel like it, you can have a decent gin, play darts or watch people go by. the bartender could be the best in southern europe... or not :). every month he does a cinemacarrada about questions about series and movies... and they give prizes... it's entertaining... but difficult hahaha
great atmosphere. good people. friendly staff

cocktail bar with movie competitions on the weekend every month or two. the cocktails take time when filled but are made with fresh fruit and a lot of care. cheap for what it offers and a very good atmosphere. highly recommended.

a good bar to go to during the week. great for the weekend. once a month they have a film contest and another political talk contest. the cocktails are delicious, the waiter who prepares them is a sweetheart of a person.

it's not a big cocktail bar, but it's very nice.i went there to participate in a trivial that they do monthly and it was a lot of fun. the owner and waiters are very kind and friendly and make you feel at home.drink prices are more than reasonable.the activities they organize welcome a lot of people and you are guaranteed to laugh.
i felt in a pleasant... familiar atmosphere... i hadn't been out at night in barcelona for years
great to spend a quiet afternoon. very good service with sports broadcasting.

it's a friendly pub. they serve cocktails. there are various beers. soccer is broadcast. with two environments. one at the bar and another small cozy room with vintage armchairs. there are no tourists. and young audience. the waiter is a very friendly and smiling man. the outdoor terrace is very little traveled. it is reminiscent of the town bar where everyone knows each other.
18 euros for a tasteless gin and tonic, in a run-down dive…. i thought that in such a shabby bar the prices would be reasonable… an abuse… once and no more…
a curious mix of neighborhood bar and jeviata club. the best thing is the parish (well, that and the music). very authentic people, friendly waiters and an unpretentious atmosphere.

we discovered it by chance. we were already going home, but i was peeing a lot and we stopped to use the bathroom. we ended up staying until they practically closed. it was a pleasant surprise: a place with regular and nice customers. simple place without posturing, which is appreciated nowadays. the waiter was very funny and peculiar. we will be back!!
it is cheap and very well located. they have board games
the headquarters of beers and politics, i don't know. xavier peytibi will know more for sure
a pub like the old ones, dark, good drinks, good music, with love of culture and nothing touristy. fair prices. the furniture can be a bit tacky, but perhaps that is part of the charm of the place.
get running.bar with snacks and drinks and little else.attention is conspicuous by its absence.
what can i say, drinks ok... the staff and the place leave a little to be desired... outdated and poorly maintained.
good place to have beer or cocktails. friendly and professional waiter. there are also darts. good vibes in general. there are no bad vibes.
i love this place, it has become one of my favorite places to have a few drinks. very close and friendly staff. see you soon!
very good drinks, in the place there are also board games like monopoly
visited place for the first time and i found it very pleasant as well as good service and above all good music 🎺

10 euros for a tasteless gin and tonic, in a dilapidated club, with sticky furniture and with people suspiciously going to the bathroom three by three. don't fall into the same trap as me! learn from other people's mistakes and don't step in this hole.
pleasant and communicative service. the well-made cocktail. and the cozy and quiet terrace. recommendable.
an endearing place where you can spend sleepless nights! it remains a bar with lots of charm and personality!
cocktails, beers with open bar and popcorn. super friendly bartender, cozy environment. the downside, a lot of noise that hinders conversations.
super cute bar to go have a drink with friends, very good atmosphere
a bar that makes you feel at home, people who are fun and open to meeting. i am from outside and they have made me feel like they are in a bar in my city.
the best bar in barcelona, ​​the owner, the waiter and the customers are the best. if you go you will enjoy to the fullest
good atmosphere, 80s and 90s music. ideal for drinks with friends.
good service and good atmosphere!!! ideal for having a few drinks....
it is very comfortable!! ivan and miki are a sun apart from price and attention dpm.
well-made cocktails. good atmosphere to disconnect.
casual cocktail bar, good gin and tonics and good music, very friendly service.
still open at 1:00, ideal for a drink with a good atmosphere.
beer is expensive, be careful
good place to grab something quick, but prices a little high.
pm's joint and the fetén waiter 👌
nice pub, good service...good music and very good bartender
ideal place to meet up with the hangouts and have a laugh with iván or mike!! 😘😘
very good music and super pleasant atmosphere.
the bartender makes you some super professional cocktails and accompanies you with some crispy, freshly made popcorn
the best mojitos in barcelona and its friendly and attentive staff
a good musical bar to taste cocktails and listen to good music in the ❤ of barcelona
authentic pub, good music, good selection of drinks and very good customer service.
good cocktails and gin and tonics and very good value for money, young atmosphere and board games
rock atmosphere bar where you can play darts. they have pretty good imported beers.
a very nice place with a very good initiative to create clientele
neighborhood pub. family atmosphere with very good and pleasant treatment.
cozy bar, good terrace and good atmosphere
a brutal place to have a few drinks at night😁
to have a drink and watch old cinema in black and white
slow when serving drinks very low music bad musical bar
the gin and tonic, amazing. and very kind
good music and good cubatas. attentive staff.
a chinese bar. normal, we just have something
a good bar to have a few drinks
small but cozy? friendly treatment
bad impression.!! a little strange people, they consume themselves
cocktail bar, good atmosphere
select atmosphere and careful service!!!
a great place with a great waiter!
a nice neighborhood bar.
romantic place to hang out
singular place #letsguide #rosafrancomendoza

there was a student activity when we went, and it was actually a lot of fun. i'm sure if this atmosphere was in another bar, we would have had more fun because while we were having fun, they suddenly stopped the music and put on live music. it was the worst thing to do when people were just starting to have fun. drinks were relatively expensive and i think snacks should be offered.

the decoration is old american style, that we really liked it. most important was that we could communicate well in english with the stuff, that explained the menu to us that was written in spanish (that was minus but since the menu was explained to us .....it was ok). the stuff were very polite and the service was fast.
we loved the place.
we definitely recommend it!!!!
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
👍😁

as i was waiting for drinks at the counter, big guy with piercings decided to push me out with the movable counter, not even asking if i could move out for him to easily come out. later on as he was walking back to the counter, just rammed into my shoulder and i ended up spilling my drink. if you think it’s fine to treat customers like this you should really have a reality check

vegan options were available, but some dishes were very plain, not as per indian taste. we ordered sphagetti pasta, and it was nothing just, pasta in olive oil. i ordered wok noodles with vegetables, that was tasty and will recommend it, you need to add spicy sauce as per your taste

super nice and comfy place. the decoration transports you to another place, the staff is really nice and accessible, they are friendly and the food is delicious! all fresh and tasty... and desserts! the cheesecake is definitely recommended!
the best burgers in barcelona! very very tasty! atmosphere of a real american pub. beer was good, it would be nice to extend the beer menu.
great burgers.   one of the best i've had in spain.   nice mushrooms croquettes, too.  friendly, fast service.
very busy bar, initially could only get a drink to drink outside. the great doorman sorted us out a table inside a little later where we had some nice burgers. nice bar, nice food and good service.

fantastic sports bar screening barca football matches live. they speak fluent english and are happy to take ta le reservations for match days with view on the screens. in our case reservations were strictly honoured. also, there nachos l'equipe are the best we have had anywhere.

american style place. plates are also big and really tasty. so far the best ribs i've had in those american places. prices are fair and they also have special plates per week which are cheaper than in regular menu, no lunch menu though

i have to say this was my favourite when i was visiting barcelona as tourist. we ordered from tapas like nachos full equipe and potato fries with cheese and jamon. i am pretty sure all of the tapas are great here. also tried the drinks here (not sure how it is called, definitely not sangria but something similar).
great place. nice service, beer and awesome burgers. it's a bit loud but it's a sports bar, so that's ok. :)
i had the pulled pork burger and was not the greatest. other orders from my colleges looked way better. the staff was super unfriendly but fast and efective
this place is super fun! angela is awesome! great atmosphere
nice bar, burgers were ok, they are lacking a sauce and little amount of fries. order a happy gin tonic or two and you’ll have a good night out.

affordable delicious foods, nice beer, huge screen to watch football and an american theme. this place was definitely different and had very diversified customers, i enjoyed everything ❤️ i didn’t take pictures because i was hanging out with a group and i barely remembered my phone but we all enjoyed our time and will most likely return there so i’ll upload pictures then

do not eat here if you are expecting more than cold appies and ghetto quality. this is a spanish bar trying to be american but very poorly.

lunch time, had to chase the waiter down after sitting down for 10 mins. food arrived and i couldn't believe my eyes! the "traditional" bread with tomatoes (where are they btw?!) arrived cold and with an over use of olive oil... and the "loaded nachos" had plastic cheese that had to be cut with a knife...

unless you are coming here to watch a game and get
if i could give 10 stars i would. hidden jem in barcelona. service was excellent, great food and beer. big recommendation
nice sports bar with lots of youngsters. food not bad and good selection of beer. did not show the epl match i wanted
very good! when i ever come back to barcelona i will win the beerpongtournament #foreversecond :)
daniel and ariel are the best you have to come here. best shots on the east coast of bcn.
a fine bar. you should be aware that the bar seems like its primary visited by the younger audience.
the blonde guy and the colombian guy were super nice with us! they are the best!!
daniel and ariel were really nice to us! 10/10 would recommend
love everyone that works there, super friendly people and the atmosphere is amazing! definitely a must go! also, they host a lot of erasmus events so it’s a good place to meet new people too :)

had some very good patatas bravas from here but they a bit spicy so keep t that in mind when ordering. the staff was very friendly and nice and they let me have a take away! the food came very quickly and it was the perfect pick me up! the water does cost 2 euros but that is quite typical of bars and pubs so i wouldn’t hold it against them.
tourist friendly space in poblenou, drinks after work are chill and relaxed, but from 19 onwards it fills up with tourists, very lively but nice, kind personnel.
very nice staff and great atmosphere! my friends got a birthday cake! went there 2 nights in a row!
i love this guys. this bar is amazing.  excelent everything
we came spontaneously for a late night bite and the burgers were pretty good. also the atmosphere is really charming and they have live music and good beers 🍻
i love it! very nice atmosphere. i was there at a karaoke night organised by erasmus students. there are also beer pong events and the bartenders are very friendly.
quickly served, good tasting food and plenty big enough portion size! all well priced and good staff, seems like a good spot!

our hotel was round the corner and before heading into the city for drinks we started here.
tapas food was fantastic (bravas outstanding)
beer was very good and the bar had a great atmosphere

after a full day of walking and a breathtaking tour of la sagrada família we were exhausted and starving. not one for a bar, we went past and then returned. we ordered beers and hamburgers. blown away good. best burger i've had in years. friendly service and great food. highly recommended.

this place has such a cool vintage vibe. it's right near the enormous flea market, encants. however, small beers cost 2,50€ when they normally cost 1,20 to 1,50€. that fact set my alarms off. the grill smells amazing but be prepared for possibly amazing prices. i'll be back for sure to check it out.
good food and atmosphere friendly staff who spoke english
great for tourists, drinks are quite cheap !! staff are lovely, especially daniel & ro !! went to karaoke night and atmosphere was incredible and had a great time
manager is just the worst! horrible hospitality, place is not what say it is.
this spot is great, definitely stop by if you’re in the area. the bartenders alex and dani are and amazing and took such good care of us. thank you for an amazing night xo
if you don't like loud,  don't go!! fun sports bar with friendly service. could use a few more tvs. lots of locals here.
wow so amazing bar! me and my friends  went to the ping pong tournament on tuesday and had so much fun! really do recommended it!
drinks are expensive, other than that bar is great.
very good tapas and beers at affordable prices. great interior and atmosphere at this sports bar.
great snacks and drinks with great prices. it's a good place to come with the gang to watch sports and have some fun after the beach.
fun bar! in addition to being a sports bar, on some nights they put cumbia music and many people will dance! friendly and down-to-earth staff.
service was quick and easy. staff is friendly and attentive. great music and vibes for a laid back night out.

amazing place! we heard about the sonora sport tavern on our first day in barcelona and decided to check it out. i'm so glad we did, its places is full of charm and character, the staff are too!! the food was brilliant and the atmosphere to match!
can't recommended enough!! if you like party, good food and a brilliant vibe. then definitely worth a visit, highlight of a barcelona trip.
nice american themed ambiance and lots of fun with the beerpong on tuesdays💯
good beer, great tapas/snacks, cheap price$, good service. 6/5 stars
huge americans bar with big drink menu and space
omg i love daniel so much he is so cute and awesome! the best bartender ever❤️ had the best time because of him!
best bar in barcelona. so fun! best pregame for razz…ovella negra so over rated. juan our bartender was the best.
awesome location to have some drinks and snacks while watching football or any other sport. very busy and many locals.
the best bar in barcelona. staff is so nice, music is good, have karaoke/bwerpong. would recommend!

went here on a saturday night, was pretty lively but the food was mediocre at best. worst part of it all was the monotone waiter, i asked him if they serve pizza (due to the fact that they did not have an english menu) and his answer was "this isn't italy" in a monotonic matter. could not tell if he was joking.

we only had interaction with the one waiter, who i'm assuming was the rudest one there.

overall, i would say this place is not tourist friendly.

a lot of other bars could learn a thing or two here. great vibe, cool american styling, great staff, booze and food.
don't change anything guys. see you soon.

after a long day travelling easy and simple regular and dependable food was in order. the pub has a  very pleasant atmosphere, provides decent pub grub. we are staying at nearby hotel and this sports bar restaurant was rated well and lived up to the ratings.  good food, not gourmet but was more than fine, good service, quick and the food was as described. pleasant atmosphere, no football or the reporting event was on so the bar wasn't very busy, yet was being frequented by youngish arty type peo

i really enjoyed the friendly and direct approach by the energetic and cheerful stuff, a nice selection of local beers and non-alcoholic beverages, and an overall sensation that makes you forget about anything else, when you walk in. this place made me feel 10 years younger, maybe that's why i did like it so much. i give sonora sport tavern 5 out of 5 stars.
best pub in barcelona!! they were full but made space for us, so we could watch el clasico with the local people. thank youuu! ❤️
love this place!! such a dope vibe!! staff is super great and welcoming! a must to visit and kick it

nice and delicious food, really good bbq wings with fair prices. full screen football (and other sports) in several screens and in a very well distributed space.

will repeat every derby.
great bar, friendly staff, my girlfriend and i will definitely be back next time i’m in barcelona!!
juan cruz is amazing. his is unmatched anywhere in this city. live music wednesday is the best thing in the world
i went when it was world cup so all tables were reserved so couldn't eat. cool bar though and great for pre gig drinks etc if going to razzmataz
very nice place to have a drink with colleagues of friends afterwork. prices are ok for barcelona, around 3€ for a pint. inside looks a bit like a far west saloon all in wood. giant screen and music.
very cool atmosphere and amazing staff
great place to watch sports, bar staff extremely friendly and the live music is excellent.

nice irish styled bar with excellent tv screen setup to watch games and very friendly staff! the place to be for a sports bar with good food! they even ordered my favourite belgian beer on stock because i asked! (try the ribs!!!)

typical frat/college bar. bland food but that's not why the young crowd is there! game watching a foremost priority, cleared out quickly afterwards. no issues, just better for a younger set and not a good option for catalonian dinner 😊
great pub, good food, nice beer and awesome people.
bad place, dont come here, the owner is arrogant, really bad staff and management
been there for the erasmus beerpong tournament on thuesday. its has been so nice crowded then.

went there without a reservation, on a champions league evening with barca playing that night - the staff went out of their way to find us a place, the service was quick and the food tasty. everybody was busy as the place was packed, so it was understandable that sometimes we had to wait a little bit for attention. the prices were more than fair. would recommend!

fast service with the drinks but the meals we ordered- the burger was stone cold and instead of a steak a chicken breast arrived. the food service was a bit of a mess but nice atmosphere and friendly bar staff.

worst joint in the neighborhood.  they make you wait forever until they finally take your order. i gave them three chances before but i am reminded why i don't like to come here. you easily wait forever for a simple coffee order while they just walk around the joint helping others..it's bad! i just walked away three times..not coming back here.

friendly stuff fluent in english and eager to help despite the workload and specifically the waiter with the tats. the food was very good especially the burgers and the tapas. cheap beers and generally good prices.

we used to love this place but might not come again. grossly understaffed on weekends, one waiter superstressed and the other had no idea how to do the job and did not take our reservation correctly so we waited for one hour while other people around came and eat. meat was raw and gummy. i would be ashamed to offer this service
honestly stumbled across this places after razzmatazz, the best place so hospitable and live pay staff, angela is the best bar woman ever !

best place to have your drink, the variety of their tapas 😋, burgers 😋 chicken😋,pork dishes 😋 i really enjoyed and i don't know what ladie adore but i always saw sparkling eyes and nice smiles. i can't go without mentioning the service juan and the team the non-stoping robots that make sure your order is at your table in time! top recommenadtion!

food quality below average. the staff has an attitude. service is a bit slow. i work near by, i gave it 2 stars because as a pub to have a beer, its ok all good, as a restaurant or anything else very low quality.

i work nearby so i have to go there pretty often (when i don't have a choice). the personal could not be less welcoming. most of the time you say hi(hola) they don't answer, they do not smile. they talk to you like you are bothering them. the food is not that good either.
amazing bar!! such fun vibes and lovely music belgian beers!!!! (we love belgian beers) and much moreee!!!❤️❤️

if you do not mind sitting on slightly uncomfortable seats, the place itself is a nice option to watch games. the meals and the beers are somewhat pricey and the quality could be better, but for a sport's bar, it is a fine option..

rude and arrogant, unfriendly staff.
as a single person wanting to watch the soccer in half full establishment moved from near screen to as far as possible from the screen and when i asked why (i am aged older than general people going there) would not say why. people around me were amazed at my treatment and said the same to me.
i left in disgust. this is not my first time at the bar, my partner and i have spent three nights as a couple in our ten nights in barcelona eating dinner and/or having
service was not good during our visit unfortunately. the kitchen served a burger with a raw beef, and overall the place seemed to need cleaning.
liked the place good for beer, friends & food. opened during the day too. 2nd time:waited more than 10 minutes on the terrace to bring the menu even when i informed them we were outside. just left.
it was good but at 8:00 they told us that there was a reservation and we had to leave the table. i wish we knew that beforehand...
amazing pub! have all the sports showing amazing hosts! definitely go to this bar!

this place is so fun. on wednesday, there are a lot of erasmus people that come here to enjoy some beers and talk together, before going to the razzmatazz (just one block away) and dance the whole night. it's very crowded but you can really feel the soul of españa and spanish people.

very rude waiter who seemed only interested in arguing rather than trying to accommodate to my order (which was simply asking to have a little salad in my omelette sandwich). the end result was charging me for a chicken sandwich with extra cheese, totalling about €1.70 more than the plain cheese omelette bocadillo; rather a lot for a few bits of lettuce and tomato. when i took issue with this he proceeded to argue with me and would not back down. i paid and left, and was asked never to return. n
amaaaazing café!!! the bartenders are friendly, the music is lit and so much more! we loved it omgucci.

just wanted to have a beer and watch a match, alone, quiet, in peace. didn't want a table. the guy literally told me: if you don't have a table get out of here. they are messy, rude and not friendly at all. i'll never get close to this place again.
great bar, lovely staff and decent prices.
very good bar, the barman juan was very helpful as tourists he provided us good information about the city

ribs burn on the outside, covered by sauce so customers cannot see. not cooked in the inside (dangerous with pork). you need to boil the ribs before cooking them, check your cocking book. yet, after telling the chef, i was still charged the full price. and no, i didn't want to wait another 30 minutes for my complimentary dessert... avoid this place or just go for a drink.
friendly staff, good food with good price and nice atmosphere!
great german style beer hall, perfect to have a beer with friends
lively beer hall down the street from razzmatazz. younger crowd, big groups, and lots of birthdays. great way to get the night going. short lines and lots of seating.

cheap and funky student bar.
always full.
it was previously an abandoned factory so the building is really cool.
they do cheap food that isn't bad. the only annoying thing is that you have to set a timer on your phone and go back up to the till to collect the food, sometimes its not ready so you have to go sit back down and return again in a few minutes
cheap beer place. it is impossible to sit down. has some games on the second floor an you can watch the football games on a big screen.

i suppose the one who are going to rate it 5stars are teens mostly, went for a beer with couple of friends, and it's just isn't made to work 50% of it's capacity.

i believe full house, lots alcohol and people interacting is its very essence.

a classic of the nights in barcelona. large and pleasant space, ideal for large groups of friends. relaxed atmosphere to have a few beers and something to eat first thing in the morning, but very lively and fun when the night gets "heated up." the staff is friendly, both at the door and in the room. you will have a good time.

young and party atmosphere. ideal to go with friends to drink beer. old factory where they once worked is now a place of leisure and fun. highly recommended to go only to drink, the food is of very poor quality, it is not worth eating, better to just drink.
quiet atmosphere, the only thing that would be nice if they put batteries in the games room

it is one of the most legendary places in barcelona, ​​near the razzmatazz room.a good place to have a good dinner before going to a good concert. all this makes it an unforgettable night.the good thing about it is that it is a huge place, but you still have to go early if you want to get a place, because it gets full.you can dine on tapas, sandwiches and hamburgers. all this with a good beer or, like i did (because i don't like beer...) a good mojito.
it is one of the quintessential joints in barcelona to go for a drink and have a good time with friends.
a good place to drink and eat, super recommended burgers, simple but very good (€6.50), super spacious place to go with large groups
it arrived super and i had to wait in line for at least 1:30 hours or more.

very nice place to go with friends, it is huge. you have to reserve because it fills up. they have kegs of beer and sangria for 30 euros. there is pool and foosball and there is dancing after 12 or so.
very good place to especially have a drink with friends. what they have to eat is also good. the music could be made a little more upbeat.

good place to go with your partner or friends. the drink is good, with reasonable prices. we have tried the food and it is super good. price quality 👏🏻the structure of the bar is very nice and original.

it depends on your mood and/or your age, maybe it is not the place for you, the number of young people is like a concert and you can hardly talk to whoever you are with because the noise is deafening... if you go with friends who want to shout and drink beer by the liter until you can't take it anymore and with too many people shouting that you can't even find a place to sit, this is the place... and you also have to stand in a long line to get the stamp in your hand, no. it's just arriving and
they have removed table football and billiards. they have moved the bathrooms.

the smell of the toilets is unpleasant, the food arrives cold, the service is bad, you have to get up to ask for napkins and cutlery, a typical place for generation children without values ​​and respect. and the establishment knows what they can do and undo with the client.
good place to watch a game.but with queues and sometimes unwanted people.
good place for big gatherings, beer a bit expensive. at the end when it is full, the noise is a bit annoying.
somewhat high prices, good atmosphere, table football and billiards, good vibes in general.a 10 for the staff
why don't you put the name l'ovella negra as it is original?
it's called the black sheep
pretty average food
a classic that doesn't fail.
past 🤪🤪🤪
the opening times are different than those stated on google, so we found ourselves in front of a closed door.

suprisingly better than the current rating. the service was great and the food delicious. the cochonillo was outstanding and so was the cod bacalao tortilla. the deserts were so delicious, particularly la crema catalan and the cheese cake. it’s a really nice setting inside. value and taste for money is great. i highly recommend.

beautiful atmosphere and customer service! the food was local and well explained. absolutely loved the chicken croquetas and arroz con leche dessert. priced well, we ate a 3-4 course for about $50 per person.

great place . recommended by local friends. love the crispy bread , the fried aubergine, and the paella. there’s one thing look like a lasagne but in a wrap form with chicken fillings , which isn’t heated enough. paella is a bit dry and salty but my local friends said it’s supposed to be like this. over all a lovely place. also the garlic source is great.

excellent white table service. the atmosphere is casually elegant. we had grilled vegetables tender and crisp with a an accompanied a light red pepper sauce. patattes braves came with a savory aioli spicy sauce with crisp grilled potatoes. dishes served at a timely pace.  thegrilled chicken perfectly cooked with a nice piquant sauce was unique to me and delicious. my campanion had the chicken cannaloni that had a creamy white sauce.  she normally shares her dishes with me, but not this time. cla

it was really hard not to fill up on the delicious thin and crispy slices of tomato brushed breads.
our heavy appetizers of broken eggs tossed in a flavorful mix of potato & chorizo, and sausage stuffed with mushroom, with a side of white beans almost filled us up!
then came the hot cauldron of this rice dish with mixed seafood and lobster in a rich broth, which was outstanding! kind of like a soupy paella... good thing we ordered the min. portion of 2 for the 4 of us to share, as it was really

great restaurant that offers traditional mediterranean dishes from all over spain. i loved the interior decor, which is rustic and elegant, with a very warm and inviting atmosphere. the food was absolutely delicious and the portions are huge. we really enjoyed the "pa amb tomàquet" as a welcome dish. it was a delightful surprise and added a lovely touch to the meal. the staff is very friendly and attentive. the drinks selection is also great. the prices are justified by the quality of the food a

with great excitement i finally visited it after some recommendations, well i cannot recommend it anymore. service is great and also nice atmosphere however you need to be aware that you will not enjoy your meal. i am sure the place gets full due to a menu of 8 options (4 firsts, 4 seconds) plus desert and a glass of wine or beer for 16€. who can complain of that? but if you order a la carte then get ready to pay! plenty of plates with spanish typical cousine, some things can't go wrong so stay

we ate here twice a week because the dishes were very good, especially the burger which was very generous and tasty like the portion of fries. also, the wine sangria is a little expensive (24 €) but worth trying.  the only negative point was the servers who weren't  warm and this was the case the 2 times we were there.
incredible place. delicious food and very friendly personal. 100% to visit
very nice traditional place....for 10 persons family or single eater.

we were recommended to come here by the hotel we're staying at. maybe they get a commission because it was terrible. the service was fine and the ambience was ok but the food was terrible. it was tasteless and swimming in olive oil. we had crystal bread - sloppy and tasteless, grilled vegetables and goat cheese - all cold and tasted like they came out of a jar. the tortilla was passable. the tap beer (st miguel) was as expected but cost €10 for a half a litre!

with plenty of good places to eat
best meal i had in barcelona, absolutely delicious all around.

been here twice the food is outstanding, with excellent service at a good price.
update::::: it's been 3 years and we came back.   this place still offers amazing food 😋  1000% percent recommend.  i will say the beef is on the expensive side and i would recommend getting other items from the menu..  5 stars all the way around ✨️
very cozy restaurant in gracia, perfect for a sunday lunch. would recommend the aubergine starter and spicy chicken. service could be a bit more welcoming.
stopped in here for their lunch menu. included, salad, entree, wine and dessert for a very reasonable price. the service was friendly and honestly fantastic here. had a very enjoyable meal!

my roast beef fell off the bone and the sauce. perfection. i also had the obligatory sangria - delish. my rice pudding dessert was the perfect end to a perfect meal. the ambiance, the old school decor, and the music were the cherry on top.
they have an amazing food with excellent selections as well. everything served to me were really delicious and it is not that expensive. this place is highly recommended.

spectacular place with both catalan cuisine, quality products and a formal elegant atmosphere.

the plates are well served with a nice grill flavors.

very recommend.

beautifully decorated in a modern rustic interior, we has such a welcoming and attentive service and all the dishes were fresh and delicious. the two meat dishes we ordered — cochinillo & roast beef were sublime, crunchy cracking and tender meat falling off the bone 👌 they come as quite a big portion so definitely something to share for two. definitely a place to return!

this place is worth it! we went while on vacation. our service made great recommendations and we went by them and he definitely knew exactly what to offer. everything was delicious. everybody was so friendly. the atmosphere was great and love the decorations. 100/100
underrated authentic place, 16 eu lunch menu hard to beat! very fast service!
large portions. potato bravas, canneloni, tomato bread all good. fried artichokes were not good.
nice traditional place. tasty lunch menu with wonderful dessert at the end.

the place is ok for the price, menu 11 euros only (first course, second course, 1 drink, bread with tomato and coconut cake). gazpacho was really good and refreshing, but the beef was too oily. my husband had chorizo with egg and it wasn't so good either, plus there was no spring onion in it, but in the menu it was written.

located in gracia neighborhood, 6 minute walk from our hotel suites center barcelona. awesome food and service.  jose, diana, barca, and the cashier from qc, kabayan were very attentive. everyone should try the roasted suckling pig! highly recommend! and also the fried aubergine, fried artichoke, patatas bravas, bay scallops iberico ham, grilled vegetables and roasted chicken!  we also ordered red wine sangria and cerveza.  they made a mistake with our order but they didn't charge us. great cust
food is really good. but it is very very expensive restaurant.
not bad, not good. expensive. tourist trap with prices, try to scam with additional stuff and upselling of stuff that ended up being 30 euros
just wow!!! take gazpacho and croquettes and actually any meal you see - service is really great 👍 and the place is worth the price! totally 💯
i liked it very much but the portions are huge so be careful.
visited for lunch. ordered rice with fish. the fish was barbecued. with some garnish. costly. yet good.

the wines and food were amazing!

we were being bothered by a female german tourist who intruded on our conversation but that's not the restaurant's fault.
outstanding food!! excellent service!! one of the most warm and welcoming restaurants i've ever been to. highly recommended

avoid if you don't enjoy tourist traps!
we came here june 24 which is a local holiday so there were limited options open for lunch. i wasn't expecting anything exceptional but was hoping for a few tapas and quick decent lunch.
as soon as we sat down the waiter asked us if we wanted the house tomato bread. not our favorite so we declined. another waiter stopped by and asked the same and we once again declined, after a 3rd waiter asked us if we were sure we didn't want to try some, we said ok. onc
had a great lunch here. authentic food and lively atmosphere. very good. spent a little over an hour here.
great dining experience. thankfully there are no tapas!
our favorite restaurant in barcelona. if you didn't eat here,...you missed out. go here every time we're in barcelona.

very authentic spanish restaurant. very popular. delicious food and wine at very reasonable prices. the mixed grilled meats, chicken, pork loin lamb chop, rabbit, two types of sausage and their own black pudding with potato wedges and char grilled peppers was a carnivores delight.
a warm, friendly place. i've been there twice for team dinners, and it's both solid and comforting.

t-bone steak
it was served on a steaming hot plate, you can cook it to the intensity you prefer.
the meat was excellent.
10/10 recommend!

excellent food, service, and environment! went here our first night in barcelona at the recommendation of our hotel concierge. food was traditional spanish fare and we enjoyed being surrounded by locals.
very good menu del dias. reasonable price, and good taste.

we had dinner here with friends at recommendation of our hotel host. we were the first ones seated being americans and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal and dining experience.  food was good quality and well prepared but if you are looking for michelin star food, go to a michelin rated restaurant.  servers were attentive and professional and the atmosphere was great once the locals started pouring in.  two thumbs up and recommended if you are looking for a nice sit down meal (not tapas) in a pleasa

crisp, friendly service, from staff in black/white formal adds to old world charm of this traditional iberian taberna. food is uncomplicated, well constructed, with quality ingredients. it became my 'local' while i was in bcn. me gusta :-)
very nice spanish taverna, nice atmosphere and kind staff, the lamp was super delicious❤️
why can't i give 6 stars for the service? and the meat is great, even for the already high spanish standards. great wine, too. if it's meat dinner you're looking for, you found it.

the food was great and service fantastic. we came right after a long flight and were warmly greeted and sat. unfortunately jet lag hit just as our appetizers (highly recommend the alberginies fregides)were brought out, and we had to ask the staff to box up the rest of our food to take to go. i felt pretty rude but they were kind and understanding. as we were waiting they even brought us dessert! looking forward to coming back later in our trip when we are less out of it.
friendly and professional staff. good food that came quick. menu has a wide variety of options.

this is a very good place in the area of gracia for feeling the spirit of barcelona. traditional and classic restaurant with very good service and spanish cuisine. clientele is more locals than tourists. we liked everything we ordered and the prices were in the medium range, considering also the very central location. a decent place if you have guests and you want to treat them in a fine and affordable restaurant.
very good and autanticly decorated restaurant good food good service

we came in for some caracoles and tinton de verano. the bartender ignored us for awhile when we sat down, but one of the other servers approached us after a few minutes. turns out the bartender doesn't speak english, so he waited until one of the other servers could talk to us. had he tried, i could have ordered in spanish, but instead he just avoided us.

the carcoles were ok, but not as good as some of the other places we visited. the drinks were also just ok. all in all, it was fine, but we l

food was ok.
but we were really disappointed with the fact that we were charged for a draft beer - 10 euro. the beer was not on the menu, still it was available when asking. but the fact that one beer costs 10 euro was conveniently left aside.
on average, in this area a beer costs roughly 4-5 euro.
the argentinian style pot roast was one of the best pot roasts i've ever had and the service was fantastic. price was well worth the quality in my opinion.
it was amazing! everything was delicious!
we had the lunch menu. the quality was very good and the price reasonable.  the service was attentive and quick too. definitely worth a visit if you want excellent local food.
the sangria was good the paella disgusting absolutely terrible burnt . worst meal l have ever been served !!!
good food, fast service, nice atmosphere. the only downside was that a draft beer was 10eur (it's usually 5-6eur). the beer was not in the menu, so we could not see the price.

great menu del dia choice for lunch around gracia.  service is always good, food is always good; standard catalan cuisine.

thursday they have paella on the menu del dia and it constitutes a bargain even if the gambas are frozen instead of fresh.

this is one of our go-tos for a comfortable lunch.
delicious roasted lamb, simply melts in your mouth. good service, cozy atmosphere.
very nice place, various meat dishes, choice of wine, great service. we had entrecote, lamb, chicken and hake fish, all great. yummy starters included the potatoes and fried eggplant.
large portions, food was good not great.  do not accept the bread unless you want to pay and it's covered with a thin tomato paste

bad experience. i took the menu del día and i didn’t like any plate not even the desert. even though i always order my chicken from there and i think it’s good, but the menu isn’t.
the waitress saw that i didn’t eat any plate and she didn’t even ask for the reason .

really good food and skilled personnel! we brought our children (2.5 and 6 yrs) and much thanks to the serving staff we had a great time. i had the leg of lamb and switched the mashed potatoes to baked potatoes, the meat was so tender and the sauce so good i almost drank the last few drops.
it is a tourist trap, please avoid it if you can
a restaurant server poured out hot sauce on my colleague's suit and they don't want to be fully responsible for their fault. one of the most terrible experience in barcelona.

great service
delicious and authentic food
worth the price !!
the food is great 👍 the service is good. the place i can recommend if you have a plan with your love one 🥰

amazing food! the attention is excellent, super friendly staff and the ambiance is super cosy. i always eat well in my beloved bcn, but at the same time few places treat you with warmth. this place was.an amazing surprise. it's a must when in the city.

whilst digesting my food i really couldn't wait to write a review.
definitely a place to come and eat if in gracia! the seafood paella was beautiful, only thing it is quite pricey - €28 euro per person. also what ever is offered,  isn't free so watch out!

beautiful leg of lamb with mash and the gravy was a strong flavour of wine however when poured on the meal it was beautiful.

a must visit with great hospitality!

this was the first restaurant i ever went to in barcelona on recommendation from our hotel and i still go there after living here 6,5 years. great food! also the pollo a last and grilled veggies are great for sunday dinner. don’t wait in the other lines. this is the best.
been there last summer.  all of us approved.  the best restaurant 👌
loved the place, had the dish of the day, drink included, excellent size and taste. not a turistic trap, full of locals.

such mixed feelings with this place. i have a feeling they treat tourists as ignorant people who don't know anything. so the ambience is nice and the waiters are skilled, however, that air of authority from them gets old very fast. the food was good, but you will get it as they feel fit so forget about ordering your steak how you like it, not going to happen.

very decent restaurant, good atmosphere, kind stuff.
menu del dia (currently 11€) is a great value for money, considering the high food quality (3 first and 3 second courses to choose one from each, plus bread with tomato, drink and desert).

lovely restaurant, they specialize in grilled meat, great for families or couples.
due to its rustic decoration, it may be a bit too informal for work related events, although it has the capacity to lodge them.

very good place, it isn't the cheapest you would find but it is very worth it. all the spanish you would need for a nice meal. i recommend asking for a starter plate with no doubt and dare to try the one you don't know. anyways it has a day menu whit three plates and it was very good.

terrible meal! food was not as described on menu, luke warm, not very fresh. my risotto was inedible! pleasant service but very bland dissapointing food. also be careful with extras ie bread orders - as they charge for all of these. sorry to say i would not come here again.

i went there with two foreign friends so we were speaking english.

i guess assuming we were all foreigners, the waiter proceeded to serve local bread which was delicious which we didn't order. where i'm from in spain you don't charge for things you serve and the customer didn't order.  turns out there they do and claimed that's how it's done in town when we were going to pay.

food was ok though their cider was not that great and the roast pork tasted roo gamy for my taste.

keeping in mind how

scam tourists, which says everything about their attitude in running the business— money is more important than people. we were wondering what to order, but wanted to have paella. the waiter said how about he brings some jamón and little things in the meanwhile. we said okay. there was no discussion on the details of the “little things” he would bring, and how many plates. we ended up having way too much before the gigantic paella came. the bill was the shocking one. €40 per person (4 ppl). the
fantastic food with great service,
great place to eat and rest! fantastic service and delicious food. 10/10!
truly delicious food. friendly attentive service with excellent recommendations. a lovely atmosphere. highly recommended. estupendo!
great typical place to taste original spanish dishes

lovely traditional spanish restaurant, we stopped here on our walk back to town from parc guell. from the street it looks like nothing but walk through the doors and there is large rooms full of spanish people having lunch. the cheese tapas was plentiful and good value, we had a vegan and vegetarian with us which had good options, gazpacho soup, grilled vegetables etc. complimentary olives to start and cake to finish excellent friendly service whom helped my daughter perfect her spanish.
the staff was friendly and accommodating to our big group. they provided us everything quickly and promptly. not to mention the food was delicious and helped us start the night off the right way
the roasted pig is good, the skin is crisp and meat tender. the salad is plateful and quite fresh. the dessert is good too. will visit again when there is a chance.
excellent place for lunch, the menu del dia was really good and the atmosphere and service are great, as well as reasonably priced. would definitely recommend.
food really good, steak amazing! i don t give 5 stars because the price for water and coffee was too high and they made me pay 2 portions of tomato bread that we didn t eat.

taberna del cura was one of this trips findings, everything we ordered was absolutely spot on, the staff was very helpful from the get go, food was brilliant and the place itself is very charming will reccomend 10/10
fantastic. friendly staff, ex pat friendly. some of the best food we had while traveling. it will be awhile before we return, but when we get back to barcelona... we'll be back at taberna.

this review is for their take-out rotisserie chicken, which was absolutely delicious. the seasoning was magical and the chicken was cooked to perfection, the  garlic aioli that comes with it is fantastic.
very nice catalan and spanish dishes, tapas, good service and cosy interior. i like going there with friends, specially those who come to visit from outside and want to try traditional kitchen.

delicious! very nice “entrantes”
some of the dishes are massive
the roasted chicken is excellent and convenient

stumbled upon this rustic little restaurant while i was in the area.
i had only the pork trotters and some wine and it was excellent.
dishes on other tables also looked great.
staff were very nice too.
will be coming here again on my next trip to barcelona.

we were looking for the best place in barcelona to try paella in our first trip to barcelona and we wanted to stay from all the tourist trap restaurants and locations. taverna el glop is the place where locals go for amazing food and a good night out! i saw a lot of locals enjoying the food there and i recommend making a reservation of you are looking for a good table! we tries the seafood paella it was amazing, tasted delicious! chicken paella was good too! french onion soup was very rich in fl

the food was good. besides paella and other rice, we ordered few tapas and all of them were delivered to us in two portions. i am not sure if it was because we were 6 people, but we sure did not ask for it. so there was some misunderstanding between us and waiters team. i think it would be better to ask people in the future, if they want to double their tapas or not. or maybe this is restaurant politics? but i don’t remember anything written about it in the menu.

good location, not far from popular places of interesting, so leave you a more local vibe here. nice place to amplify your satisfaction in your barcelona trip! i like the black paella very much. rich in seafood with good taste! the waiters are friendly and helpful! i’ll definitely recommend it if any friend asks me where to find a good place to eat in barcelona.
very tasty paella and wine, really worth a visit. unlike hundreds of overpriced soggy food places by the beach, this place will cook you a genuine (takes 20-30 minutes) paella in front of your eyes.

i spent more than one week trying paella in different cities and restaurants (even valencia) and this was by far the best i ever had. perfect balance of seafood and rice (while most other restaurants put too much rice and not enough seafood), the seafood was cooked perfectly, the rice was not too soft but not crunchy, not too salty either and just delicious overall.
if you want the best paella in barcelona, definitely go here.

if you want a big slab of pork drizzled with a lot of olive oil with side dishes of sweet fried onions, capsicums and aubergine then this will be the place for you! feast on the flavors and the ambience- you really can’t have enough!
a great seafood restaurant. food and drinks 10 out of 10. the portion of paella is huge, more then 2 people can eat. the staff works very efficiently and provides pleasant service.

amazing paella! taverna el glop was a recommendation from a friend and it did not disappoint. i am unfortunately allergic to shellfish but the chicken and veggie paella was amazing. best paella i’ve had! great staff and a comfortable atmosphere.

everyone goes here for the seafood, but let me tell you, the meat here is something to die for. the secretos ibéricos are the best ones i tried here in barcelona, the right portion of fat/slim meat and very fresh, it's 22€ for a portion that will fill you up.
the sangria is also really good, it's nothing special in terms of ingredients, but the execution is very homemade, like you would get in a bar from a village here in spain.
what actually is outstanding about this place is their service, let

really nice tavern style restaurant with one of the best food i had during barcelona visit. i highly recommend onion soup au gratin as it was amazing (it has melted cheeses, onions and bread inside). seafood paella was high quality and really tasty. portion on picture was for 3 persons. for dessert i had some kind of ice cream, which was great. food is a bit expensive (soup 6,60€, paella 18,60€ per person, ice cream 5,25€) but it is well worth the money. service was perfect and atmosphere was gr

the best restaurant i have been to in barcelona. you have to try the black paella. very tasty and with quite a lot seafood. they are also friendly for solo traveler.  i hope i can come back again one day.

we ordered 3 plates to share. one paella de pescado y mariscos (for two), grilled lamb, grilled vegetables, and a cold cut platter. the 4 of us barely finished them because it was lots of food. excellent food. good service and good atmosphere.

medium class restaurant.
delicious meals, the entry, main and dessert are all very good.
menu is quite diverse with classical recipes.
excellent cooks.
nice service.
original deco.
about 30 euros per pax.

superb food and service! we ordered the seafood paella (restaurant policy is to order min for two pax) and a basque style hake. loved both items tremendously. the food was flavourful and both items were fresh. shoutout to dany our server who was so patient with us, explaining the menu in detail and also the wine list. we left behind an item and he even chased us a street down just to return it to us. even though this restaurant has a stellar reputation, really glad that each diner is given due s
don’t miss this taverna!!! lovely place! we loved the rustic authentic atmosphere, amazing mediterranean food !!! highly recommended!!!

wonderful and delicious restaurant in barcelona.
you can make a reservation via whatsapp. there are very kind and also food was wonderful.

paella in resonable price, sangria also perfect.

the table was full, but all of them are very nice and gentle to everyone.

definately visit again
the best paella i have ever had. big portion size and they were very generous with the seafood

it was a super tasty dinner,  we tried the paella and the secreto. both were tasty at an ok price. the place is super hidden it looks like there’s almost no tables then when you enter there’s a full secret room backdoors quite interesting.

very charming place ^^
the paella with the sea food 🥘 was just excellent !

i wish i had taken photos of our appetizers, because they were also so very delicious!

everything we ate was spectacular, as well as the service!

small cozy restaurants located by the street. reservations are made via whatsapp, recommend a booking beforehand especially on weekend nights or if it’s a large group. although the paella says it serves one, the portion is definitely big enough for two not so hungry people. would recommend ordering a paella and other appetizers or side dish if you have more than two. sangria is nice and worth the value as well. staff was friendly and very patient even though i speak almost no spanish at all. a g

a friend of mine recommended me this place as one of the best local restaurants.

the location and atmosphere is really great. the food is very tasty! the meat is delicious i totally recommend duck!. sangria was also great.

unfortunately, it turned out that the owner forgot one of our meals (even though he asked two or three times what do we want). we were waiting almost 20 mins for nothing. thank god one of the waiters noticed us and was able to save the day and get me my meal straight away. c

there was a set menu available at €14 per person when we visited😝 n there was a waiter(alex) who was able 2 communicate in english😅🥲 shown 2 our seats upstairs😊. we  ordered lamb steak with ribs 😋 but served lamb chops instead 😵😬 (was given a correct replacement when requested) tis was very yummy n tender😋🤩 but steamed mussels was smelly😷 n tasted not fresh🤢😕, we asked 4 cancellation instead of re-ordering🙁. secreto iberico was amazingly delish😋🤤 n squid-ink paella with seafood, for 3 persons, w
one of the best spanish food we’ve ever had. and we see a lot of locals dinning here. it is also highly recommend to make a reservation for larger groups. will be back for more stuff on the menu.
we had a great time dining in at taverna el glop. we ordered the seafood paella, and it was delicious. more than enough for two people. this restaurant should be on your list to visit in gràcia.

me and my friend ordered secreto ibérico. my meat turned up dry, overcooked and not looking like what i ordered or the secreto ibérico my friend had because it wasn't the same!!! i asked the waiter if this was the correct dish. he said yes but a different cut. i said really??? so we pay the same??? he looked at me dismissively and said 'yeah' then walked off. look at these photos and tell me this looks the same dish to you? plus they gave us all the wrong side dishes. won't go back.

this was one of the best places we visited in barcelona. the paella was the best one (we tried chicken). we loved the sangria as well though it is not too alcoholic but it compensates for this with freshnes! usually the place is very busy but we managed to find a table for too everytime we went there. the cooking in general is really really good, the starters are wonderful, the traditional cooking also. the grilled meat is well prepared though not too well seasoned, but still it is a good choice

went at 7 pm without a reservation. at that time still not too crowded but soon after people started showing up.
very generous serving size.
grilled vegetables with goat cheese. ink rice (very tasty, not too salty. price listed on menu is for per person). cod is very tender.
love the marinara mussel and black rice paella! me and my friend went there twice in 4 days just to have the marina mussel again!

the best paella in the city for sure, probably the best one i've ever tried in my life.
but the atmosphere is not the best, you are definitely going to find yourself among tourists, in a tiny dark place.
however, the stuff is super nice and friendly, and delicious food worth the struggle with the look of the place 😂
beautiful decor, amazing service, food was very typical of catalonia and delicious. 5 starts.
really enjoyed our dinner at el glop. ordered gaspacho and seafood paella and meat assorty. all was amazing taste and quality and very reasonable price. thank you juan for a good service.

we made a reservation via whatsapp on the previous day and today we went there for lunch. everything we tried was delicious - salads, toasts, artichoke, seafood paella, cuttlefish and calamari. i definitely recommend to visit for authentic tavern experience!

traditional catalan restaurant in gracia neighborhood. the restaurant is quite big and it filled up with locals. love the caracoles a lot and also the seafood paella, there are so many seafood inside. surprisingly the paella is not salty, cuz most of the paella restaurants here are way too salty. very attentive service. would like to return and try the grilled dishes.
very nice restaurant with casual environment!
really nice old fashioned tavern. lunch was kinda of quick but everything was good quality

i went there at 2:30 and without reservation. there was no queue and not as crowd as i thought. the waitresses are nice and friendly. i ordered a black rice to share. however, me and my boyfriend do think pealla is quite salty and the portion is quite big. i would recommend this restaurant for group dinning, still i believe there would be some better choices for having a nice paella

i was looking for a place where to eat a proper paella. i met this guy working in a sandwich place that recommended the best place to eat paella.
i have to say it. i had one of the best sangria i ever had in ages and the paella.. it was incredible! we got a vegetarian and a classical fish. both were amazing!
the only thing i was not that happy about was the owner.
i went to pay the bill, i asked if i could have an espresso before paying saying that i would pay it separately. the owner wasn't tha
awesome place. from the entrance it looks small but it has separate room with more tables. all the food was delicious and it’s near sagrada familia so it is a great place to have a meal.
super nice! the portion is reasonable, the flavor is nice. the service is perfect. in one word, you have to come to have a try!

while the food was super good, the restaurant seems to be located in an area that didn't feel very safe.
the food was tasty and very well cooked, but the service is sub par. the waiter, eli, serving us dropped the fried artichokes on our table while placing it. while trying to avoid that he spilled the gazpacho too. he did ask us if we wanted to change it, but the point being he didn't seem to be polite or warm when he was serving  us. the waitress adriana didn't want to serve us tap water despi

the restaurant is located on the corner of a small alley, with a small frontage but with a special place inside. the cantaloupe with ham was really amazing, and the paella was excellent. very good experience.

amazing charcoal grilled steak and fish.delicious fried artichoke appetizer. beautiful restaurant and delightful attentive service. the atmosphere and open kitchen was delightful. watching the grill chef was like a finely choreographed act. he was never frazzled and focused. the dishes came out perfect! highly recommend

i lived in barcelona all my life. now when i come back i always like to go to el glop to enjoy the true and classic flavor of catalan cuisine. great variety from the sea and meats. a spot not to miss for locals or if you visit the city.
this was the cutest place. out front it looks a little small, but is way bigger, when you get inside. the staff was wonderful, and the food was amazing!

staffs are very friendly
but the manager was little racist and rude.
food is okay, lots of seafood in paella

i booked a table for 2 at 19:00 and arrived at 18:55, the receptionist was very rude, stared at me and asked me my reservation information for the whole time and asked us to wait until 19:00. but in the meantime, a group of 8 people without reservation came in and the receptionist asked them to divide into 6+2. and the 2 was invited to the table before us. at 19:02 we were brought to the table and the receptionist said we have to finish our dinner in 1 hour( also in a rude way)but the food would
one of the best paella i had in barcelona. unfortunately the minimum order is really large for 2 pax, so didn’t get a chance to try other dishes.
best food we tried in barcelona, and stuff are really friendly! daily menu is best choice!

if you want proper seafood paella or fideua (we had the latter), look no further.  the food is out of this world!! definitely not a tourist trap (though everyone does speak spanish/english if needed).  our server was a little grim (probably because we were tourists), but other than that, amazing, delicious, friendly, and wonderful dining experience in every respect. highly recommend!!

for reference, a fiduea/paella for 2, an appetizer/side dish, a salad, and a bottle of house wine plus tip came

the staff is very friendly and that they made us the melon even it’s a summer fish. paella has to be minimum portion for two person but it’s pretty big. we three girls didn’t manage to finish everything
great local food. due to language barrier and barely speak english you find them rude. but they are trying to accommodate me. all in all i’m here for food and it’s one of the best local food
the great paella in barcelona, the staff was friendly and kind, the food was great and delicious. i suggest to try paella seafood and mussels. the waiter karim was so helpful and friendly. 🙏

excellent lunch, very young stuff including chief . it is my husband’s birthday and they celebrated with us. they put happy birthday music and brought us baklava . thank you for delicious food and great service

delicious food, great ambience, lovely service!

menu of the day here was amazing. for less than 12€ you can get a home-cooked spanish meal.

i recommend the galta and the entrecot- plus for dessert, the lemon mousse and the flan!

no wonder they have so many reviews!

thank you, el glop!!

quite nice athmosphere inside. paella seems to be the speciality of the house. can totally recommend to get one. prices are a little bit above average but totally fair. house wine is good. good selection of desserts. very friendly staff.

i had some mixed feelings before visiting that restaurant. was thinking it’s not really good, but my  wife decided to go here and i agreed.
the restaurant is good but have not only spanish dishes.
i love mussels marinara, stuffed aubergine is great, and here i got one of the best in my life grilled artichoke. pork sausage with haricots it’s ok. my wife told me that the pinup soup was ok too.
wine by glass is not good.
a friend recommended this place for their paella and it was indeed great. the atmosphere and vibe made it a good dining experience. remember to make reservations!

three stars are entirely given to the secreto iberico steak because that’s the only thing i actually liked, and the rest of my experience there was really just at most a one star experience. the waitresses there clearly seemed as if they did not want to work and tried their best to ignore the customers. the black rice and cuttlefish was way too salty to even finish the dish. if you’re used to chewing tire-like salty squid, go ahead.

talking about food? no comments, it was amazing! one of the best croquettes i have ever tried in barcelona! paella was amazing and the “secreto ibérico” was delicious! no words...however i had to go and get plates after almost 10 minutes waiting with our food on the table and my coffee came with a surprise, a little insect! would go back for a second chance!

this place was amazing. we were a walk in and at first we were worried we wouldn’t get a table because the restaurant was packed, but we only waited 15 minutes for a table. we started off with the patata bravas for the appetizer and the chicken and vegetable paella for the entree. the paella was phenomenal and definitely worth the wait. i wish i had more time to come back here and try the seafood paella. a must try in gràcia! i recommended making a reservation in advance if you can.
we came for the seafood paella and was not disappointed. very flavorful and filled with fresh seafood. also ordered potatas bravas and croquetas on the side and those were average though.
best sangria i had in spain! delicious food, especially the eggplant and provolone cheese. highly recommend. recommend to book if going for dinner as gets busy!

for me a classic in the city, offering good catalan specialties since the late seventies. this one is the original, in the heart of gracia neighborhood. salads, toast, grilled meat, calçots and now also rice options including paella. all of it keeps the good quality and excellent service. they know their job. offering also a nice daily menu at a fair price. the space has gotten popular over the years so it is a bit too crowdy now but still worth a visit.

my second visit after many years, good to see that business is booming but their food still good. i had bbq pork cheeks (i think) whatever it was it was delicious. house rioja just fine too. sat by the kitchen and enjoyed the staff joking around. you should book but there are two el glops, so make sure you choose the right one, and sit in the big room where the kitchen is for maximum experience!

the ambiance and history is a lot to take in. it’s a great meal after a morning at the segrada familia. the pictures in the restaurant depict what the segrada familia was back when it was first built. great to see. the food was great, everything felt like it had its personal touch, the goat cheese salad had you saying why don’t you put some salad in my goat cheese, in the states you would never see that amount in a salad. the ham over melon was fresh, the eggplant parm cleaned the plate,  i had
good food, good service, central location.  because the restaurant is very crowded, you should book a table before coming.

i was looking for a good, catalonian restaurant.
here in barcelona, you will everywhere see restaurants, but when it comes to quality, it's not that easy to find something rlly good...!!!

anyways, me and my family have eaten there, rlly good, like it was so good.
the food is freshly made/cooked and the ambient of the restaurant is very traditional built.

the only thing that was a little bit annoying, was the long waiting time, but we were informed about it, from the waitresses and on the menu

my second visit after many years, good to see that business is booming but their food still good. i had bbq pork cheeks (i think) whatever it was it was delicious. house rioja just fine too. sat by the kitchen and enjoyed the staff joking around. you should book but there are two el glops, so make sure you choose the right one, and sit in the big room where the kitchen is for maximum experience!

the ambiance and history is a lot to take in. it’s a great meal after a morning at the segrada familia. the pictures in the restaurant depict what the segrada familia was back when it was first built. great to see. the food was great, everything felt like it had its personal touch, the goat cheese salad had you saying why don’t you put some salad in my goat cheese, in the states you would never see that amount in a salad. the ham over melon was fresh, the eggplant parm cleaned the plate,  i had
good food, good service, central location.  because the restaurant is very crowded, you should book a table before coming.

i was looking for a good, catalonian restaurant.
here in barcelona, you will everywhere see restaurants, but when it comes to quality, it's not that easy to find something rlly good...!!!
