anyways, me and my family have eaten there, rlly good, like it was so good.
the food is freshly made/cooked and the ambient of the restaurant is very traditional built.

the only thing that was a little bit annoying, was the long waiting time, but we were informed about it, from the waitresses and on the menu

we had a really enjoyable evening at the glop. the wine, served in a porron, was cheap and palatable, the paella was scrumptious and filling, the atmosphere jovial and relaxed with a bunch of italian youngsters singing against better judgment. . a proper tavern experience.

this is definitely the right choice if you wanna experience a local food in an environment full of personality. this taverna looks to be a very traditional one and they have amazing paellas and black rice. i highly recommend. we walked from the cathedral (sagrada familia), had pause for lunch at el glop, then walked up to the park guel.

the seafood paella was delicious. it took about half an hour but was well worth the wait. the price is €15 per person and requires a minimum of 2 people. 3 out the 4 of our mussels were closed though (you can't eat them).
everything was very good! the favorites of our table were the grilled provolone cheese, the paella, and the fish soup! very nice service — i would highly recommend going!

was lucky enough to get seated on a crowded night with no reservation. sangria is only served in the carafe but was delicious. seafood paella was so big, two of us barely put a dent in it. come hungry!

the inkfish paella was really good! big portions and fresh seafood.

here is menu with the most updated prices.

we went as a big group and did not have an option to ask for a group menu even when booking in advance. stuff was rude. he did not smile and looked very annoyed when we reminded him to bring the glasses because we had the wine on the table already for some time. food is good, typical catalan and the ambience is according to it.
super cozy, local place with high quality food. service was a bit slow but it’s a busy place and it’s spain so i wouldn’t expect much different. highly recommend the salmon al cava and arroz senyoret

we didn’t get to eat here because no one took our order, we waited for half an hour, this after they told us that we can eat there only if we finish in one hour because afterwards every table is booked. i told the waiter twice that we are ready to order but he kept telling us “just a moment”.
came here to grab early dinner and we ordered paella. the plate was so big for two but we managed to finish since food was really good! loved the wine as well and staff is very nice!

great staff, the paella and the rabbit was an amazing fully tasted, i highly recommend this place, the restaurant is not wheelchair access but was easy to get through the small step at the door. thank you all the waiters for the service

the service is exceptionally good!
they are stressed but in the little details you notice, they care for your wishes.

the food was amazing, original and authentic! don’t expect like fancy candlelight but honest and good kitchen!

you should make a reservation one or two days before.

the very best reason for me to come back to barcelona!

you can’t go wrong eating here. it’s always a good plan. i’ve tried half the menu and i was always delighted and reassured with wondrous plates, either from the lunch menu or the regular menu. also, they don’t close shop during the day, because they are smart. one thing that stands out is how they give you the necessary ingredients to make your own pa amb tomaquet. garlic, tomato, olive oil, salt and bread; deal with it.

located in gracia. found it with the help of good maps and reviews. had an awesome meal here and the value was excellent. paella, roasted vegetables, green peppers and croquettes all excellent. finished it off with a creme catalonia. perfecto. a nice simple, authentic spanish restaurant. i'd happily go again.

excellent calcots and romesco sauce!

service was excellent, and delicious cava. food is a bit on the pricey side so we just had the calcots and the grilled artichokes, which were both fantastic
had the seafood paella which was delicious and loaded with seafood. really generous portion that i struggled to finish. croquetta as starter was also great. really friendly and attentive staff.

i have been vacationing in spain for three weeks and this is the best restaurant i have found so far. amazing service! very friendly staff! and the food was over the top great!!! if you have the opportunity to try this restaurant you will pleasantly surprised!!!

this was the very first restaurant i tried when i arrived in barcelona and it sure was a treat! it's located in a quiet area and can go unnoticed unless you know you're looking for it. the portions are amazing and one can easily be enough for two people which will bring the meal to a very low budget. i had the chicken paella and the house salad and both were truly delicious.

a very traditional looking restaurant with some nice dishes. we really enjoyed the artichokes, the bravas and the pan con tomate.
make a reservation to go.

nice experience - i really recommend the croquetas, it was really tasty.
i wouldn't recommend the chuleta ibérica, although it was alright, i felt that it wasn't the menu best option.
the staff is nice - serve the table in a calmer pace, so don't come if you are one of those person that want everything at once.
great experience, probably i'll return to try other dishes.
great paella. my family and i agreed that this is the best paella we had in while in barcelona. the wine is amazing as well. all with reasonable prices.

ate the seafood paella, was really nice, everything tasted nice and fresh from the sea! the portion was really big, so the price is fair. a glass of wine for 3€ is a fine addition.

don't be fooled of the front room looks empty, they bring you in a back room were the atmosphere is really good. from there you can look directly into the kitchen.
great place 🙌🏼the service was very friendly. the food was delicious. we had mussels and octopus. the best restaurant we visited during our stay in barcelona.

i’m not a local so i don’t know how authentic the food is, but i can say that i am super satisfied at the end of my meal. i got the seafood paella and a glass of cava and it was ~€18 before tips. the paella was great and there was no shortage of seafood in each spoonful of it. i came in around 8pm and most of the patrons are tourists. after 9pm, however, i noticed some locals coming in (but the majority was still tourists).

i have bought there magic bag through too good to go for 3,99 what was supposed to be a big promotion of original price of 10,50 and received pasta with brussels sprouts. for sure was not worth it. for that price of 10,50 was the whole menu with meat or fish to choose. so promotion was not a promotion to me.
perfect for a bite on a rainy or chilly day...they have a covered patio (which is rare around here). typical catalan neighborhood bar, so the food won't really wow you, but no complaints.
quite an average food, but not expensive

family and cozy restaurant with very good menus, the food is always good and the service is pleasant, menu of the day for €12.95 includes starter, main course, bread, drink, dessert or coffee. good value for money. i recommend you
excellent for breakfast. aromatic coffee and good snacks. highly recommended!
very tasty homemade food, well prepared, it shows that they do it with time and love, the service is 10, the truth is i loved the place, the food and the treatment. half price. high quality.

as soon as i arrived i said that it was for lunch for two people and the woman at the bar who looked like she ran the restaurant didn't want to understand me until i told her in spanish. it is a site that discriminates against catalan and therefore i cannot recommend it. i didn't stay for lunch.

unbeatable price quality.they use organic galician meat in their menu.very nice and well decorated placeattention, 10, super friendly without being overwhelming.the grilled iberian lizard is delicious.i recommend it.
excellent for breakfast, good coffee and very good sandwiches!
good restaurant for breakfast and mid-day menus. very good quality price. very good coffee. they are fast and very nice. highly recommended
highly recommended for breakfast, it should be noted that they make sandwiches on the spot and with quality sausages. of the best in the area!
very homely place. homemade food and very friendly staff
bar-restaurant for breakfast, they have good offers (i recommend the eggs and sausages offer). the spectacular midday menu!! quiet atmosphere and excellent service.
correct menu in quantity/quality and pricefor my taste something small in quantityvery fast attention

i discovered it recently and since then, whenever i can on my break, i go with my colleagues to eat the famous sandwich they have weekly, the service is wonderful and their delicious sandwiches are out of the ordinary.
we went to eat during our time in barcelona and it was a pleasant surprise. homemade food at a great price.i recommend it.
great quality/price ratio. homemade food. they treat you very kindly.

upon entering you encounter a familiar, welcoming situation, with really nice guys who create a fun atmosphere. a stone's throw from one of the most beautiful areas of barcelona, ​​gracia. excellent dishes served for lunch! highly recommended! excellent coffee!
good, quality food, with a varied menu and service of 10.
i went to eat the lunch menu and it was truly excellent. quality exceeds the price. the owner treats you like one of his family. service and food 10
delicious food, very cozy place and spectacular treatment. i will be back!
very good price quality, a highly recommended place to eat from the menu
highly recommended for lunch and making a menu, unbeatable price
fairly fair midday menu. the staff is friendly but the space is a bit crowded.
highly recommended to go to eat. the service is fast and attentive. we will be back!
spectacular bar to eat and have a relaxed time
i eat here often for work and it has a good menu for a low price. highly recommended for menu

i usually go several times a week to eat the lunch menu and the price/quality ratio is great. in the afternoon there is very good background music and it is a highly recommended place to have a drink.

very delicious breakfast and coffee, comfortable environment, and friendly owner. it is one of my favorite restaurants during this trip. i will go there again next time i go to barcelona. wait for me😚
traditional catalan bar, with fast, friendly and efficient breakfast service. i recommend sandwiches and lunch menus. the thursday paella is delicious!

the blue orange bar is a bar run by a galician, meaning quality food in abundance, and drinks will never be lacking.you can see that they have the best industrial beer in the world, estrella galicia, something brutal is that they have black coupage, estrella's best beer by far.not content with that, they have a wide variety of beers, i am a lover of ipas, mmmm try them...they are excellent at making coffee, with love, i recommend the coffee with toffee, as you can see in the photo you drink it
a place to repeat! cozy place where you will find good quality homemade food at a more than affordable price where professionalism, friendliness and good food come together.
very good homemade food, good taste and price

i'm from valladolid, someone told me about this place. and without a doubt a great success.they were right in their recommendation.friendly treatment, cozy place and the food all exquisite.i will return without hesitation on future trips

we are from galicia and on a trip to barcelona we decided to get advice from local people in the area to eat at lunchtime a week. and the one that won the most votes from the people was the blue orange, and to our surprise it was the best restaurant in barcelona without a doubt, a 100 in everything, homemade food, you have everything from menus to more elaborate dishes whose presentation leaves anyone stunned. , and at a very good price, we ordered paella and mixed dishes and the quality of the
they maintain professionalism, quality and excellent treatment. from first thing in the morning until they close (mid-afternoon). dog friendly.
the best menu bar in the area without a doubt, a pleasant place with good value for money, cordial and professional treatment by the workers. i will repeat...
quality food at a good price, good place to eat a menu, have breakfast or have something to drink in the afternoon. good atmosphere, good treatment and cleanliness.
very kind, friendly staff. good menu, comfortable place. price quality, correct. good place to go from time to time.
small place but with very good presentation of the food and, above all, good flavor at a very affordable price
homemade food, with an unbeatable quality/price ratio. €12 menu
small place with pleasant staff and menus at good prices, for coffee lovers, they serve a very aromatic and excellent flavor
very good restaurant, unbeatable menu and excellent service!
homemade food, very good value for money. unbeatable treatment.
excellent place, spectacular food and the waitress a 10. i will repeat for sure.
very good value for money. varied daily menu.
good value for money, good lunch menu. recommendable
i love orange! it's all very good! they do everything with great love! highly recommended!
very good service, great site, high quality
very good menu! very good coffee! but best of all the waiter's smile!
too bad the owner is not gay. highly recommended especially for their estrella galicia beer!!!
a place where you are well taken care of. the food is very good. highly recommended.
great assortment of sandwiches. highlight the hamburger with bacon and cheese!!!
great find! good sandwiches and better coffee! avoid peak hours because it gets very crowded!
everything delicious and excellent treatment
good menu (the potatoes are real) at a good price and good service...
environment, treatment and quality services. what a shame not to have it nearby, to be able to go every day....
lovely service and large portions at a good price!!
nice, a little spacious, but the food nothing special. just meet
extraordinary sandwiches, perfect coffee and friendly service. the best of the zone!!
a great place, the food is wonderful!!!excellent treatment, thank you!!
excellent treatment and competitive prices for the area. a 10.
a good neighborhood bar, cheap prices and good service!! with imported beers!!!
very good. the best breakfasts in the area.
i especially recommend their iberian ham!! and its good service!
excellent quality price
the best beef fricando in barcelona!
not bad! good value for money
perfect for breakfast
brutal great service and the owner very beautiful
family treatment. good sandwiches and good coffee.
very hearty and varied food.
correct menu price and quality!
very good bar and very friendly waiter.
waiter0 very handsome and friendly ........ very good service
good product, friendly and very affordable
you eat well
impressive homemade mushroom sausage sandwich!
the boy is very professional. good raw material.
highlights both meat and pasta and good desserts
good and pleasant. graciss
best restaurants in barcelona
excellent sandwiches!
satisfactory, original site and good service
let them dedicate themselves to something else
lovely staff...

heerlijk ontbijt en lunch gehad met leuke bediening!

delicious breakfast and lunch with nice service!

nice metal bar with good drink options. it is a large place with enough places to sit and good music. the music is not that loud which allows you to have a nice conversation. the pint of draft beer was 4.5 euros.
this bar is perfect for what it is. it is a basic metal music bar i wish it had more food options but they let you bring food from outside which is great :)

great place to drink and enjoy the evening with friends!

their setlist mostly includes hard rock & heavy metal music!

they have two soccer table in the back

this is a place with a very industrial decoration and loud heavy metal music, but unlike one might think, it is not crowded. in fact, it has plenty of space and it is very comfortable for large groups of people. commonly people come here to play their famous board drinking game, which includes the board (a large piece of paper), the players pieces, which are beer crown caps), and a big blue bucket filled with wine mixed with coke. i have gone twice and i have had much fun. all in all, it is a go

pretty cheap and good if you want to drink as much as possible but the decoration was unimpressive. if you are a big group you'll have to move to the "basement" and there's no music playing there. also, people are a bit too loud, to the point that you have to kind of shout even if the people are not that far from you.
the best local in barcelona. drinks & best metal music. good choice.
one of the best metalheads bar in barcelona! \m/.
the music , atmosphere , and the drinks were awesome

heavy metal music venue, with good drinks and atmosphere, although lately there are people who are not into it. i don't know if there is any food, they used to make french fries. the drink is good and the price is reasonable. the service is friendly.

to have a good time, drinking and getting drunk is fine hahahathe music and the foosball tables are cool.you never get cold here, you will always get hot no matter the time of year.there is almost always room to sit and have a good ocalimocho.your trusted marina bar.

large pub with plenty of seating. lots of variety of drinks at reasonable prices. music that they don't usually play in other places. i give the 3 stars because with the amount of money that must go in there they will be able to renovate the bathrooms because they are in a sorry state. the girls' bathroom: neither of the two sinks has a latch, so you have to hold the door yourself so that no one opens it, or ask someone to watch that no one enters. the lid of one of the toilets moves when you s

with what you get in the calimocho buckets, it wouldn't hurt to change the bathroom doors, as those of us who pee while sitting validate 3 years of aerobics so that our embarrassments don't show. i don't go out anymore, but i've wanted to say it for a long time haha
very good vibes, good music and it feels like homeange and david, they are already part of the familyvery spacious and well decorated place in heavy metal rock style 🤘🤘🤘🤘🔥🔥🔥
a bar with a good atmosphere and heavy music. the owners of the place, very good people.

if you like heavy metal, this is one of the few places left in marina, the best? you can order buckets with calimocho, valencia water, beer, etc... and they give you a board that is like the game of goose but for drinking, it is super fun! highly recommended!

one of my favorite bars, where you can have drinks at a good price, at large tables, good atmosphere and they even offer some drinking games. he is one of the few that still plays the music loud enough to thrill everyone and encourage them to sing.

for me the best place to go for a drink if you are a heavy/rocker. it's a place to call "home". the atmosphere on saturdays is packed where it is rarely easy to find a place, but you see hordes of people standing waiting to sit down while having a drink. it must be for a reason, right?the owners are a sweetheart and the waiters, apart from working well in front of so many crowds at the bar, i guarantee that they are very good people (i guarantee this because i have even made friends after meeti
good prices, footballs and metal music. shame about the speaker system because it sounds pretty bad. a perfect place to go for a touch.

one of the only bars left in the entire marina neighborhood that plays heavy music since the horde of posh people in shirts began to come, people who are like dogs but who are not, and the canis since they learned that drinking in this neighborhood is cheap for at least 6 years. because of these people, there was less and less heavy music with each passing year until you barely heard heavy music in any bar, let alone clubs. a few months ago they tore down half of the entire street. it made me v

it is a bar where you can have a drink and play table football.the music is always very loud so if you don't like noisy places you shouldn't go.there is a good atmosphere and i have never witnessed any fights.

very good place to drink before going out. there is a good quality price relation. ideal to spend some time with your friends. there is table football and rock music. drinking board games, laughter is guaranteed. near razzmatazz.
great place to listen to rock, heavy music. the best thing is there is no reggeton! in summer it is very hot

of the little decent that is left in marina along with children of cain. two pubs that are still what they were before. i preferred (i don't understand why) to go to the open but now i have a clear idea of ​​which one i will go to next time.
typical bar in marina, you went when you were young in 2000, but you go now with 30i peak and you still get drunk the same. beware of jagers. they sell good alcohol. spacious premises
the sailor's joint par excellence. affordable prices, good service, good alcohol, excellent agua de valencia. of course, at certain times of the night the bathrooms are painful to see.
very good, our trusted bar. don't ask for the heavy blood! it's good but it leaves you tinki winki
i've been going for 12 years now. it's a great bar to go to before going to the clubs. the music is cool and so are the prices.
oh yeah! if you like the rock atmosphere...it's a good place...but bring wipes because your shoes will stick to the floor ahahaha it's a joke
it is one of the favorite places to be with colleagues and listen to good heavy music.and the people who frequent it are very good.there is a very good vibe.🤘🤘🤘
very good rock bar! good prices, excellent music and a good rock atmosphere. i liked that the music was varied within the rock/metal genres.
it is an excellent bar with very cheap prices and a very good atmosphere
perhaps the most classic heavy bar in barcelona. it is still a noisy, dirty, old place with all the defects you want to see. but they play the best metal and some decent beers.
the best metal there is in barcelona, brutal. very good music, very good atmosphere, amazing decorations. seriously highly recommended, a paradise!
top pub with rock metal music and a very good atmosphere.
wonderful, the waiter always with a smile on his face, friendly, funny and charismatic. the unbeatable drink and incredible music.
the most authentic place in the entire marina. i've been going for many years and they never lose their heavy essence!
great experience. lots of heavy metal and a very good atmosphere
good bar with good music and a very good atmosphere. of course, the toilets were very poorly maintained and very dirty.
good place if you are looking for cheap drinks and a relaxed atmosphere
mythical! great for its music, atmosphere, quick dinners and drinks!
they have good music and it is ideal to be with friends chatting and drinking
unbeatable treatment, with a smile on your face. brutal music. it's my favorite bar in marina :)
a magnificent bar to play drinking goose with colleagues, pleasant atmosphere and variety of buckets, the waiters are great
it's very cool, good atmosphere, good music, good alcohol, table football, one of the best things in marina, keep it up
3 stars because when he says "we repeat" he refers to the music, not the danet custard
the only or one of the only places in the marina that doesn't just play classical music but also plays current rock and metal with a very good atmosphere.
good bar to go in a group to drink, with good rock music and a good atmosphere.
good service, good people, variety of drinks, good music
heavy metal and good people! what more can you ask for?
lots of space, good alcohol and better music 10/10
cheap drink and very good water from valencia. the music that plays is heavy/rock
mandatory stop before a bovedazo!!!!rock & rooouuull!!!!!
good atmosphere. perfect to tune up before starting a big night
ideal bar to have some calm, the only bad thing is the bathrooms and that in summer it is very hot!
an essential place for your marineo nights
he called me bald without meaning to. i don't understand anything.
too good for normal people
very good atmosphere, i recommend the sangre heavy!
an average place, but the drink is very well priced.
the place is not bad, the only thing is that the bathrooms require interesting workmanship.
good heavy metal atmosphere, lots of people.
dirty and poor staff treatment, if not edge. compensate for music and cold beer
god, jesus joseph and mary.
the game of goose with sangria is deadly 🤣❤️
good place to start the night, good prices and table football!
good atmosphere, the only drawback is the bathrooms.
i thought it no longer existed!!! it was my final route on saturdays!!!
my favorite club, more family than anything else.
with an okalimocho, laughter is guaranteed
a classic faithful to its origins
the best joint in the area. pure r&r
drink here like good heavy
good board games with good cubes ;)

we are in barcelona with other colleagues form work. back at home we found reviews of the restaurant and decided we would go there. we were very well looked after. we just showed up. no reservation, and they accommodated very quickly. a man called angel was a real angel and can't remember the other two people looking after us but they were fantastic! food was delicious and we all found it mind blowing. had a great time. thank you folks.
classic barcelona. very nice pasta and pizza. very classy
favourite restaurant in barcelona. authentic, great food for great price and the best service.

nice first floor for groups..
and piano
old fashioned charm and wonderful italian food.

despite its name, the restaurant is more catalan than italian i would say. great generous main dishes (fish, meat, rabbit etc), and not pricy at all. simple and tasty, good food for the money, and a good option when looking for some local food too. to finish, maybe the best grappa in town (possibly courtesy, if you behave)
wondeful time lapse of what new wave brought to restaurants in barcelona, in front and with the flash flash they are modern landmarks. food is acceptable, but the place is worth the detour!

awful, overpriced food in a place, that hasn't been touched for 30 years (don't get fooled by the pics, it's simply shabby!). also the waiters couldn't care less about their work.
the burrata tasted like mozzerella from a gas station. the pasta were overcooked, bathed in an uninspiring sauce. my company (italian) had an ok lentil salad and equally disappointing pasta. (all ordered a la carte)
very quite and original place, with piano live music some days. delicious pasta, not specially cheap, but very appropriate prize fot its quality. i really enjoyed the experience in general.
decor is nice & original but would need some refreshing, the food is very basic for the expensive price, on the menu it looks haut de gamme but plates were very disappointing.
place is very cool. good service. food is okay. quite expensive for what you get, and for barcelona
a really cosy place. nice environment and great food!  pasta is always an excellent choice in ill giardinetto and a drink after dinner makes it even better.
very very good restaurant, been here with 3 people, 3 different pizzas and all 3 fingerlicking goood! definitely recommended place!
lisa served me while sitting at the bar and was super welcoming and friendly. we talked for 30 minutes, she was just so sweet!
nice italian food, felt like beeing in a very old fashion italian restaurant, the smell was old too which it was not good to me, the people was gentle and good service.
a little gem. great food in an emblematic place
nothing special, decent food.
true intellectuals go here.

a place to go as a couple. i want to highlight the waiter whose attention and help in choosing our meal was total. on the other hand, the waitress was rude and capable of ruining your meal. luckily we redirected it by meeting the waiter. anecdotes aside, the food is very good and they make a very decent mid-day menu for 27 euros.

ideal. both the food and the desserts are delicious and the place is beautiful. but if i had to highlight something in particular, it would undoubtedly be the service. incredibly friendly and attentive staff always, especially the waiter. all perfect!

italian cuisine restaurant. parking 30 seconds away. they have live music 2 days a week. the service has been very good and fast, they put us on a sofa table and we were very comfortable. the ideal temperature. the a la carte price is around €40-50 per head. i recommend it!

i want to think they had a bad day, because if that's always the case... they brought us starters and drinks. an arugula and parmesan salad that was good, but nothing more. we also ordered melted brie cheese with tomato jam and toasted bread. the amount of jam they serve is the minimum. you can see it in the photo… great, that's why.now, it took them an hour to serve the unique dishes we ordered. one hour. i ordered the dish called “brutal with aum aum sauce”. it consists of a type of large mac
regular food. a little expensive for the quality they offer. the dining room is dark with all the curtains closed. the treatment was good. i wouldn't recommend it.

vintage restaurant specialized in italian cuisine. dishes with good raw materials and tasty. very professional and attentive service. the atmosphere is pleasant but the dining room is somewhat noisy and the piano can barely be heard. you usually see well-known people since it is a restaurant frequented by politicians, journalists, writers and artists. cultural meetings are often held.

emblematic place in barcelona if there is one. it was decades ahead in its design, gastronomic offer, atmosphere and much more. il giardinetto was transgressive in its time and remains so today.each evening is different.meeting of diverse and fun people. some are the most sophisticated, others intellectual... there are also bohemian, posh or alternative ones.of course, it depends on the color, but without a doubt it was and will be one of my favorite places.i can't write this review without nam

the place is an emblematic place in barcelona, ​​the food is good and it is quite an experience (they play the piano live) and the service is very attentive. for a romantic and special celebration it is the ideal place. but i will say that it needs a little renovation (the carpet is older than all the clients combined)
it is quite good, we ate well enough and were well taken care of. the place lives anchored in the past, half a century ago.

i believe that waiters should wear a summer work uniform appropriate to the high temperature in which they must work. regardless of their great professionalism at all times, seeing them dressed in that anachronistic uniform made all of us diners suffer and wonder who was responsible for such an unfortunate decision.

i love the menu formula: two salads, two soups, two pastas, two rice dishes, two fish and two meats. two courses, dessert and coffee included, drink separately. the risotto was ok, it lacked a point of saltiness and the girl didn't bring me parmesan (i got it myself from the next table). very good salmon, decent tiramisu, good coffee and wine. i subtract one star for not having the letter in catalan, what world do these people live in? for this reason i discarded it to celebrate my birthday the
there is a lack of people in the kitchen and waiters. it cannot be that it takes an hour to wait after ordering a menu atnoon. slow, very slow.
very friendly service. very good food but a little expensive. but i advise you to go

what a pity! the place, the maitre d' and the waiters were impeccable, attentive and friendly. the cuisine, as always, is simply tasty, and at a medium-high price. so? well, everything was fantastic if you could have dinner until one at night. il giardinetto is a restaurant at night. during the day it is sad and its curtains look somewhat dingy. at night it is a proper lounge with a certain "démodé" feel with a patina of glamour. now the kitchen opens at 8:30 p.m. and closes at 11:00 p.m. like
very good food. very good service. the very special decoration
excellent food and good service, good attention and especially the salads, a 10, delicious and very good.

the truth is that i don't know if they had a bad day, but a group of us went to dinner and the food had no flavor, it was tasteless and for the price you pay it is not what you expect. i chose the spaghetti aglio e olio with shrimp and the truth is that it tasted almost like nothing and the asparagus ravioli also had almost no flavor.the service would also need to be reinforced, since there was one waiter, sometimes two, and they didn't do everything.it was not worth it for the price we paid. i
what i like most about this place is the decoration. original and fun. the food is very good and so is the service. i recommend the pasta with bay leaf.

i have seen it in some list as perfect for a romantic restaurant, the experience let's say that it was quite the opposite, it is a rather "dirty" place, the carpet is full of dust, the waiters are friendly but their uniforms are quite dirty, the food is fair enough, i don't recommend it for a special night,
a classic ideal for organizing private events
a barcelona classicvery good service and fooda very good place to have a drink
excellent. and an unbeatable environment. the decoration, the food, the service....
large common space on the 1st floor...very kind and attentive..

the only thing i would say against them is that they are very very very slow in their service. although the food is very good.they have few gluten-free dishes and cannot guarantee that there is no cross contamination.they also don't have gluten-free bread.they have gluten-free spaghetti, which has nothing to envy of the normal ones.the cheesecake is gluten-free and is spectacular.
an endearing and elegant place to dine in peace. if you're lucky, you'll be accompanied by live music from an excellent pianist. the delicious food!

terrible value for money. little food and no seasoning at all. the meat arrived very undercooked, when we asked the waiter to cook it a little, he didn't like it, and when he came back with the meat, it was dry, with brownish tones, and still raw... very strange. we left the place and went to eat some fast food.
their pasta with truffle, spaghetti sofia loren and her staff are incredible. a charming restaurant with decoration that evokes a garden
quiet place to dine with spectacular quality.

it is a real privilege to be able to enjoy in this emblematic restaurant, opened in 1973, its original decoration, of course its delicious italian dishes, the mastery of cocktails by mr. ángel and, above all, the pleasant and friendly treatment offered by the waiters and the head of the room. there are things that are good not to change.
very good atmosphere. very good quality of food and cooking. although the quantities are very small. the right pizzas

ouch! the two times i've been there were special occasions and for now i won't repeat. old-fashioned food, old-fashioned waiters (uniform included), suspiciously old velvets..the concept of a low bar? they don't understand each other. it would have to be completely reinvented, i don't know how. it's a shame to waste so much history.
very good food with excellent service from all the staff and especially ángel the maitre d'.recommendable!!
mythical restaurant, where we ate horrible today. €66 per person for unpresentable dishes. we have explained it to the maitre d' and he has accepted it but without any reaction. we have felt cheated😢

we have repeated and it has been worth it. delicious food, meat, bravas and incredible desserts. it makes my mouth water. the waiters are super friendly and attentive, and they serve you in just a few seconds, we didn't have to wait at any time and even though the entire restaurant was full, they are super efficient!

i was eating for the first time at this classic restaurant in barcelona, ​​and i was pleasantly surprised. both for the naturalness of the very well cooked dishes, and for the excellent dedication to service.

we ordered a menu that costs 23 euros and the price-quality is disappointing. the quantities are very small but the worst is the quality. the risotto was very overcooked rice with a little philadelphia and the result was very salty. the same with the penne carbonara, the bacon was a little stale and therefore very salty. the seconds were very mediocre. for that price, ordering the same dishes i would have eaten much better in a neighborhood restaurant. the only thing that was good was the tiram

we had dinner on the tuesday of its reopening! nothing has changed, it continues with the essence of more than 3 decades ago and the comforts of today.we were served by a young waiter, enric, charming and attentive at all times. even in the account he told a story to my son!great food.without a doubt it is still our restaurant in gràcia!

after booking in advance, a group of us had dinner last friday. the place is elegant, cozy and the seats are very comfortable, the attention of the staff is professional, the food at its point was very tasty along with the plating, i congratulate the chef, and the perfection of the moment was watching and listening to the pianist while you enjoy the evening. a privilege and very emotional for everyone. the place is ideal to go in a group or if you prefer to get along with your partner, you will

elegantit is a barcelona classic with an elegant and exclusive atmosphere. it's worth going, even if it's just once. the treatment is very good.the food according to what is expected in a place like this, all very good!!to start as an appetizer i had white butifarra. first, a cold cream of avocado and melon with mint, second, a beef carpaccio with rosemary oil, arugula and parmesan and for dessert, chocolate cake with exquisite english cream!!red wine of very good quality and served at the righ

good restaurant, with a long-time clientele, where the treatment of the staff is its best asset. visit in phase 2, june 2020, where a "breakable" menu offered you a correct menu at a good price accompanied by a small menu of first and second courses. nice roof
the service and attention is good. the level and category of the daily menu has decreased. despite this, a highly recommended place for lunch or dinner and business gatherings.

il giardinetto was born in the 1970s, by the photographer leopoldo pomés, who, after the success of the flash flash tortilleria, embarked on the adventure of creating an italian restaurant and once again, commissioned the project to the architects alfonso milá and federico correa, who won the 1974 fad interior design award.recreate a magical garden inspired by the chestnut trees of the south of francein september 2012, under the direction of poldo pomés, il giardinetto renovated the downstairs

the place is beautiful, and the food is delicious. it was my first time and we will repeat without a doubt. lis took care of us and she was lovely, she advised us very well and she was a sweetheart. 💖

fairly well-known and old place in barcelona, ​​they have lowered the level of the menu a little, the menu remains the same, we have been many times with business food and it is a good place, professional waiters and very good food on the menu

i have a reservation for today and google shows that it is open. but i have gone there and it is closed... no one has told us that it would be closed and the reservation has been made correctly... i called their phone number and no one answers... a shame, i wanted to try it.

i was not surprised at all, the pasta was nothing special, maybe we chose incorrectly. local with decoration from glorious times, with a very efficient service, but the food has remained like the local, old-fashioned.

historic place that has maintained the quality of the product and service.the special decoration made with carpet simulates a garden, giving the restaurant its name.the menu of the day is €24, but the price is well justified given the high quality.the best thing is that there are no tourists.

a different place, great atmosphere, exceptional service.we ordered a starter and a trio of pastas, we didn't quite love this second one. we thought that the quality of the pasta was not up to the "level" of the place. also everything is very good!

excellent starters, pastas and risottos but the meat and fish menu is very brief. the atmosphere is very "demodé", it was decorated in the 80's and that's how it has stayed. the carpet worn over the years. the atmosphere, stale, frequented by clients aged 60 and up, right-wing politicians in low hours and the most crusty barcelona "nobility".
charm, impeccable treatment, loving pianist, delicious dishes. good taste. try their coconut ice cream🤗😋special dinner.

we went on the spur of the moment looking for live music but had no luck (check when there is a piano). although the show is already in the air. it seemed like "vacation at sea", the 80's series... everything was very old fashioned, not to say outdated, but i recommend living the experience, due to the picturesqueness of the place, especially its people. the food is quality... and the price accordingly...
excellent italian restaurant. one of the classics that remain in the limelight.
perfect in everything.to repeat

it is eaten very well. they cook all kinds of food, meats, fish. i really like chocolate mousse. while you wait they give you breadsticks, broken olives and some potatoes with allioli that are delicious. the staff's attention is very good. in the premises, it has two parts: the front part, the quietest, and the interior part is noisier. it is a very simple place. the price is high, but the quality and quantity deserves that price. due to its location, it is difficult to park. it is recommended

local with decoration from the 70s. personally, i liked it. although the duel is carpeted, it is apparently clean. well attended, the waiter, a very correct gentleman, and the waitress, very friendly. i liked the food. a tad expensive
a barcelona classic, retro/romantic.everything is delicious, especially try the cal vives white sausage, charcuterie 😋

the place deserves much more. but the food can be greatly improved. non-italian olives. saladisimos. burrata is a mozzarella. the dish comes out of the refrigerator and you can tell even though neither the cheese nor the tomato are cold lovers. very disappointing. artichoke with egg, the truffle was missing. bestial ricatoni, they returned to the kitchen for overcooking and the reheated sauce with yesterday's flavor. spaghetti sofía loren...... apart from the fact that it was a very fine noodle
a classic and an icon of spectacular restaurants as always, it also has a complete menu for €28 and i want to highlight the staff and the quality-price ratio.
perfect food!!perfect attention!good place... but, a little dark and dangerous steps... the falls at the entrance 💥 could be taken into account... and little by little see how to solve it 😬.
we went to have cocktails. excellent!!!!
a place that we can describe as calm and "selective".it's worth a visit. cups. limited letter with quality.decoration with personality, maintained since its opening.
fairy tale, as always. good quality, professional service and reasonable price. highly recommended. every day is better! congratulations!
the restaurant needs a renovation. it's very dated with that carpet and that decoration.good menu, but the value for money is a little expensive.

very comfortable and avant-garde place with traditional italian cuisine that showcases homemade pasta. their risottos are prepared with great dedication. among their fish, the grilled monkfish with onion compote must be highlighted. their dessert menu is very delicious and varied. excellent service.
the pianist would have to start later. it's not a nightclub. he's going to dinner. the place and the food are good but they could be more updated.

romantic dinner as a couple. we were at ease and well taken care of. although the atmosphere is a bit charged due to the noise. local music thanks to the live piano. food quality and very correct presentation at a reasonable price. the only thing to criticize is the price of our house wines, which i think are too expensive. thank you for this evening giardinetto.

place with a vintage touch, 2 fad interior design awards, it's worth going for a day. a little aristocratic-progressive atmosphere but it also has its point!! super good pasta and the cocktails also very well made and served.

on friday, november 10, we went to dinner with another couple. this time disappointing, completely noisy dining room, groups of people who kept getting up, talking loudly...you couldn't even hear the pianist, it looked like a picnic area. i will never return on a weekend.

il giardinetto restaurant (la granada del penedès, 28), opened in 1974, has become a classic in its area. it is a restaurant of italian and mediterranean cuisine, market and seasonal, with charm and piano music, in a place that at the time won an fad interior design award for its decoration, which recreates a garden. it is also a cocktail bar and cultural and artistic activities take place there. it has an interesting weekday lunch menu at €24, with bread and water included, to which wine and c

il giardinetto is one of those restaurants in barcelona that you have to go to. it has more than 40 years of history and i think it has become a classic. the decoration of the place recreates a vintage garden, very seventies all in all, elegant and with a touch of glamor from other eras. the food is more than good and they have a very good selection of wines. i want to go back as soon as possible.
we will not repeat. very poor quality-price ratio, they don't measure up:- pasta that anyone can make at home with raw materials.- very expensive and low quality desserts- inattentive service

we read that it was a barcelona classic, and you only realize it when you enter. the food is very correct and the pasta very fine. as a drawback, the portions are a bit small for a pasta dish. the rest was all very correct.
